verse	40	1	1	The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the Son of Abraham.
verse	40	1	2	Abraham begot Isaac, and Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot Judah and his brethren.
verse	40	1	3	And Judah begot Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez begot Hezron, and Hezron begot Ram.
verse	40	1	4	And Ram begot Amminadab, and Amminadab begot Nahshon, and Nahshon begot Salmon.
verse	40	1	5	And Salmon begot Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz begot Obed by Ruth, and Obed begot Jesse,
verse	40	1	6	and Jesse begot David the king, and David the king begot Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
verse	40	1	7	And Solomon begot Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begot Abijah, and Abijah begot Asa.
verse	40	1	8	And Asa begot Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat begot Joram, and Joram begot Uzziah,
verse	40	1	9	And Uzziah begot Jotham, and Jotham begot Ahaz, and Ahaz begot Hezekiah.
verse	40	1	10	And Hezekiah begot Manasseh, and Manasseh begot Amon, and Amon begot Josiah.
verse	40	1	11	And Josiah begot Jechoniah and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon.
verse	40	1	12	And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechoniah begot Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel.
verse	40	1	13	And Zerubbabel begot Abiud, and Abiud begot Eliakim, and Eliakim begot Azor.
verse	40	1	14	And Azor begot Zadoc, and Zadoc begot Achim, and Achim begot Eliud.
verse	40	1	15	And Eliud begot Eleazar, and Eleazar begot Matthan, and Matthan begot Jacob.
verse	40	1	16	And Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
verse	40	1	17	So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the carrying away into Babylon to Christ are fourteen generations.
verse	40	1	18	Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened this way: After His mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph before they came together, she was found with child from the Holy Spirit.
verse	40	1	19	Then Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not willing to make her a public example, was minded to put her away privately.
verse	40	1	20	But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take to yourself Mary your wife, because that which is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
verse	40	1	21	And she will bear a Son, and you shall call His name JESUS, because He will save His people from their sins."
verse	40	1	22	So all this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying:
verse	40	1	23	"Behold, a virgin will be with child, and will bear a Son, and they will call His name Immanuel," which being translated is, "God with us."
verse	40	1	24	Then Joseph being raised from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and took to him his wife,
verse	40	1	25	and did not know her until she had brought forth her firstborn Son. And he called His name JESUS.
verse	40	2	1	Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,
verse	40	2	2	saying, "Where is He who has been born King of the Jews? Since we have seen His star in the east and have come to worship Him."
verse	40	2	3	When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verse	40	2	4	And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ would be born.
verse	40	2	5	And they said to him, "In Bethlehem of Judea, because, thus it is written by the prophet:
verse	40	2	6	'And you Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are not the least among the rulers of Judah; because out of you will come a Ruler that will rule My people Israel.'"
verse	40	2	7	Then Herod, when he had privately called the wise men, diligently inquired of them what time the star appeared.
verse	40	2	8	And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and search diligently for the young Child, and when you have found Him, bring back word to me, that I may come and worship Him also."
verse	40	2	9	After they heard the king, they departed; and behold, the star which they had seen in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young Child was.
verse	40	2	10	When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
verse	40	2	11	And when they had come into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary His mother, and fell down, and worshiped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented gifts to Him: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verse	40	2	12	And being warned by God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
verse	40	2	13	Now when they had departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, "Arise, take the young Child and His mother, flee into Egypt, and wait there until I bring you word; because Herod will seek the young Child to destroy Him."
verse	40	2	14	When he arose, he took the young Child and His mother by night and departed into Egypt,
verse	40	2	15	and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, "Out of Egypt I have called My Son."
verse	40	2	16	Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked because of the wise men, was exceedingly angry; and he sent forth and killed all the children who were in Bethlehem and in all of its districts, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men.
verse	40	2	17	Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying:
verse	40	2	18	"A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are no more."
verse	40	2	19	But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
verse	40	2	20	saying, "Arise, and take the young Child and His mother, and go into the land of Israel, because those who sought the young Child's life are dead."
verse	40	2	21	Then he arose, and took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verse	40	2	22	But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in the position of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. However being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the region of Galilee.
verse	40	2	23	And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets, "He will be called a Nazarene."
verse	40	3	1	In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judea,
verse	40	3	2	and saying, "Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is at hand!"
verse	40	3	3	Because, this is he who was spoken of through the prophet Isaiah, saying: "The voice of one shouting in the wilderness: 'Prepare the way of the LORD; make His paths straight.'"
verse	40	3	4	Now John himself was clothed in camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist; and his food was locusts and wild honey.
verse	40	3	5	Then Jerusalem, all Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him
verse	40	3	6	and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
verse	40	3	7	But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, "O generation of vipers! Who has warned you to escape from the wrath to come?
verse	40	3	8	Therefore bear fruits worthy of repentance,
verse	40	3	9	and do not think to say within yourselves, 'we have Abraham as our father.' Because, I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
verse	40	3	10	And even now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree which does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verse	40	3	11	I indeed baptize you with water for repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than me, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
verse	40	3	12	His winnowing fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean His threshing floor, and gather His wheat into the storehouse; but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire."
verse	40	3	13	Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan to be baptized by him.
verse	40	3	14	But John prevented Him, saying, "I need to be baptized by You, and are You coming to me?"
verse	40	3	15	But Jesus answered and said to him, "Permit it to be so now, because it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness." Then he allowed Him.
verse	40	3	16	And when He was baptized, Jesus came up immediately from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to Him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon Him.
verse	40	3	17	And behold a voice from heaven, saying, "This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."
verse	40	4	1	Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
verse	40	4	2	And when He had fasted forty days and forty nights, afterward He was hungry.
verse	40	4	3	Now when the tempter came to Him, he said, "If You are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread."
verse	40	4	4	But He replied and said, "It is written, 'Man will not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God.'"
verse	40	4	5	Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, and set Him on a pinnacle of the temple,
verse	40	4	6	and said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. Because it is written: 'He will give His angels orders concerning You,' and, 'in their hands they will hold You up, lest at any time You strike Your foot against a stone.'"
verse	40	4	7	Jesus said to him, "It is written again, 'You shall not tempt the LORD your God.'"
verse	40	4	8	Again, the devil took Him up onto a very high mountain, and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
verse	40	4	9	And he said to Him, "I will give You all these things, if You will fall down and worship me."
verse	40	4	10	Then Jesus said to Him, "Leave Satan! Because it is written, 'You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only shall you serve.'"
verse	40	4	11	Then the devil left Him, and behold, angels came and ministered to Him.
verse	40	4	12	Now when Jesus had heard that John had been thrown into prison, He departed to Galilee.
verse	40	4	13	And leaving Nazareth, He came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea coast, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verse	40	4	14	that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying:
verse	40	4	15	"The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles:
verse	40	4	16	The people who sat in darkness have seen a great Light, and upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death Light has dawned."
verse	40	4	17	From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, "Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is at hand."
verse	40	4	18	And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; because they were fishermen.
verse	40	4	19	And He said to them, "Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men."
verse	40	4	20	And they immediately left their nets, and followed Him.
verse	40	4	21	And going on from there, He saw two more brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and He called them.
verse	40	4	22	And immediately they left the boat and their father, and followed Him.
verse	40	4	23	Then Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all types of sickness and every kind of disease among the people.
verse	40	4	24	And His fame went throughout all Syria; and they brought to Him every sick person who was afflicted with various diseases and torments, and those who were possessed with demons, those who were insane, and paralytics; and He healed them.
verse	40	4	25	And large crowds of people followed Him from Galilee, and from Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.
verse	40	5	1	And seeing the crowds, He went up on a mountain, and when He was seated His disciples came to Him.
verse	40	5	2	Then He opened His mouth and taught them, saying:
verse	40	5	3	"Blessed are the poor in spirit, because theirs is the kingdom of heaven."
verse	40	5	4	Blessed are those who mourn, because they will be comforted."
verse	40	5	5	Blessed are the meek, because they will inherit the earth."
verse	40	5	6	Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, because they will be filled."
verse	40	5	7	Blessed are the merciful, because they will obtain mercy."
verse	40	5	8	Blessed are the pure in heart, because they will see God."
verse	40	5	9	Blessed are the peacemakers, because they will be called the children of God."
verse	40	5	10	Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness' sake, because theirs is the kingdom of heaven."
verse	40	5	11	"Blessed are you when men revile you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for My sake."
verse	40	5	12	Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, because great is your reward in heaven, because they also persecuted the prophets who were before you."
verse	40	5	13	"You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt has lost its flavor, how will it be salted? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and to be trampled underfoot by men."
verse	40	5	14	"You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden."
verse	40	5	15	Nor do men light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house."
verse	40	5	16	Let your light shine like this before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven."
verse	40	5	17	"Do not think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I did not come to destroy but to fulfill."
verse	40	5	18	Because, truly, I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle will by no means pass from the law, until all is fulfilled."
verse	40	5	19	Whoever therefore breaks one of these least commandments, but teaches men so, he will be called the least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever does and teaches them, they will be called great in the kingdom of heaven."
verse	40	5	20	Because, I say to you, that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will by no means enter into the kingdom of heaven."
verse	40	5	21	"You have heard that it was said by those of old times, 'You shall not murder, and whoever murders will be in danger of the judgment.'"
verse	40	5	22	But I say to you that whoever is angry with his brother without a cause will be in danger of the judgment. And whoever shall say to his brother, 'Raca!' will be in danger of the council. But whoever says, 'You fool!' will be in danger of hell fire."
verse	40	5	23	Therefore if you bring your gift to the altar, and there remember that your brother has something against you,"
verse	40	5	24	leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift."
verse	40	5	25	Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are on the way with him, lest at any time your adversary deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be thrown into prison."
verse	40	5	26	Truly, I say to you, you will by no means come out of there until you have paid the last penny."
verse	40	5	27	"You have heard that it was said by those of old times, 'You shall not commit adultery.'"
verse	40	5	28	But I say to you that whoever looks on a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart."
verse	40	5	29	And if your right eye offends you, pluck it out, and cast it from you; because, it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than your entire body to be thrown into hell."
verse	40	5	30	And if your right hand offends you, cut it off and cast it from you; because, it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, and not that your entire body be cast into hell."
verse	40	5	31	"It has been said, 'whoever puts away his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.'"
verse	40	5	32	But I say to you, that whoever puts away his wife for any reason except sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever marries a woman who is divorced commits adultery."
verse	40	5	33	"Again, you have heard that it has been said to those of old times, 'You shall not swear falsely, but shall perform your oaths to the Lord.'"
verse	40	5	34	But I say to you, do not swear at all: neither by heaven, because it is God's throne;"
verse	40	5	35	nor by the earth, because it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King."
verse	40	5	36	Neither shall you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black."
verse	40	5	37	But let your communication be, 'yes,' 'yes,' or 'no,' 'no.' Because whatever goes beyond these is from evil."
verse	40	5	38	"You have heard that it has been said, 'An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.'"
verse	40	5	39	But I tell you that you should not resist a wicked person. But whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn the other to him also."
verse	40	5	40	And if anyone wants to sue you at the law and take away your coat, let him have your cloak also."
verse	40	5	41	And whoever compels you to go one mile, go two with him."
verse	40	5	42	Give to him who asks you, and from him who wants to borrow from you do not turn away."
verse	40	5	43	"You have heard that it has been said, 'You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.'"
verse	40	5	44	But I say to you, Love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you,"
verse	40	5	45	that you may be the children of your Father who is in heaven; because, He makes His sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust."
verse	40	5	46	Because, if you love those who love you, what reward do you gain? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?"
verse	40	5	47	And if you only greet your brethren, what do you do more than others? Do not even tax collectors do so?"
verse	40	5	48	Therefore be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect."
verse	40	6	1	"Beware that you do not do your charitable deeds in front of men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven."
verse	40	6	2	Therefore, when you do your charitable deeds, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory from men. Truly, I say to you, they have their reward."
verse	40	6	3	But when you do charitable deeds, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,"
verse	40	6	4	that your charitable deeds may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly."
verse	40	6	5	"And when you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites are. Because, they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Truly, I say to you, they have their reward."
verse	40	6	6	But you, when you pray, go into your room, and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly."
verse	40	6	7	But when you pray, do not use vain repetitions, as the heathen do. Because, they think that they will be heard because of their many words."
verse	40	6	8	"Therefore do not be like them. Because, your Father knows the things you have need of before you ask Him."
verse	40	6	9	In this manner, therefore, pray: Our Father who is in heaven, hallowed be Your name."
verse	40	6	10	Your kingdom come. Your will be done, on earth, as it is in heaven."
verse	40	6	11	Give us this day our daily bread."
verse	40	6	12	And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors."
verse	40	6	13	And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Because, Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen."
verse	40	6	14	"Because, if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you."
verse	40	6	15	But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses."
verse	40	6	16	"Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites, with a sad countenance. Because, they disfigure their faces, that they may appear to men to be fasting. Truly, I say to you, they have their reward."
verse	40	6	17	But you, when you fast, anoint your head, and wash your face,"
verse	40	6	18	so that you do not appear to men to be fasting, but to your Father who is in that secret place; and your Father who sees in secret, will reward you openly."
verse	40	6	19	"Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust corrupts, and where thieves break in and steal;"
verse	40	6	20	but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust corrupts, and where thieves do not break in nor steal."
verse	40	6	21	Because, where your treasure is, there will your heart be also."
verse	40	6	22	"The light of the body is the eye. Therefore if your eye is single, your entire body will be full of light."
verse	40	6	23	But if your eye is corrupt, your entire body will be filled with darkness. Therefore if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!"
verse	40	6	24	"No one can serve two masters; because, either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon."
verse	40	6	25	"Therefore I say to you, do not be anxious about your life, what you shall eat or what you shall drink; nor about your body, what you shall put on. Is not this life more than food and the body more than clothing?"
verse	40	6	26	Look at the birds of the air, because, they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of much more value than them?"
verse	40	6	27	Which of you by being anxious can add one cubit to his stature?"
verse	40	6	28	"So why do you worry about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin;"
verse	40	6	29	and yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these."
verse	40	6	30	Now if God clothes the grass of the field like that, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?"
verse	40	6	31	"Therefore do not worry, saying, 'What shall we eat?' or, 'What shall we drink?' or, 'What shall we wear?'"
verse	40	6	32	(Because, the Gentiles seek after all these things.) Because your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things."
verse	40	6	33	But you, seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you."
verse	40	6	34	Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will be concerned for the issues of itself. Sufficient for the day is its own evil."
verse	40	7	1	"Judge not, that you be not judged."
verse	40	7	2	Because, with the judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with the measure you use, it will be measured back to you."
verse	40	7	3	And why do you look at the speck that is in your brother's eye, but do not consider the plank that is in your own eye?"
verse	40	7	4	Or how can you say to your brother, 'Let me remove the speck from your eye'; and behold, a plank is in your own eye?"
verse	40	7	5	You hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye."
verse	40	7	6	"Do not give that which is holy to the dogs; nor cast your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and attack you."
verse	40	7	7	"Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you."
verse	40	7	8	Because, everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him that knocks it will be opened."
verse	40	7	9	Or what man is there among you, who if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?"
verse	40	7	10	Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent?"
verse	40	7	11	If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him?"
verse	40	7	12	Therefore, everything you would like men to do to you, so likewise you do to them, because this is the Law and the Prophets."
verse	40	7	13	"Enter in through the narrow gate; because, the gate is wide and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and there are many who go in through it."
verse	40	7	14	Because, the gate is narrow and the way is narrow that leads to life, and there are few who find it."
verse	40	7	15	"Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves."
verse	40	7	16	You will know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?"
verse	40	7	17	Likewise every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit."
verse	40	7	18	A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit."
verse	40	7	19	Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire."
verse	40	7	20	Therefore by their fruits you will know them."
verse	40	7	21	"Not everyone who says to Me, 'Lord, Lord,' shall enter into the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father who is in heaven."
verse	40	7	22	Many will say to Me in that day, 'Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonderful works in Your name?'"
verse	40	7	23	And then will I declare to them, 'I never knew you; depart from me, you who practice iniquity!'"
verse	40	7	24	"Therefore whoever hears these sayings of Mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man, who built his house on a rock:"
verse	40	7	25	and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house; and it did not fall, because it was founded on a rock."
verse	40	7	26	"But everyone who hears these sayings of Mine, and does not do them, will be likened to a foolish man who built his house on the sand:"
verse	40	7	27	and the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house; and it fell. And great was its fall."
verse	40	7	28	And so it happened, when Jesus had ended these sayings, that the people were astonished at His doctrine,
verse	40	7	29	because, He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
verse	40	8	1	When He had come down from the mountain, large crowds followed Him.
verse	40	8	2	And behold, a leper came and worshiped Him, saying, "Lord, if you are willing, You can make me clean."
verse	40	8	3	And Jesus put out His hand, and touched him, saying, "I am willing; be cleansed." And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verse	40	8	4	And Jesus said to him, "See that you tell no one; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them."
verse	40	8	5	Now when Jesus had entered into Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, pleading with Him,
verse	40	8	6	saying, "Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, afflicted terribly.
verse	40	8	7	And Jesus said to Him, "I will come and heal him."
verse	40	8	8	The centurion replied and said, "Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But only speak a word, and my servant will be healed.
verse	40	8	9	Because, I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this man, 'Go,' and he goes; and to another, 'Come,' and he comes; and to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."
verse	40	8	10	When Jesus heard it, He marveled, and said to those who followed, "Truly I say to you, I have not found such great faith, no, not even in Israel!"

verse	40	13	27	So the servants of the householder came and said to him, 'Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have tares?'"
verse	40	13	28	He said to them, 'An enemy has done this.' The servants said to him, 'Do you want us then to go and gather them up?'"
verse	40	13	29	But he said, 'No, lest while you gather up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them."
verse	40	13	30	Let both grow together until the harvest, and at harvest time I will tell the reapers, "First gather together the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn." '"
verse	40	13	31	He put before them another parable, saying: "The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, that a man took and sowed in his field,"
verse	40	13	32	which indeed is the least of all the seeds; but when it is grown it is greater than the herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches."
verse	40	13	33	He spoke another parable to them: "The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid inside three measures of flour until it was all leavened."
verse	40	13	34	Jesus spoke all these things to the crowds in parables; and He did not speak to them without a parable,
verse	40	13	35	that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying: "I will open My mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret since the foundation of the world."
verse	40	13	36	Then Jesus sent the crowd away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, "Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field."
verse	40	13	37	He replied and said to them: "He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man."
verse	40	13	38	The field is the world, the good seed are the children of the kingdom, but the tares are the children of the wicked one."
verse	40	13	39	The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels."
verse	40	13	40	Therefore as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of this age."
verse	40	13	41	The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that cause offense, and those who practice iniquity,"
verse	40	13	42	and will throw them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth."
verse	40	13	43	Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!"
verse	40	13	44	"Again, the kingdom of Heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which when a man finds, he hides; and for joy over it he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field."
verse	40	13	45	"Again, the kingdom of Heaven is like a merchant man seeking choice pearls,"
verse	40	13	46	who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it."
verse	40	13	47	"Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered some of every kind,"
verse	40	13	48	which, when it was full, they drew to shore; and sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but threw the bad away."
verse	40	13	49	So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come forth, separate the wicked from among the just,"
verse	40	13	50	and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth."
verse	40	13	51	Jesus said to them, "Have you understood all these things?" They said to Him, "Yes, Lord."
verse	40	13	52	Then He said to them, "Therefore every scribe which is instructed concerning the kingdom of heaven is like a man who is a householder who brings out of his treasure things new and old."
verse	40	13	53	Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, that He departed from there.
verse	40	13	54	And when He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, "Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?

verse	40	13	56	And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?"

verse	40	27	1	When the morning came, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put Him to death.

verse	40	27	65	Pilate said to them, "You have a guard; go your way, make it as secure as you can."
verse	40	27	66	So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone and setting the guard.

verse	41	1	1	The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
verse	41	1	2	As it is written in the prophets: "Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, who will prepare Your way before You."
verse	41	1	3	"The voice of one shouting in the wilderness: 'Prepare the way of the LORD; make His paths straight.'"
verse	41	1	4	John came baptizing in the wilderness, and preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
verse	41	1	5	And all the land of Judea, and those from Jerusalem, went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
verse	41	1	6	Now John was clothed with camel's hair and a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
verse	41	1	7	And he preached, saying, "He who comes after me is mightier than me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to stoop down and loose.
verse	41	1	8	I indeed have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit."
verse	41	1	9	And it came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verse	41	1	10	And immediately, coming up from the water, He saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit descending upon Him like a dove.
verse	41	1	11	And there came a voice from heaven, saying, "You are My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."
verse	41	1	12	And immediately the Spirit drove Him into the wilderness.
verse	41	1	13	And He was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered to Him.
verse	41	1	14	Now after John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
verse	41	1	15	and saying, "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent, and believe the gospel."
verse	41	1	16	Now as He walked by the sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea; because they were fishermen.
verse	41	1	17	And Jesus said to them, "Follow after Me, and I will make you become fishers of men."
verse	41	1	18	And immediately they left their nets and followed Him.
verse	41	1	19	And when He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the boat mending their nets.
verse	41	1	20	And immediately He called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after Him.
verse	41	1	21	Then they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day He entered into the synagogue and taught.
verse	41	1	22	And they were astonished at His doctrine, because, He taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.
verse	41	1	23	Now there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit. And he shouted out,
verse	41	1	24	saying, "Leave us alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are, the Holy One of God!"
verse	41	1	25	But Jesus rebuked him, saying, "Be quiet, and come out of him!"
verse	41	1	26	And when the unclean spirit had convulsed him and shouted with a loud voice, he came out of him.
verse	41	1	27	Then they were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, "What is this? What new doctrine is this? Because, with authority He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him."
verse	41	1	28	And immediately His fame spread throughout all the region around Galilee.
verse	41	1	29	Now as soon as they had come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
verse	41	1	30	But Simon's wife's mother lay sick with a fever, and they quickly told Him about her.
verse	41	1	31	So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she ministered to them.
verse	41	1	32	And at evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were demon possessed.
verse	41	1	33	And the entire city was gathered together at the door.
verse	41	1	34	And He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He did not permit the demons to speak, because they knew Him.
verse	41	1	35	Now in the morning, having risen a long while before daylight, He went out and departed to an isolated place, and prayed there.
verse	41	1	36	And Simon and those who were with Him searched for Him.
verse	41	1	37	And when they had found Him, they said to Him, "Everyone is looking for You."
verse	41	1	38	And He said to them, "Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there as well, because for this purpose I have come forth."
verse	41	1	39	And He preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out demons.
verse	41	1	40	Now a leper came to Him, begging Him, kneeling down to Him and saying to Him, "If You are willing, You can make me clean."
verse	41	1	41	Then Jesus, moved with compassion, stretched out His hand, and touched him, and said to him, "I am willing; be cleansed."
verse	41	1	42	And as soon as He had spoken, immediately the leprosy left him, and he was cleansed.
verse	41	1	43	And He strictly warned him and immediately sent him away,
verse	41	1	44	and said to him, "See that you say nothing to anyone; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing those things which Moses commanded, as a testimony to them."
verse	41	1	45	However, he went out and began to proclaim it freely, and to spread the matter abroad, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter into the city, but was outside in deserted places; and they came to Him from every direction.
verse	41	2	1	And after a few days He entered into Capernaum again, and it was told that He was in the house.
verse	41	2	2	And immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no room to receive them, not even near the door. And He preached the word to them.
verse	41	2	3	Then they came to Him, bringing a paralytic who was carried by four men.
verse	41	2	4	And when they could not come near to Him because of the crowd, they uncovered the roof where He was. So when they had broken through, they let down the bed upon which the paralytic was lying.
verse	41	2	5	When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, "Son, your sins are forgiven you."
verse	41	2	6	However some of the scribes were sitting there and reasoning in their hearts,
verse	41	2	7	"Why does this Man speak blasphemies like this? Who can forgive sins but God alone?"
verse	41	2	8	But immediately, when Jesus perceived in His spirit that they reasoned like this within themselves, He said to them, "Why do you reason these things in your hearts?"
verse	41	2	9	Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, 'Your sins are forgiven you,' or to say, 'Arise, take up your bed and walk'?"
verse	41	2	10	But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins," He said to the paralytic,
verse	41	2	11	"I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house."
verse	41	2	12	And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went out in front of them all, so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, "We never saw anything like this!"
verse	41	2	13	Then He went out again by the sea; and all the crowds came to Him, and He taught them.
verse	41	2	14	And as He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office, and said to him, "Follow Me." And he arose and followed Him.
verse	41	2	15	Now it happened, as Jesus was dining in Levi's house, that many tax collectors and sinners also sat together with Jesus and His disciples; because there were many, and they followed Him.
verse	41	2	16	And when the scribes and Pharisees saw Him eating with tax collectors and sinners, they said to His disciples, "How come He eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?"
verse	41	2	17	When Jesus heard it, He said to them, "Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance."
verse	41	2	18	And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast. Then they came and said to Him, "Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?"
verse	41	2	19	And Jesus said to them, "Can the children of the bridechamber fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them they cannot fast."
verse	41	2	20	But the days will come, when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days."
verse	41	2	21	And no one sews a piece of new cloth on old clothing; or else the new piece that took its place rips away from the old, and the tear is made worse."
verse	41	2	22	And no one puts new grape juice into old wineskins; or else the new grape juice bursts the wineskins, the grape juice is spilled, and the wineskins are ruined. But new grape juice must be put into new wineskins."
verse	41	2	23	Now it happened that He went through the grainfields on the Sabbath day; and as they went His disciples began to pluck the heads of grain.
verse	41	2	24	And the Pharisees said to Him, "Look, why do they do what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?"
verse	41	2	25	But He said to them, "Have you never read what David did when he had need and was hungry, he and those who were with him:"
verse	41	2	26	how he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the showbread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and also gave some to those who were with him?"
verse	41	2	27	And He said to them, "The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath."
verse	41	2	28	Therefore the Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath."
verse	41	3	1	And He entered into the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a withered hand.
verse	41	3	2	So they watched Him, whether He would heal him on the Sabbath day, so that they might accuse Him.
verse	41	3	3	And He said to the man who had the withered hand, "Stand in the midst."
verse	41	3	4	Then He said to them, "Is it lawful on the Sabbath days to do good or to do evil, to save life, or to kill?" But they kept silent.
verse	41	3	5	And when He had looked around at them with anger, being grieved because of the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
verse	41	3	6	Then the Pharisees went out and immediately took counsel with the Herodians against Him, how they might destroy Him.
verse	41	3	7	But Jesus withdrew Himself with His disciples to the sea. And a large crowd from Galilee and from Judea followed Him,
verse	41	3	8	also from Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond the Jordan; and those from Tyre and Sidon, when they heard about the many things He was doing, a large crowd came to Him.
verse	41	3	9	So He told His disciples that a small boat should be kept ready for Him because of the crowd, lest they should swarm Him,
verse	41	3	10	because, He had healed many, so that as many as had afflictions swarmed about Him to touch Him.
verse	41	3	11	And unclean spirits, whenever they saw Him, fell down before Him and shouted out, saying, "You are the Son of God."
verse	41	3	12	But He warned them strictly that they should not make Him known.
verse	41	3	13	And He went up on a mountain and called to Him those whom He wanted. And they came to Him.
verse	41	3	14	Then He ordained twelve, that they might be with Him and that He might send them out to preach,
verse	41	3	15	and to have power to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:
verse	41	3	16	And Simon He surnamed Peter;
verse	41	3	17	James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, to whom He surnamed Boanerges, which is, "The Sons of Thunder";
verse	41	3	18	Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananite;
verse	41	3	19	and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him. And they went into a house.
verse	41	3	20	And the crowd came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
verse	41	3	21	But when His friends heard about this, they went out to lay hold of Him, because they said, "He is out of His mind."
verse	41	3	22	And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, "He has Beelzebub," and "By the ruler of the demons He casts out demons."
verse	41	3	23	So He called them to Himself and said to them in parables: "How can Satan cast out Satan?"
verse	41	3	24	And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand."
verse	41	3	25	And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand."
verse	41	3	26	And if Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he cannot stand, but has an end."
verse	41	3	27	No one can enter into a strong man's house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man. And then he shall plunder his house."
verse	41	3	28	"Truly, I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they may speak;"
verse	41	3	29	but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation,"
verse	41	3	30	because they said, "He has an unclean spirit."
verse	41	3	31	Then His brethren and His mother came, and standing outside they sent to Him, calling Him.
verse	41	3	32	And the crowd sat around Him; and they said to Him, "Look, Your mother and Your brethren are outside seeking You."
verse	41	3	33	But He replied to them, saying, "Who is My mother, or My brethren?"
verse	41	3	34	And He looked around at those who sat about Him, and said, "Behold My mother and My brethren!"
verse	41	3	35	Because, whoever does the will of God is My brother and My sister and mother."
verse	41	4	1	And again He began to teach by the sea side. And a large crowd was gathered to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat in it on the sea. Then the entire crowd was by the sea on the land.
verse	41	4	2	Then He taught them many things by parables, and said to them in His doctrine:
verse	41	4	3	"Listen! Behold, a sower went out to sow."
verse	41	4	4	And it happened, as he sowed, some fell by the wayside, and the birds of the air came and devoured it."
verse	41	4	5	And some fell on stony ground, where it did not have much earth; and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of earth."
verse	41	4	6	But when the sun was up it was scorched, and because it had no root it withered away."
verse	41	4	7	And some fell among thorns; and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit."
verse	41	4	8	But the other fell on good ground, and yielded fruit that sprang up, increased, and produced: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred."
verse	41	4	9	And He said to them, "He who has ears to hear, let him hear."
verse	41	4	10	But when He was alone, those around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable.
verse	41	4	11	And He said to them, "To you it has been given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God; but to those who are outside, all these things come in parables,"
verse	41	4	12	so that 'Seeing they may see and not perceive, and hearing they may hear and not understand; lest they should be converted at any time, and their sins be forgiven them.'"
verse	41	4	13	And He said to them, "Do you not understand this parable? How then shall you understand all the parables?"
verse	41	4	14	The sower sows the word."
verse	41	4	15	And these are those by the wayside where the word is sown. But when they have heard, Satan comes immediately and takes away the word that was sown in their hearts."
verse	41	4	16	And likewise these are those which are sown on stony ground who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;"
verse	41	4	17	but they have no root in themselves, and so endure only for a time. Afterward, when affliction or persecution arises for the word's sake, immediately they stumble."
verse	41	4	18	Now these are the ones sown among thorns; those who hear the word,"
verse	41	4	19	but the cares of this world, the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful."
verse	41	4	20	But these are they which are sown on good ground, those who hear the word, receive it, and bear fruit: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred."
verse	41	4	21	And He said to them, "Is a lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Is it not to be set on a lampstand?"
verse	41	4	22	Because, there is nothing hidden which will not be revealed, nor has anything been kept secret but that it should come to light."
verse	41	4	23	If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear."
verse	41	4	24	Then He said to them, "Take heed what you hear. With the same measure you use, it will be measured to you; and to you who hear, more will be given."
verse	41	4	25	Because, whoever has, to him more will be given; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him."
verse	41	4	26	And He said, "The kingdom of God is like as if a man should scatter seed on the ground,"
verse	41	4	27	and should sleep by night and rise by day, and the seed should sprout and grow, he himself does not know how."
verse	41	4	28	Because, the earth yields crops from itself: first the blade, then the head, after that the full grain in the head."
verse	41	4	29	So when the grain ripens, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come."
verse	41	4	30	Then He said, "To what shall we liken the kingdom of God? Or with what comparison shall we compare it?"
verse	41	4	31	It is like a grain of mustard seed which, when it is sown on the ground, is smaller than all the seeds that are in the earth;"
verse	41	4	32	but when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all herbs, and shoots out large branches, so that the birds of the air may nest under its shade."
verse	41	4	33	And with many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.
verse	41	4	34	But He did not speak to them without a parable. And when they were alone, He expounded all things to His disciples.
verse	41	4	35	And the same day, when evening had come, He said to them, "Let us cross over to the other side."
verse	41	4	36	Now when they had sent the crowd away, they took Him in the boat just as He was. And there were also with Him other little boats.
verse	41	4	37	And a large windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already full.
verse	41	4	38	But He was in the back of the boat, asleep on a pillow. And they awoke Him and said to Him, "Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?"
verse	41	4	39	Then He arose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, "Peace, be still!" And the wind ceased and there was a great calm.
verse	41	4	40	But He said to them, "Why are you so fearful? How is it that you have no faith?"
verse	41	4	41	And they feared exceedingly, and said to one another, "What type of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey Him!"
verse	41	5	1	Then they came over to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
verse	41	5	2	And when He had come out of the boat, immediately there met Him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
verse	41	5	3	who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no one could bind him, not even with chains,
verse	41	5	4	because he had often been bound with shackles and chains. And the chains had been pulled apart by him, and the shackles broken in pieces; neither could anyone tame him.
verse	41	5	5	And night and day he was always in the mountains and in the tombs, yelling out and cutting himself with stones.
verse	41	5	6	When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and worshiped Him.
verse	41	5	7	And he shouted out with a loud voice and said, "What have I to do with You, Jesus, You Son of the Most High God? I beg You by God that You do not torment me."
verse	41	5	8	Because He said to him, "Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!"
verse	41	5	9	Then He asked him, "What is your name?" And he answered, saying, "My name is Legion; because, we are many."
verse	41	5	10	And he begged Him earnestly that He would not send them out of the country.
verse	41	5	11	Now a large herd of swine was feeding there near the mountains.
verse	41	5	12	And all the demons begged Him, saying, "Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them."
verse	41	5	13	And immediately Jesus gave them permission. Then the unclean spirits went out and entered into the swine (there were about two thousand); and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and drowned in the sea.
verse	41	5	14	And those who fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that had happened.
verse	41	5	15	Then they came to Jesus, and saw the one who had been demon possessed and had the legion, sitting and clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
verse	41	5	16	And those who saw it told them how it happened to him who had been demon possessed, and also concerning the swine.
verse	41	5	17	Then they began to plead with Him to depart from their region.
verse	41	5	18	And when He got into the boat, he who had been demon possessed begged Him that he might be with Him.
verse	41	5	19	However, Jesus did not permit him, but said to him, "Go home to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how He has had compassion on you."
verse	41	5	20	And he departed and began to proclaim in Decapolis all the great things that Jesus had done for him; and everyone marveled.
verse	41	5	21	Now when Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, many people gathered to Him; and He was near the sea.
verse	41	5	22	And behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue came, Jairus by name. And when he saw Him, he fell at His feet
verse	41	5	23	and begged Him earnestly, saying, "My little daughter lies at the point of death. I beg you, come and lay Your hands on her, that she may be healed, and she will live."
verse	41	5	24	So Jesus went with him, and a large crowd followed Him and swarmed Him.
verse	41	5	25	Now a certain woman had a flow of blood for twelve years,
verse	41	5	26	and had suffered many things from many physicians. She had spent all that she had and was no better, but rather grew worse.
verse	41	5	27	When she heard about Jesus, she came behind Him in the crowd and touched His clothes.
verse	41	5	28	Because, she said, "If only I may touch His clothes, I will be made well."
verse	41	5	29	And immediately the fountain of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the affliction.
verse	41	5	30	And Jesus, immediately knowing in Himself that virtue had gone out of Him, turned around in the crowd and said, "Who touched My clothes?"
verse	41	5	31	But His disciples said to Him, "You see the crowd swarming You, and You say, 'Who touched Me?'"
verse	41	5	32	And He looked around to see her who had done this thing.
verse	41	5	33	But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth.
verse	41	5	34	And He said to her, "Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction."
verse	41	5	35	While He was still speaking, there came some from the ruler of the synagogue's house who said, "Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?"
verse	41	5	36	As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, He said to the ruler of the synagogue, "Do not be afraid; only believe."
verse	41	5	37	And He permitted no one to follow Him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.
verse	41	5	38	Then He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw the tumult and those who wept and wailed loudly.
verse	41	5	39	And when He came in, He said to them, "Why make this commotion and weep? The girl is not dead, but sleeping."
verse	41	5	40	And they ridiculed Him. But when He had put them all outside, He took the father and the mother of the child, and those who were with Him, and entered where the girl was lying.
verse	41	5	41	Then He took the girl by the hand, and said to her, "Talitha, cumi," which is translated, "Little girl, I say to you, arise."
verse	41	5	42	And immediately the girl arose and walked, because, she was twelve years of age. And they were overcome with great astonishment.
verse	41	5	43	But He commanded them strictly that no one should know it, and commanded that something should be given her to eat.
verse	41	6	1	Then He went out from there and came into His own country, and His disciples followed Him.
verse	41	6	2	And when the Sabbath day had come, He began to teach in the synagogue. And many hearing Him were astonished, saying, "Where did this Man get these things? And what wisdom is this which is given to Him, that even such mighty works are performed by His hands?
verse	41	6	3	Is this not the carpenter, the Son of Mary, and the brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And are not His sisters here with us?" So they were offended at Him.
verse	41	6	4	But Jesus said to them, "A prophet is not without honor except in his own country, among his own relatives, and in his own house."
verse	41	6	5	Now He could do no mighty work there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
verse	41	6	6	And He marveled because of their unbelief. Then He went around about the villages teaching.
verse	41	6	7	And He called the twelve to Himself, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them power over unclean spirits.
verse	41	6	8	And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey except only a staff, no bag, no bread, no money in their money belts;
verse	41	6	9	but to wear sandals, and not put on two coats.
verse	41	6	10	He also said to them, "In whatever place you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from that place."
verse	41	6	11	And whoever will not receive you nor hear you, when you depart from there, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Truly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!"
verse	41	6	12	So they went out, and preached that people should repent.
verse	41	6	13	And they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many who were sick, and healed them.
verse	41	6	14	Now King Herod heard of Him, because His name had become well known. And he said, "That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore these mighty works are at work in him."
verse	41	6	15	Others said, "It is Elijah." And others said, "It is a prophet, or like one of the prophets."
verse	41	6	16	But when Herod heard of it, he said, "This is John, whom I beheaded; he has risen from the dead."
verse	41	6	17	Because, Herod himself had sent out and laid hold of John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife; because he had married her.
verse	41	6	18	Because John had said to Herod, "It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife."
verse	41	6	19	Therefore Herodias had this disagreement with him, and wanted to kill him, but she could not;
verse	41	6	20	because, Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and protected him. And when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
verse	41	6	21	Then when a convenient day came that Herod on his birthday gave a feast for his nobles, high officers, and chief men of Galilee.
verse	41	6	22	And when Herodias' daughter herself came in and danced, and pleased Herod and those who sat with him, the king said to the girl, "Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you."
verse	41	6	23	He also swore to her, "Whatever you will ask me, I will give it to you, up to half of my kingdom."
verse	41	6	24	So she went out, and said to her mother, "What should I ask?" And she said, "The head of John the Baptist!"
verse	41	6	25	And swiftly she came in immediately to the king and asked, saying, "I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter at once."
verse	41	6	26	And the king was exceedingly sorry; yet because of his oath and because of those who sat with him, he did not want to refuse her.
verse	41	6	27	So immediately the king sent an executioner and commanded his head to be brought. And he went and beheaded him in the prison,
verse	41	6	28	brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl; and the girl gave it to her mother.
verse	41	6	29	And when his disciples heard of it, they came and took away his corpse and laid it in a tomb.
verse	41	6	30	Then the apostles gathered together to Jesus and told Him everything, both what they had done and what they had taught.

verse	41	6	40	So they sat down in ranks, in hundreds and in fifties.

verse	41	6	42	So they all ate and were filled.
verse	41	6	43	And they took up twelve baskets full of fragments and of the fish.

verse	41	7	1	Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes came together to Him, having come from Jerusalem.
verse	41	7	2	Now when they saw some of His disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, with unwashed hands, they found fault.
verse	41	7	3	Because, the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands often, holding the tradition of the elders.
verse	41	7	4	And when they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other things which they have received to embrace, like the washing of cups, pots, copper vessels, and couches.
verse	41	7	5	Then the Pharisees and scribes asked Him, "Why do Your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?"
verse	41	7	6	He answered and said to them, "Rightly has Isaiah prophesied of you hypocrites as it is written: 'This people honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me."

verse	41	7	8	Because laying aside the commandment of God, you embrace the tradition of men, like the washing of pots and cups, and many other such things you do."
verse	41	7	9	And He said to them, "All too well you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your own tradition."
verse	41	7	10	Because, Moses said, 'Honor your father and your mother'; and, 'He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death.'"

verse	41	7	12	then you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother,"
verse	41	7	13	making the word of God of no effect through your tradition which you have handed down. And many such things you do."
verse	41	7	14	And when He had called all the people to Himself, He said to them, "Hear Me, everyone of you, and understand:"
verse	41	7	15	There is nothing that enters a man from outside which can defile him; but the things which come out of him, those are the things that defile a man."

verse	41	7	17	And when He had entered a house away from the people, His disciples asked Him concerning the parable.
verse	41	7	18	So He said to them, "Are you likewise without understanding also? Do you not perceive that whatever enters a man from outside cannot defile him,"
verse	41	7	19	because, it does not enter his heart but the stomach, and goes out into the drain, thus purging all foods?"
verse	41	7	20	And He said, "That which comes out of a man, that defiles a man."
verse	41	7	21	Because, from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,"
verse	41	7	22	thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, perversion, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness."

verse	41	7	29	Then He said to her, "Because of this saying go your way; the demon has gone out of your daughter."
verse	41	7	30	And when she had come to her house, she found the demon gone out, and her daughter lying upon the bed.

verse	41	11	11	And Jesus entered into Jerusalem and into the temple. So when He had looked around at all things, as the hour was already late, He went out to Bethany with the twelve.
verse	41	11	12	Now the next day, when they had come out from Bethany, He was hungry.
verse	41	11	13	And seeing from afar a fig tree having leaves, He went to see if perhaps He would find something on it. And when He came to it, He found nothing but leaves, because it was not yet the season for figs.
verse	41	11	14	And Jesus responded and said to it, "Let no one eat fruit from you ever again." And His disciples heard it.
verse	41	11	15	Then they came to Jerusalem. And Jesus went into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves.
verse	41	11	16	And He would not permit anyone to carry any vessel through the temple.
verse	41	11	17	Then He taught, saying to them, "Is it not written, 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations'? But you have made it a 'den of thieves.'"
verse	41	11	18	And the scribes and chief priests heard it and sought how they might destroy Him; because they feared Him, as all the people were astonished at His doctrine.
verse	41	11	19	And when evening had come, He went out of the city.
verse	41	11	20	Now in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
verse	41	11	21	And Peter, remembering, said to Him, "Teacher, look! The fig tree which You cursed has withered away."
verse	41	11	22	So Jesus replied and said to them, "Have faith in God."
verse	41	11	23	Because, truly, I say to you, whoever shall say to this mountain, 'Be removed and be cast into the sea,' and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that those things he says will come to pass, he will have whatever he says."
verse	41	11	24	Therefore I say to you, whatever things you desire when you pray, believe that you receive them, and you will have them."
verse	41	11	25	"And whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive, that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses."
verse	41	11	26	But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your trespasses."
verse	41	11	27	Then they came again to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to Him.
verse	41	11	28	And they said to Him, "By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority to do these things?"
verse	41	11	29	But Jesus answered and said to them, "I also will ask you one question; then answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things:"
verse	41	11	30	The baptism of John, was it from heaven or from men? Answer Me."
verse	41	11	31	And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "If we shall say, 'From heaven,' He will say, 'Why then did you not believe him?'
verse	41	11	32	But if we say, 'From men,'" they feared the people, because, everyone counted John to have been a prophet indeed.
verse	41	11	33	So they answered and said to Jesus, "We cannot tell." And Jesus replied and said to them, "Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things."
verse	41	12	1	Then He began to speak to them in parables: "A certain man planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it, dug a place for the grape juice vat and built a tower. And he leased it to vinedressers and went into a far country."
verse	41	12	2	Now when the season came he sent a servant to the vinedressers, that he might receive some of the fruit of the vineyard from the vinedressers."
verse	41	12	3	And they took him and beat him and sent him away empty handed."
verse	41	12	4	So, again he sent them another servant, and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated."
verse	41	12	5	And again he sent another, and him they killed; and many others, beating some and killing some."
verse	41	12	6	Therefore still having one son, his dearly beloved, he also sent him to them last, saying, 'They shall reverence my son.'"
verse	41	12	7	But those vinedressers said among themselves, 'This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.'"
verse	41	12	8	So they took him and killed him and cast him out of the vineyard."
verse	41	12	9	"Therefore what shall the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the vinedressers, and give the vineyard to others."
verse	41	12	10	Have you not even read this Scripture: 'The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone."
verse	41	12	11	This was the LORD'S doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?"
verse	41	12	12	And they sought to lay hands on Him, but feared the people, because, they knew that He had spoken the parable against them. So they left Him and went their way.
verse	41	12	13	Then they sent to Him some of the Pharisees and the Herodians, to catch Him in His words.
verse	41	12	14	When they had come, they said to Him, "Teacher, we know that You are true, and esteem no one; because, You do not regard the person of men, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
verse	41	12	15	Should we give, or should we not give?" But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, "Why do you test Me? Bring Me a denarius that I may see it."
verse	41	12	16	So they brought it. And He said to them, "Whose image and inscription is this?" They said to Him, "Caesar's."
verse	41	12	17	And Jesus replied and said to them, "Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's." And they marveled at Him.
verse	41	12	18	Then some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him; and they asked Him, saying:
verse	41	12	19	"Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man's brother dies, and leaves his wife behind, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
verse	41	12	20	Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife; and dying, he left no offspring.
verse	41	12	21	And the second took her, and he died; nor did he leave any offspring. And the third likewise.
verse	41	12	22	So the seven had her and left no offspring. Last of all the woman died also.
verse	41	12	23	Therefore, in the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife shall she be? Because all seven had her as wife."
verse	41	12	24	Jesus answered and said to them, "Are you not in error because of this, because, you do not know the Scriptures nor the power of God?"
verse	41	12	25	Because, when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like the angels who are in heaven."
verse	41	12	26	But concerning the dead, that they rise, have you not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spoke to him, saying, 'I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob'?"
verse	41	12	27	He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. You are greatly in error because of this."
verse	41	12	28	Then one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, perceiving that He had answered them well, asked Him, "Which is the first commandment of all?"
verse	41	12	29	And Jesus answered him, "The first of all the commandments is: 'Hear, O Israel, the LORD our God is one LORD."
verse	41	12	30	And you shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.' This is the first commandment."
verse	41	12	31	And the second is similar, being this: 'You shall love your neighbor as yourself.' There is no other commandment greater than these."
verse	41	12	32	So the scribe said to Him, "Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth, because there is one God, and there is no other but He.
verse	41	12	33	And to love Him with all the heart, with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one's neighbor as oneself, is more than all of the entire burnt offerings and sacrifices."
verse	41	12	34	Now when Jesus saw that he responded wisely, He said to him, "You are not far from the kingdom of God." But after that no one dared ask Him any questions.
verse	41	12	35	Then Jesus responded and said, while He taught in the temple, "How is it that the scribes say that Christ is the Son of David?"
verse	41	12	36	Because David himself said by the Holy Spirit: 'The LORD said to my Lord, "Sit at My right hand, until I make Your enemies Your footstool." '
verse	41	12	37	Therefore David himself calls Him 'Lord'; how is He then his Son?" And the common people heard Him gladly.
verse	41	12	38	Then He said to them in His doctrine, "Beware of the scribes, who desire to go around in long robes, love greetings in the marketplaces,"
verse	41	12	39	the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts,"
verse	41	12	40	who devour widows' houses, and for an exhibition make long prayers. These will receive greater damnation."
verse	41	12	41	Now Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. And many who were rich put in much.
verse	41	12	42	Then one poor widow came and threw in two mites, which make a quadrans.
verse	41	12	43	So He called His disciples to Himself and said to them, "Truly, I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than all those who have given into the treasury;"
verse	41	12	44	because, they all put in out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in all that she had, even her entire livelihood."
verse	41	13	1	Then as He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, "Teacher, see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!"
verse	41	13	2	And Jesus replied and said to him, "Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left upon another, that will not be thrown down."
verse	41	13	3	Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately,

verse	41	13	7	But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be troubled; because, such things must happen, but the end will not be yet."

verse	41	13	15	Let him who is on the housetop not go down into the house, nor enter into it to take anything out of his house."
verse	41	13	16	And let him who is in the field not turn back again to get his clothes."

verse	41	13	28	"Now learn this parable from the fig tree: When its branch has already become tender, and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near."
verse	41	13	29	So you also, when you see these things come to pass, know that it is near, even at the doors!"

verse	41	13	36	lest, coming suddenly, he find you sleeping."
verse	41	13	37	And what I say to you, I say to all: Watch!"
verse	41	14	1	After two days it was the Feast of the Passover and of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take Him by deception and put Him to death.

verse	41	15	1	Then immediately, in the morning, the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the entire council; and they bound Jesus, led Him away, and delivered Him to Pilate.
