verse	41	15	28	So the Scripture was fulfilled which says, "And He was numbered with the transgressors."
verse	41	15	29	And those who passed by ridiculed Him, shaking their heads and saying, "Aha! You who destroys the temple and builds it in three days,
verse	41	15	30	save Yourself, and come down from the cross!"
verse	41	15	31	Likewise the chief priests also, mocking among themselves with the scribes, said, "He saved others; He cannot save Himself.
verse	41	15	32	Let Christ, the King of Israel, descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe." Even those who were crucified with Him reviled Him.
verse	41	15	33	Now when the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the entire land until the ninth hour.
verse	41	15	34	And at the ninth hour Jesus shouted out with a loud voice, saying, "Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?" which is translated, "My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?"
verse	41	15	35	And when they heard that, some of those who stood by said, "Behold, He is calling for Elijah!"
verse	41	15	36	Then someone ran and filled a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and offered it to Him to drink, saying, "Let Him alone; let us see if Elijah will come to take Him down."
verse	41	15	37	And Jesus shouted out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.
verse	41	15	38	Then the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
verse	41	15	39	So when the centurion, who stood opposite Him, saw that He shouted out like this and gave up the spirit, he said, "Truly this Man was the Son of God!"
verse	41	15	40	There were also women looking on from afar, among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joses, and Salome,
verse	41	15	41	who also followed Him and ministered to Him when He was in Galilee, and many other women who came up with Him to Jerusalem.
verse	41	15	42	Now when evening had come, because it was the Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
verse	41	15	43	Joseph of Arimathea, an honorable council member, who also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly to Pilate and sought the body of Jesus.
verse	41	15	44	Pilate marveled that He was already dead; and summoning the centurion to him, he asked him if He had been dead for some time.
verse	41	15	45	So when he knew it from the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
verse	41	15	46	Then he bought fine linen, took Him down, and wrapped Him in the linen. And he laid Him in a tomb which had been cut out of the rock, and rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verse	41	15	47	And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses observed where He was laid.
verse	41	16	1	Now when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint Him.
verse	41	16	2	And very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb at the rising of the sun.
verse	41	16	3	And they said among themselves, "Who shall roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?"
verse	41	16	4	But when they looked, they saw that the stone had been rolled away, because, it was very large.
verse	41	16	5	And entering the tomb, they saw a young man clothed in a long white robe sitting on the right side; and they were afraid.
verse	41	16	6	But he said to them, "Do not be afraid. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen! He is not here. Behold the place where they laid Him.
verse	41	16	7	But go your way, tell His disciples, and Peter, that He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him, as He said to you."
verse	41	16	8	So they went out quickly and fled from the tomb, because they trembled and were astonished. And they said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
verse	41	16	9	Now when Jesus was risen early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven demons.
verse	41	16	10	And she went and told those who had been with Him, as they mourned and wept.
verse	41	16	11	And when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe.
verse	41	16	12	After that, He appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country.
verse	41	16	13	And they went and told it to the rest, but they did not believe them either.
verse	41	16	14	Later He appeared to the eleven as they sat at the table; and He rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen Him after He had risen.
verse	41	16	15	And He said to them, "Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature."
verse	41	16	16	He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who does not believe will be damned."
verse	41	16	17	And these signs will follow those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new tongues;"
verse	41	16	18	they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will not hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover."
verse	41	16	19	So then, after the Lord had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.
verse	41	16	20	And they went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word through the signs following them. Amen.
verse	42	1	1	In as much as many have taken in hand to arrange in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,
verse	42	1	2	just as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word delivered them to us,
verse	42	1	3	it seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus,
verse	42	1	4	that you may know the certainty of those things in which you were instructed.
verse	42	1	5	There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah, and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verse	42	1	6	And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
verse	42	1	7	But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both now well advanced in years.
verse	42	1	8	And it came to pass, that while he was serving in the priest's office before God in the order of his division,
verse	42	1	9	according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot fell to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
verse	42	1	10	And the entire crowd of the people were praying outside at the time of incense.
verse	42	1	11	Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verse	42	1	12	And when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
verse	42	1	13	But the angel said to him, "Do not fear, Zacharias, because your prayer is heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will call his name John.
verse	42	1	14	And you will have joy and happiness and many will rejoice at his birth.
verse	42	1	15	Because, he will be great in the sight of the Lord and will drink neither grape juice nor strong drink. And he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother's womb.
verse	42	1	16	And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.
verse	42	1	17	He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, 'to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,' and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord."
verse	42	1	18	And Zacharias said to the angel, "How shall I know this? Because, I am an old man, and my wife well advanced in years."
verse	42	1	19	And the angel answered and said to him, "I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and to show you these glad tidings.
verse	42	1	20	But behold, you will be mute and not able to speak until the day that these things will take place, because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time."
verse	42	1	21	And the people waited for Zacharias and marveled that he lingered so long in the temple.
verse	42	1	22	But when he came out, he could not speak to them; and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, because he beckoned to them and remained speechless.
verse	42	1	23	So it was, as soon as the days of his service were completed, he departed to his own house.
verse	42	1	24	Now after those days his wife Elizabeth conceived; and hid herself five months, saying,
verse	42	1	25	"Thus the Lord has dealt with me, in the days when He looked upon me, to take away my dishonor among men."
verse	42	1	26	Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
verse	42	1	27	to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. And the virgin's name was Mary.
verse	42	1	28	And the angel went in to her presence and said, "Rejoice, you who are highly favored, the Lord is with you; blessed are you among women!"
verse	42	1	29	But when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying and considered what manner of greeting this was.
verse	42	1	30	Then the angel said to her, "Do not fear, Mary, because you have found favor with God.
verse	42	1	31	And behold, you will conceive in your womb and bring forth a Son, and will call His name JESUS.
verse	42	1	32	He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Highest; and the Lord God will give to Him the throne of His father David.
verse	42	1	33	And He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of His kingdom there will be no end."
verse	42	1	34	Then Mary said to the angel, "How can this be, since I do not know a man?"
verse	42	1	35	And the angel answered and said to her, "The Holy Spirit will come upon you and the power of the Highest will overshadow you; therefore, also, that Holy One who will be born of you will be called the Son of God.
verse	42	1	36	Now behold, Elizabeth your relative has also conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month for her, who was called barren.
verse	42	1	37	Because with God nothing will be impossible."
verse	42	1	38	Then Mary said, "Behold the maidservant of the Lord! Let it be to me according to your word." And the angel departed from her.
verse	42	1	39	Mary arose in those days and hurried into the hill country, into a city of Judah,
verse	42	1	40	and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.
verse	42	1	41	And it happened, when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verse	42	1	42	And she spoke out with a loud voice and said, "Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verse	42	1	43	But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verse	42	1	44	Because, indeed, as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
verse	42	1	45	And blessed is she who believed, because there will be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord."
verse	42	1	46	Then Mary said: "My soul magnifies the Lord,
verse	42	1	47	and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.
verse	42	1	48	Because, He has regarded the lowly state of His maidservant; because behold, from now on all generations will call me blessed.
verse	42	1	49	Because, He who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is His name.
verse	42	1	50	And His mercy is on those who reverence Him from generation to generation.
verse	42	1	51	He has shown strength with His arm; He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
verse	42	1	52	He has put down the mighty from their thrones, and exalted the lowly.
verse	42	1	53	He has filled the hungry with good things, and He has sent the rich away empty.
verse	42	1	54	He has helped His servant Israel, in remembrance of His mercy,
verse	42	1	55	as He spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and to His seed forever."
verse	42	1	56	Then Mary stayed with her about three months, and returned to her own house.
verse	42	1	57	Now Elizabeth's full time came for her to be delivered, and she brought forth a son.
verse	42	1	58	And her neighbors and her relatives heard how the Lord had shown great mercy on her, and they rejoiced with her.
verse	42	1	59	And so it was, on the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
verse	42	1	60	But his mother replied and said, "Not this; but he will be called John."
verse	42	1	61	But they said to her, "There is no one from your family that is called by this name."
verse	42	1	62	So they made signs to his father, what he would have him called.
verse	42	1	63	And he asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, saying, "His name is John." So they all marveled.
verse	42	1	64	And immediately His mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he spoke and praised God.
verse	42	1	65	Then reverence came on all who lived around about them; and all these sayings were discussed throughout all the hill country of Judea.
verse	42	1	66	And all those who heard them kept them in their hearts, saying, "What kind of child shall this be?" And the hand of the Lord was with him.
verse	42	1	67	Now his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,
verse	42	1	68	"Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, because, He has visited and redeemed His people,
verse	42	1	69	and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,
verse	42	1	70	as He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets, who have been since the world began,
verse	42	1	71	that we should be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us,
verse	42	1	72	to perform the mercy promised to our fathers and to remember His holy covenant,
verse	42	1	73	the oath which He swore to our father Abraham:
verse	42	1	74	That He would grant to us, that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, might serve Him without fear,
verse	42	1	75	in holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life.
verse	42	1	76	"And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest; because, you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways,
verse	42	1	77	to give knowledge of salvation to His people by the remission of their sins,
verse	42	1	78	through the tender mercy of our God, with which the Dayspring from on high has visited us;
verse	42	1	79	to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace."
verse	42	1	80	So the child grew and became strong in spirit, and was in the deserts until the day of his appearance to Israel.
verse	42	2	1	And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered for taxation.
verse	42	2	2	And this tax registrar first occurred when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verse	42	2	3	And everyone went to be registered for taxation, every one into his own city.

verse	42	2	35	(yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul also), that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed."

verse	42	3	1	Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,

verse	42	4	1	Then Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
verse	42	4	2	being tempted forty days by the devil. And in those days He ate nothing, and when they had ended, afterward He was hungry.
verse	42	4	3	And the devil said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread."
verse	42	4	4	But Jesus replied to him, saying, "It is written that, 'Man will not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.'"
verse	42	4	5	Then the devil, taking Him up on a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verse	42	4	6	And the devil said to Him, "I will give You all this authority, and their glory; because, this has been delivered to me and I give it to whomever I wish.
verse	42	4	7	Therefore, if You will worship me, all will be Yours."
verse	42	4	8	And Jesus answered and said to him, "Get behind Me, Satan! Because, it is written, 'You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only shall you serve.'"
verse	42	4	9	Then he brought Him to Jerusalem, set Him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.
verse	42	4	10	Because, it is written: 'He will give His angels orders concerning you, to protect You,'
verse	42	4	11	and, 'In their hands they will hold You up, lest at any time You dash Your foot against a stone.'"
verse	42	4	12	And Jesus responding said to him, "It has been said, 'You shall not tempt the LORD your God.'"
verse	42	4	13	Now when the devil had ended every temptation, he departed from Him for a season.
verse	42	4	14	Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and there His fame went out through all the surrounding region.
verse	42	4	15	And He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
verse	42	4	16	So He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.
verse	42	4	17	And He was handed the book of the prophet Isaiah. And when He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written:
verse	42	4	18	"The Spirit of the LORD is upon Me, because He has anointed Me to preach the gospel to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives and recovery of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed;"
verse	42	4	19	to proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD."
verse	42	4	20	Then He closed the book, and He gave it back to the attendant and sat down. And the eyes of everyone who was in the synagogue were fixed upon Him.
verse	42	4	21	And He began to say to them, "Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your ears."
verse	42	4	22	So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, "Is this not Joseph's son?"
verse	42	4	23	Then He said to them, "You will surely say this proverb to Me, 'Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.'"
verse	42	4	24	And He said, "Truly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country."
verse	42	4	25	But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, and there was a huge famine throughout all the land;"
verse	42	4	26	but Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow."
verse	42	4	27	And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian."
verse	42	4	28	So all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,
verse	42	4	29	and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down over the cliff.
verse	42	4	30	But passing through the midst of them He went His way,
verse	42	4	31	and went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the Sabbath days.
verse	42	4	32	And they were astonished at His doctrine, because His word was with authority.
verse	42	4	33	Now in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon. And he shouted out with a loud voice,
verse	42	4	34	saying, "Leave us alone! What have we to do with You, You Jesus of Nazareth? Did you come to destroy us? I know who You are, the Holy One of God!"
verse	42	4	35	But Jesus rebuked him, saying, "Be quiet and come out of him!" And when the demon had thrown him in the midst, it came out of him and did not hurt him.
verse	42	4	36	Then they were all amazed and spoke among themselves, saying, "What a word this is! Because, with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits and they come out."
verse	42	4	37	And His fame went out into every place in the surrounding region.
verse	42	4	38	Now He arose from the synagogue and entered into Simon's house. But Simon's wife's mother was sick with a high fever and they made request of Him concerning her.
verse	42	4	39	So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and served them.
verse	42	4	40	Now when the sun was setting, all those who had any that were sick with various diseases brought them to Him; and He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them.
verse	42	4	41	And demons also came out of many, shouting out and saying, "You are Christ, the Son of God!" And He, rebuking them, did not permit them to speak, because they knew that He was Christ.
verse	42	4	42	Now when it was day, He departed and went into a deserted place. And the people sought Him and came to Him and tried to keep Him from leaving them;
verse	42	4	43	but He said to them, "I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also, because for this purpose I have been sent."
verse	42	4	44	And He preached in the synagogues of Galilee.
verse	42	5	1	And it happened, as the people pressed about Him to hear the word of God, that He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret,
verse	42	5	2	and saw two boats standing by the lake; but the fishermen had gone from them and were washing their nets.
verse	42	5	3	Then He got into one of the boats, which was Simon's, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And He sat down and taught the people from the boat.
verse	42	5	4	Now when He had stopped speaking, He said to Simon, "Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch."
verse	42	5	5	But Simon replied and said to Him, "Master, we have toiled all night and have taken nothing; nevertheless at Your word I will let down the net."
verse	42	5	6	And when they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was breaking.
verse	42	5	7	So they signaled to their partners, who were in the other boat, that they should come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.

verse	42	5	25	And immediately he rose up before them, took up what he had been lying on, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
verse	42	5	26	And they were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with reverence, saying, "We have seen strange things today!"
verse	42	5	27	And after these things He went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, "Follow Me."
verse	42	5	28	So he left everything, rose up, and followed Him.

verse	42	5	35	But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast in those days."
verse	42	5	36	Then He also spoke a parable to them: "No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old one; otherwise the new makes a tear, and also the piece that was taken out of the new does not settle with the old."
verse	42	5	37	And no one puts new grape juice into old wineskins; or else the new grape juice will burst the wineskins and be spilled, and the wineskins will be ruined."
verse	42	5	38	But new grape juice must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved."
verse	42	5	39	And also, no one having drunk old grape juice, immediately desires new; because he says, 'The old is better.'"
verse	42	6	1	Now it happened on the second Sabbath after the first that He went through the grainfields. And His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate them, rubbing them in their hands.
verse	42	6	2	And some of the Pharisees said to them, "Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath days?"

verse	42	8	25	And He said to them, "Where is your faith?" But they being afraid marveled, saying to one another, "What kind of man is this? Because, He commands even the winds and water, and they obey Him!"
verse	42	8	26	Then they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.

verse	42	8	37	Then the entire population of the surrounding region of the Gadarenes begged Him to depart from them, because they were seized with great fear. And He got into the boat and returned back again.
verse	42	8	38	Now the man from whom the demons had departed begged Him that he might be with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,

verse	42	8	40	And it came to pass, when Jesus returned, that the people welcomed Him gladly, because they were all waiting for Him.
verse	42	8	41	And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus' feet and begged Him that He would come to his house,
verse	42	8	42	because, he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as He went, the people swarmed Him.
verse	42	8	43	Now a woman, having a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her livelihood on physicians and could not be healed by any,
verse	42	8	44	came behind Him and touched the edge of His clothes. And immediately her flow of blood stopped.
verse	42	8	45	And Jesus said, "Who touched Me?" When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, "Master, the crowds swarm and press You, and You say, 'Who touched Me?'"
verse	42	8	46	But Jesus said, "Somebody touched Me, because I perceive power has gone out from Me."
verse	42	8	47	Now when the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling; and falling down before Him, she declared to Him before all the people the reason she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately.
verse	42	8	48	And He said to her, "Daughter, be of good cheer; your faith has made you well. Go in peace."
verse	42	8	49	While He was still speaking, someone came from the ruler of the synagogue's house, saying to him, "Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher."
verse	42	8	50	But when Jesus heard it, He responded to him, saying, "Do not be afraid; only believe, and she will be made well."
verse	42	8	51	And when He came into the house, He permitted no one to go in except Peter, James, and John, and the father and mother of the girl.

verse	42	8	55	Then her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He commanded that she be given food to eat.
verse	42	8	56	And her parents were astonished, but He commanded them that they should tell no one what had happened.
verse	42	9	1	Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
verse	42	9	2	And He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
verse	42	9	3	And He said to them, "Take nothing for your journey, neither staffs nor bag nor bread nor money; and do not have two coats each."
verse	42	9	4	"Whatever house you enter into, stay there, and from there depart."
verse	42	9	5	And whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet as a testimony against them."

verse	42	9	8	and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.

verse	42	9	15	And they did so, and made them all sit down.

verse	42	12	1	In the meantime, when an innumerable multitude of people had gathered together, so that they trampled one another, He began to say to His disciples first of all, "Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy."
verse	42	12	2	Because, there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known."
verse	42	12	3	Therefore whatever you have spoken in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have spoken in the ear in inner rooms will be proclaimed upon the housetops."
verse	42	12	4	"And I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do."
verse	42	12	5	But I will forewarn you whom you should reverence: Reverence Him who, after He has killed, has authority to cast into hell; yes, I say to you, reverence Him!"
verse	42	12	6	"Are not five sparrows sold for two copper coins? And not one of them is forgotten before God."

verse	42	12	13	Then one from the company said to Him, "Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me."
verse	42	12	14	But He said to him, "Man, who made Me a judge or an arbitrator over you?"
verse	42	12	15	And He said to them, "Take heed and beware of covetousness, because, one's life does not consist in the abundance of the things he possesses."
verse	42	12	16	Then He spoke a parable to them, saying: "The ground of a certain rich man yielded plentifully."
verse	42	12	17	And he thought within himself, saying, 'What shall I do, since I have no room to store my crops?'"
verse	42	12	18	So he said, 'I will do this: I will pull down my barns and build greater, and there I will store all my crops and my goods."
verse	42	12	19	And I will say to my soul, "Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years; take your ease; eat, drink, and be merry." '
verse	42	12	20	But God said to him, 'You fool! This night your soul will be required of you; then whose shall those things be which you have provided?'"

verse	42	12	22	Then He said to His disciples, "Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you shall eat; nor about the body, what you shall put on."
verse	42	12	23	Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing."
verse	42	12	24	Consider the ravens, because, they neither sow nor reap, which have neither storehouse nor barn; and God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds?"
verse	42	12	25	And which of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?"
verse	42	12	26	If you then are not able to do the things that are the least, why are you anxious for the rest?"
verse	42	12	27	Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin; and yet I say to you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these."
verse	42	12	28	If then God so clothes the grass, which today is in the field and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?"
verse	42	12	29	"And do not seek what you should eat or what you should drink, nor have an anxious mind."

verse	42	22	68	And if I also ask you, you will not answer Me or let Me go."

verse	42	23	1	Then the entire multitude of them arose and led Him to Pilate.
verse	42	23	2	And they began to accuse Him, saying, "We found this man perverting the nation, and forbidding to pay taxes to Caesar, saying that He Himself is Christ, a King."
verse	42	23	3	Then Pilate asked Him, saying, "Are You the King of the Jews?" And He answered him and said, "You say it."
verse	42	23	4	So Pilate said to the chief priests and to the people, "I find no fault in this Man."
verse	42	23	5	But they were the more fierce, saying, "He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place."
verse	42	23	6	When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked if the Man were a Galilean.
verse	42	23	7	And as soon as he knew that He belonged to Herod's jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was himself also in Jerusalem at that time.
verse	42	23	8	Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad; because, he had desired for a long time to see Him, because he had heard many things about Him, and he had hoped to have seen some miracle done by Him.
verse	42	23	9	Then he questioned Him with many words, but He answered him nothing.
verse	42	23	10	And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused Him.
verse	42	23	11	Then Herod, with his men of war, treated Him with contempt and mocked Him, arrayed Him in a gorgeous robe, and sent Him back to Pilate.
verse	42	23	12	That very day Pilate and Herod became friends with each other, because previously they had been at enmity between themselves.
verse	42	23	13	Then Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
verse	42	23	14	said to them, "You have brought this Man to me, as one who perverts the people. And indeed, having examined Him in your presence, I have found no fault in this Man concerning those things of which you accuse Him;
verse	42	23	15	no, neither did Herod, because, I sent you to him; and indeed nothing deserving of death has been done to Him.
verse	42	23	16	I will therefore chastise Him and release Him"
verse	42	23	17	(because it was necessary for him to release one to them at the feast).
verse	42	23	18	But they all shouted out at once, saying, "Away with this Man, and release to us Barabbas,"
verse	42	23	19	who had been thrown into prison for a certain rebellion made in the city, and for murder.
verse	42	23	20	Pilate, therefore, willing to release Jesus, spoke to them again.
verse	42	23	21	But they shouted, saying, "Crucify Him, crucify Him!"
verse	42	23	22	Then he said to them the third time, "Why, what evil has He done? I have found no reason for death in Him. I will therefore chastise Him and let Him go."
verse	42	23	23	But they insisted with loud voices demanding that He be crucified. And their voices and that of the chief priests prevailed.
verse	42	23	24	So Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they demanded.
verse	42	23	25	And he released to them the one they preferred, who for rebellion and murder had been thrown into prison; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
verse	42	23	26	Now as they led Him away, they laid hold of a certain man, Simon a Cyrenian, who was coming from the country, and on him they laid the cross that he might carry it after Jesus.
verse	42	23	27	And a large company of the people followed Him, and women who also mourned and lamented Him.
verse	42	23	28	But Jesus, turning to them, said, "Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children."
verse	42	23	29	Because, indeed the days are coming in which they will say, 'Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and breasts which never nursed!'"
verse	42	23	30	Then they will begin 'to say to the mountains, "Fall on us!" and to the hills, "Cover us!" '
verse	42	23	31	Because, if they do these things in the green wood, what will be done in the dry?"
verse	42	23	32	There were also two others, criminals, led with Him to be put to death.
verse	42	23	33	And when they had come to the place that is called Calvary, there they crucified Him, and the criminals, one on the right hand and the other on the left.
verse	42	23	34	Then Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, because they do not know what they do." And they divided His clothes and cast lots.
verse	42	23	35	And the people stood looking on. But the rulers, also with them, ridiculed Him, saying, "He saved others; let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the chosen of God."
verse	42	23	36	The soldiers also mocked Him, coming to Him and offering Him vinegar,
verse	42	23	37	and saying, "If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself."
verse	42	23	38	And an inscription also was written over Him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verse	42	23	39	Then one of the criminals who were hanged blasphemed Him, saying, "If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us."
verse	42	23	40	But the other, responding, rebuked him, saying, "Do you not reverence God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?
verse	42	23	41	And we indeed justly, because we receive the due reward of our deeds; but this Man has done nothing wrong."
verse	42	23	42	Then he said to Jesus, "Lord, remember me when You come into Your kingdom."
verse	42	23	43	And Jesus said to him, "Truly, I say to you, today you will be with Me in Paradise."
verse	42	23	44	Now it was about the sixth hour, and there was darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
verse	42	23	45	Then the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in the middle.
verse	42	23	46	And when Jesus had shouted with a loud voice, He said, "Father, 'into Your hands I commit My spirit.'" Having said this, He gave up the spirit.
verse	42	23	47	So when the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God, saying, "Certainly this was a righteous Man!"
verse	42	23	48	And all the people who came together to that sight, seeing what had been done, beat their chests and returned.
verse	42	23	49	But all His acquaintances, and the women who followed Him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
verse	42	23	50	Now behold, there was a man named Joseph, a council member, and he was a good and just man.
verse	42	23	51	He had not consented to their decision and deed. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who himself was also waiting for the kingdom of God.
verse	42	23	52	This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verse	42	23	53	Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a tomb that was hewn out of the rock, where no one had ever lain before.
verse	42	23	54	That day was the Preparation, and the Sabbath drew near.
verse	42	23	55	And the women also who had come with Him from Galilee followed after, and they observed the tomb and how His body was laid.
verse	42	23	56	Then they returned and prepared spices and fragrant oils. And they rested on the Sabbath according to the commandment.
verse	42	24	1	Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain others with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared.
verse	42	24	2	But they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
verse	42	24	3	Then they went in and did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verse	42	24	4	And it happened, as they were greatly perplexed about this, that behold, two men stood by them in shining clothing.
verse	42	24	5	Then, as they were afraid and bowed their faces to the earth, they said to them, "Why do you seek the living among the dead?

verse	42	24	7	saying, 'The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.'"

verse	42	24	31	Then their eyes were opened and they knew Him; and He vanished from their sight.
verse	42	24	32	And they said to one another, "Did not our heart burn within us while He talked with us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?"

verse	42	24	40	When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.

verse	42	24	43	And He took it and ate in their presence.

verse	43	1	1	In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verse	43	1	2	He was in the beginning with God.
verse	43	1	3	All things were made by Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made.
verse	43	1	4	In Him was life, and the life was the light of men.
verse	43	1	5	And the light shines in darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.
verse	43	1	6	There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
verse	43	1	7	This man came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe.
verse	43	1	8	He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.
verse	43	1	9	That was the true Light which gives light to every man who comes into the world.
verse	43	1	10	He was in the world, and the world was made by Him, yet the world did not know Him.
verse	43	1	11	He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him.

verse	43	1	13	who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verse	43	1	14	And the Word was made flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.
verse	43	1	15	John bore witness of Him and shouted, saying, "This was He of whom I said, 'He who comes after me is preferred before me, because He was before me.'"
verse	43	1	16	And of His fullness we all have received, and grace for grace.
verse	43	1	17	Because, the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
verse	43	1	18	No one has seen God at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared Him.
verse	43	1	19	Now this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, "Who are you?"
verse	43	1	20	And he confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, "I am not the Christ."
verse	43	1	21	And they asked him, "What then? Are you Elijah?" And he said, "I am not." "Are you the Prophet?" And he answered, "No."
verse	43	1	22	Then they said to him, "Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?"

verse	43	1	24	Now those who were sent were of the Pharisees.
verse	43	1	25	And they asked him, and said to him, "Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?"
verse	43	1	26	John answered them, saying, "I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know.
verse	43	1	27	It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to unloose."
verse	43	1	28	These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verse	43	1	29	The next day John saw Jesus coming to him, and said, "Behold the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
verse	43	1	30	This is He of whom I said, 'After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, because He was before me.'
verse	43	1	31	And I did not know Him; but that He should be revealed to Israel, therefore I came baptizing with water."
verse	43	1	32	And John bore record, saying, "I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained upon Him.
verse	43	1	33	And I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water, the same said to me, 'Upon whom you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on Him, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.'
verse	43	1	34	And I have seen and bare record that this is the Son of God."
verse	43	1	35	Again, the next day, after John stood with two of his disciples,
verse	43	1	36	looking upon Jesus as He walked, he said, "Behold the Lamb of God!"

verse	43	1	39	He said to them, "Come and see." They came and saw where He was staying, and remained with Him that day (because it was about the tenth hour).
verse	43	1	40	One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.
verse	43	1	41	He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, "We have found the Messiah" (which is translated, the Christ).
verse	43	1	42	And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus looked at him, He said, "You are Simon the son of Jonah. You will be called Cephas," (which is translated, A Stone).
verse	43	1	43	The following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip, and said to him, "Follow Me."
