verse	43	4	2	(though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples),
verse	43	4	3	He left Judea and departed again to Galilee.
verse	43	4	4	But He needed to go through Samaria.
verse	43	4	5	So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verse	43	4	6	Now Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied from His journey, sat thus on the well. Now it was about the sixth hour.
verse	43	4	7	A woman of Samaria came there to draw water. Jesus said to her, "Give Me a drink."
verse	43	4	8	Because His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
verse	43	4	9	Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, "How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, that is a Samaritan woman?" Because Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.
verse	43	4	10	Jesus answered and said to her, "If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, 'Give Me a drink,' you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water."
verse	43	4	11	The woman said to Him, "Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water?
verse	43	4	12	Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank from it himself, as well as his children and his livestock?"
verse	43	4	13	Jesus answered and said to her, "Whoever drinks of this water will thirst again,"
verse	43	4	14	but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst. But the water that I will give him will be in him a fountain of water springing up into everlasting life."
verse	43	4	15	The woman said to Him, "Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw."
verse	43	4	16	Jesus said to her, "Go, call your husband, and come here."
verse	43	4	17	The woman replied and said, "I have no husband." Jesus said to her, "You have said rightly, 'I have no husband,'
verse	43	4	18	Because, you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; in that you spoke truly."
verse	43	4	19	The woman said to Him, "Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
verse	43	4	20	Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you all say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship."
verse	43	4	21	Jesus said to her, "Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when you will neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, worship the Father."
verse	43	4	22	You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, because salvation is of the Jews."
verse	43	4	23	But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; because the Father is seeking such to worship Him."
verse	43	4	24	God is a Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth."
verse	43	4	25	The woman said to Him, "I know that Messiah is coming, who is called Christ. When He comes, He will tell us all things."
verse	43	4	26	Jesus said to her, "I who speak to you am He."
verse	43	4	27	And at this point His disciples came, and they marveled that He talked with the woman; yet no one said, "What do You seek?" or, "Why are You talking with her?"
verse	43	4	28	The woman then left her waterpot, went her way into the city, and said to the men,
verse	43	4	29	"Come, see a Man who told me everything that I ever did. Is this not the Christ?"
verse	43	4	30	Then they went out of the city and came to Him.
verse	43	4	31	In the meantime His disciples urged Him, saying, "Teacher, eat."
verse	43	4	32	But He said to them, "I have food to eat of which you do not know about."
verse	43	4	33	Therefore the disciples said to one another, "Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?"
verse	43	4	34	Jesus said to them, "My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work."
verse	43	4	35	Do you not say, 'There are still four months and then comes the harvest'? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, because they are already white for harvest!"
verse	43	4	36	And he who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit for eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together."
verse	43	4	37	Because in this the saying is true: 'One sows and another reaps.'"
verse	43	4	38	I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored, and you have entered into their labors."
verse	43	4	39	And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on Him because of the word of the woman who testified, "He told me everything that I ever did."
verse	43	4	40	So when the Samaritans had come to Him, they urged Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
verse	43	4	41	And many more believed because of His own word.
verse	43	4	42	Then they said to the woman, "Now we believe, not because of what you said, but because we have heard Him ourselves and we know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world."
verse	43	4	43	Now after the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee.
verse	43	4	44	Because, Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
verse	43	4	45	Then when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things He did in Jerusalem at the feast; because they also had gone to the feast.
verse	43	4	46	So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water grape juice. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.
verse	43	4	47	When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and implored Him to come down and heal his son, because he was at the point of death.
verse	43	4	48	Then Jesus said to him, "Unless you see signs and wonders, you all will not believe."
verse	43	4	49	The nobleman said to Him, "Sir, come down before my child dies!"
verse	43	4	50	Jesus said to him, "Go your way; your son lives." So the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.
verse	43	4	51	And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him, saying, "Your son lives!"
verse	43	4	52	Then he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. And they said to him, "Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him."
verse	43	4	53	So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, "Your son lives." And he himself believed, and his entire household.
verse	43	4	54	This again is the second miracle that Jesus did when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
verse	43	5	1	After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verse	43	5	2	Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool, which is called in the Hebrew language, Bethesda, having five porches.
verse	43	5	3	In these lay a large crowd of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.
verse	43	5	4	Because, an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had.
verse	43	5	5	Now a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty eight years.
verse	43	5	6	When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he already had been in that condition a long time, He said to him, "Do you want to be made well?"
verse	43	5	7	The sick man answered Him, "Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me."
verse	43	5	8	Jesus said to him, "Rise, take up your bed and walk."
verse	43	5	9	And immediately the man was made well, took up his bed, and walked. And on the same day was the Sabbath.
verse	43	5	10	The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, "It is the Sabbath day; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed."
verse	43	5	11	He replied to them, "He who made me well, He said to me, 'Take up your bed and walk.'"
verse	43	5	12	Then they asked him, "Who is the Man who said to you, 'Take up your bed and walk'?"
verse	43	5	13	But the one who was healed did not know who it was, because Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in that place.
verse	43	5	14	Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, "See, you have been made well. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come upon you."
verse	43	5	15	The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
verse	43	5	16	So therefore the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath day.
verse	43	5	17	But Jesus responded to them, "My Father has been working until now, and I work."
verse	43	5	18	Therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill Him, because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.
verse	43	5	19	Then Jesus responded and said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father do; because whatever He does, the Son also does in like manner."
verse	43	5	20	Because, the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself does; and He will show Him greater works than these, that you may marvel."
verse	43	5	21	Because, as the Father raises the dead and gives life to them, even so the Son gives life to whom He will."
verse	43	5	22	Because, the Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son,"
verse	43	5	23	that everyone should honor the Son just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him."
verse	43	5	24	"Truly, truly, I say to you, he who hears My word and believes on Him who sent Me has everlasting life, and will not come into condemnation, but has passed from death into life."
verse	43	5	25	Truly, truly, I say to you, the hour is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God; and those who hear will live."
verse	43	5	26	Because, as the Father has life in Himself, so He has granted the Son to have life in Himself,"
verse	43	5	27	and has given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man."
verse	43	5	28	Do not marvel at this; because, the hour is coming in which all who are in the graves will hear His voice"
verse	43	5	29	and will come forth; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of damnation."
verse	43	5	30	I can of Myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is righteous, because I do not seek My own will but the will of the Father who has sent Me."
verse	43	5	31	"If I bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true."
verse	43	5	32	There is another who bears witness of Me, and I know that the witness which He witnesses of Me is true."
verse	43	5	33	You sent to John, and he has borne witness to the truth."
verse	43	5	34	Yet I do not receive testimony from man, but I say these things that you may be saved."
verse	43	5	35	He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing for a time to rejoice in his light."
verse	43	5	36	But I have a greater witness than John's; because, the works which the Father has given Me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me."
verse	43	5	37	And the Father Himself, who has sent Me, has testified of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form."
verse	43	5	38	And you do not have His word abiding in you, because whom He sent, Him you do not believe."
verse	43	5	39	Search the Scriptures, because in them you think you have eternal life; and these are they which testify of Me."
verse	43	5	40	But you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life."
verse	43	5	41	"I do not receive honor from men."
verse	43	5	42	But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you."
verse	43	5	43	I have come in My Father's name, and you do not receive Me; if another comes in his own name, him you will receive."
verse	43	5	44	How can you believe, who receive honor from one another, and do not seek the honor that comes from the God alone?"
verse	43	5	45	Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father; there is one who accuses you, that is Moses, in whom you trust."
verse	43	5	46	Because, if you believed Moses, you would believe Me; because he wrote about Me."
verse	43	5	47	But if you do not believe his writings, how shall you believe My words?"
verse	43	6	1	After these things Jesus went over the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias.
verse	43	6	2	Then a large crowd followed Him, because they saw His miracles which He performed on those who were diseased.
verse	43	6	3	And Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.
verse	43	6	4	Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near.
verse	43	6	5	Then Jesus lifted up His eyes, and seeing a large crowd coming toward Him, He said to Philip, "Where shall we buy bread, that these may eat?"
verse	43	6	6	But this He said to test him, because He Himself knew what He would do.
verse	43	6	7	Philip answered Him, "Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may have a little."
verse	43	6	8	One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to Him,
verse	43	6	9	"There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two small fish, but what are they among so many?"
verse	43	6	10	Then Jesus said, "Make the men sit down." Now there was a lot of grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
verse	43	6	11	And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; and likewise of the fish, as much as they wanted.
verse	43	6	12	So when they were filled, He said to His disciples, "Gather up the fragments that remain, so that nothing is lost."
verse	43	6	13	Therefore they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
verse	43	6	14	Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, "This is truly that Prophet who is to come into the world."
verse	43	6	15	Therefore when Jesus perceived that they were about to come and take Him by force to make Him king, He departed again to the mountain by Himself alone.
verse	43	6	16	Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea,
verse	43	6	17	got into a boat, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was already dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
verse	43	6	18	Then the sea arose because a great wind was blowing.
verse	43	6	19	So when they had rowed about twenty or thirty stadiums they saw Jesus walking on the sea and drawing near the boat; and they were afraid.
verse	43	6	20	But He said to them, "It is I; do not be afraid."
verse	43	6	21	Then they willingly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.
verse	43	6	22	On the following day, when the people who were standing on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except that one which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not entered the boat with His disciples, but that His disciples had gone away alone;
verse	43	6	23	(however, other boats came from Tiberias, near the place where they ate bread after the Lord had given thanks)
verse	43	6	24	therefore when the people saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they also got into boats and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.
verse	43	6	25	And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, "Rabbi, when did You come here?"
verse	43	6	26	Jesus answered them and said, "Truly, truly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw the miracles, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled."
verse	43	6	27	Do not labor for the food which perishes, but for the food which endures to everlasting life, which the Son of Man will give you, because God the Father has set His seal on Him."
verse	43	6	28	Then they said to Him, "What shall we do, that we may work the works of God?"
verse	43	6	29	Jesus answered and said to them, "This is the work of God, that you believe on Him whom He has sent."
verse	43	6	30	Therefore they said to Him, "What sign shall You perform then, that we may see it and believe You? What work shall You do?
verse	43	6	31	Our fathers ate the manna in the desert; as it is written, 'He gave them bread from heaven to eat.'"
verse	43	6	32	Then Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but My Father gives you the true bread from heaven."
verse	43	6	33	Because, the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world."
verse	43	6	34	Then they said to Him, "Lord, give us this bread always."
verse	43	6	35	And Jesus said to them, "I am the bread of life. He who comes to Me will never hunger, and he who believes on Me will never thirst."
verse	43	6	36	But I said to you that you have seen Me and yet do not believe."
verse	43	6	37	All that the Father gives Me will come to Me, and the one who comes to Me I will by no means cast out."
verse	43	6	38	Because, I came down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me."
verse	43	6	39	And this is the will of the Father who sent Me, that of all He has given Me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day."
verse	43	6	40	And this is the will of Him who sent Me, that everyone who sees the Son and believes on Him may have everlasting life; and I will raise him up at the last day."
verse	43	6	41	The Jews then complained about Him, because He said, "I am the bread which came down from heaven."
verse	43	6	42	And they said, "Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, 'I came down from heaven'?"
verse	43	6	43	Jesus therefore responded and said to them, "Do not murmur among yourselves."
verse	43	6	44	No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up at the last day."
verse	43	6	45	It is written in the prophets, 'And they will all be taught by God.' Therefore everyone who has heard and learned from the Father comes to Me."
verse	43	6	46	Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He who is from God; He has seen the Father."
verse	43	6	47	Truly, truly, I say to you, he who believes on Me has everlasting life."
verse	43	6	48	I am the bread of life."
verse	43	6	49	Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and are dead."
verse	43	6	50	This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die."
verse	43	6	51	I am the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever; and the bread that I will give is My flesh, which I will give for the life of the world."
verse	43	6	52	The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, "How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?"
verse	43	6	53	Then Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in you."
verse	43	6	54	Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day."
verse	43	6	55	Because My flesh is food indeed, and My blood is drink indeed."
verse	43	6	56	He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood abides in Me, and I in him."
verse	43	6	57	As the living Father has sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who eats Me will live because of Me."
verse	43	6	58	This is the bread which came down from heaven; not as your fathers ate the manna, and are dead. He who eats this bread will live forever."
verse	43	6	59	These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
verse	43	6	60	Therefore many of His disciples, when they heard this, said, "This is a hard saying; who can understand it?"
verse	43	6	61	When Jesus knew in Himself that His disciples complained about this, He said to them, "Does this offend you?"
verse	43	6	62	What then if you should see the Son of Man ascend up where He was before?"
verse	43	6	63	It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you, they are spirit, and they are life."
verse	43	6	64	But there are some of you who do not believe." Because, Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would betray Him.
verse	43	6	65	And He said, "Therefore I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted to him by My Father."
verse	43	6	66	From that time many of His disciples went back and walked with Him no longer.
verse	43	6	67	Then Jesus said to the twelve, "Do you also want to go away?"
verse	43	6	68	But Simon Peter answered Him, "Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verse	43	6	69	Also we believe and are convinced that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God."
verse	43	6	70	Jesus replied to them, "Did I not choose you twelve, and one of you is a devil?"
verse	43	6	71	He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, because it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve.
verse	43	7	1	After these things Jesus walked in Galilee; because, He did not want to walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill Him.
verse	43	7	2	Now the Jews' Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.
verse	43	7	3	His brethren therefore said to Him, "Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You are doing.
verse	43	7	4	Because, no one does anything in secret while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world."
verse	43	7	5	Because even His brethren did not believe in Him.
verse	43	7	6	Then Jesus said to them, "My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready."
verse	43	7	7	The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify of it that its works are evil."
verse	43	7	8	You go up to this feast. I am not going up to this feast yet, because My time has not yet fully come."
verse	43	7	9	When He had said these words to them, He remained in Galilee.
verse	43	7	10	But when His brethren had gone up, then He also went up to the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
verse	43	7	11	Then the Jews sought Him at the feast, and said, "Where is He?"
verse	43	7	12	And there was much murmuring among the people concerning Him. Because, some said, "He is a good Man"; others said, "No, but He deceives the people."
verse	43	7	13	However, no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.
verse	43	7	14	Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
verse	43	7	15	And the Jews marveled, saying, "How does this Man know letters, having never studied?"
verse	43	7	16	Jesus answered them and said, "My doctrine is not Mine, but His who sent Me."
verse	43	7	17	If anyone will do His will, he will know concerning the doctrine, whether it is from God or whether I speak from Myself."
verse	43	7	18	He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who seeks the glory of the One who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him."
verse	43	7	19	Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?"
verse	43	7	20	The people answered and said, "You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?"
verse	43	7	21	Jesus answered and said to them, "I did one work, and you all marvel."
verse	43	7	22	Moses therefore gave you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath day."
verse	43	7	23	If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath day, so that the law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath day?"
verse	43	7	24	Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment."
verse	43	7	25	Now some of them from Jerusalem said, "Is this not He whom they seek to kill?
verse	43	7	26	But look! He speaks boldly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers actually know that this is truly the Christ?
verse	43	7	27	However, we know where this Man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from."
verse	43	7	28	Then Jesus shouted, as He taught in the temple, saying, "You both know Me, and you know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know."
verse	43	7	29	But I know Him, because I am from Him, and He sent Me."
verse	43	7	30	Therefore they sought to take Him; but no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
verse	43	7	31	And many of the people believed on Him, and said, "When the Christ comes, will He do more miracles than these which this Man has done?"
verse	43	7	32	The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning Him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take Him.
verse	43	7	33	Then Jesus said to them, "I will be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me."
verse	43	7	34	You will seek Me and not find Me, and where I am, there you cannot come."
verse	43	7	35	Then the Jews said among themselves, "Where does He intend to go that we will not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Gentiles and teach the Gentiles?
verse	43	7	36	What is this thing that He said, 'You shall seek Me and not find Me, and where I am, there you cannot come'?"
verse	43	7	37	During the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and shouted saying, "If anyone thirsts, let him come to Me and drink."
verse	43	7	38	He who believes on Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his belly will flow rivers of living water."
verse	43	7	39	But this He spoke concerning the Spirit, whom those believing on Him would receive; because, the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
verse	43	7	40	Therefore many from the people, when they heard this saying, said, "Truly this is the Prophet."
verse	43	7	41	Others said, "This is the Christ." But some said, "Shall the Christ come out of Galilee?
verse	43	7	42	Has not the Scripture said that the Christ comes from the seed of David and from the town of Bethlehem, where David was?"
verse	43	7	43	So there was a division among the people because of Him.
verse	43	7	44	Now some of them wanted to take Him, but no one laid hands on Him.
verse	43	7	45	Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, "Why have you not brought Him?"
verse	43	7	46	The officers answered, "No man ever spoke like this Man!"
verse	43	7	47	Then the Pharisees replied to them, "Are you also deceived?
verse	43	7	48	Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed on Him?
verse	43	7	49	But these people that do not know the law are accursed."
verse	43	7	50	Nicodemus (he who came to Jesus by night, being one of them) said to them,
verse	43	7	51	"Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?"
verse	43	7	52	They answered and said to him, "Are you also from Galilee? Search and look, because no prophet has arisen out of Galilee."
verse	43	7	53	And everyone went to his own house.
verse	43	8	1	Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verse	43	8	2	Now early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people came to Him; and He sat down and taught them.
verse	43	8	3	Then the scribes and Pharisees brought to Him a woman caught in adultery. And when they had set her in the midst,
verse	43	8	4	they said to Him, "Teacher, this woman was caught in adultery, in the very act.
verse	43	8	5	Now Moses, in the law, commanded us that such should be stoned. But what do You say?"
verse	43	8	6	This they said, testing Him, that they might have something of which to accuse Him. But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear them.
verse	43	8	7	So when they continued asking Him, He raised Himself up and said to them, "He who is without sin among you, let him throw a stone at her first."
verse	43	8	8	And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
verse	43	8	9	Then those who heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning with the oldest even to the last. And Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
verse	43	8	10	When Jesus had lifted Himself up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, "Woman, where are those accusers of yours? Has no one condemned you?"
verse	43	8	11	She said, "No one, Lord." And Jesus said to her, "Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more."
verse	43	8	12	Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, "I am the light of the world. He who follows Me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life."
verse	43	8	13	The Pharisees therefore said to Him, "You bear record of Yourself; Your record is not true."
verse	43	8	14	Jesus replied and said to them, "Though I bear record of Myself, yet My record is true, because, I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from and where I am going."
verse	43	8	15	You judge according to the flesh; I judge no one."
verse	43	8	16	And yet if I judge, My judgment is true; because I am not alone, but I and the Father who sent Me."
verse	43	8	17	It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true."
verse	43	8	18	I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father who sent Me bears witness of Me."
verse	43	8	19	Then they said to Him, "Where is Your Father?" Jesus answered, "You know neither Me nor My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also."
verse	43	8	20	These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
verse	43	8	21	Then Jesus said to them again, "I am going my way, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sins. Where I go you cannot come."
verse	43	8	22	So the Jews said, "Shall He kill Himself, because He says, 'Where I go you cannot come'?"
verse	43	8	23	And He said to them, "You are from beneath; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world."
verse	43	8	24	Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; because, if you do not believe that I am He, you will die in your sins."
verse	43	8	25	Then they said to Him, "Who are You?" And Jesus said to them, "Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.
verse	43	8	26	I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I heard from Him."
verse	43	8	27	They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.
verse	43	8	28	Then Jesus said to them, "When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father has taught Me, I speak these things."
verse	43	8	29	And He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, because I always do those things that please Him."
verse	43	8	30	As He spoke these words, many believed on Him.
verse	43	8	31	Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed on Him, "If you continue in My word, then you are My disciples indeed."
verse	43	8	32	And you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free."
verse	43	8	33	They replied to Him, "We are Abraham's descendants, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How can You say, 'You will be made free'?"
verse	43	8	34	Jesus answered them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, whoever commits sin is a servant of sin."
verse	43	8	35	And a servant does not abide in the house forever, but the Son abides forever."
verse	43	8	36	Therefore if the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed."
verse	43	8	37	"I know that you are Abraham's seed, but you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you."
verse	43	8	38	I speak what I have seen with My Father, and you do what you have seen with your father."
verse	43	8	39	They replied and said to Him, "Abraham is our father." Jesus said to them, "If you were Abraham's children, you would do the works of Abraham.
verse	43	8	40	But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this."
verse	43	8	41	You do the deeds of your father." Then they said to Him, "We were not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God."
verse	43	8	42	Jesus said to them, "If God were your Father, you would love Me, because, I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me."
verse	43	8	43	Why do you not understand My speech? That is because you are not able to hear My word."
verse	43	8	44	You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and did not abide in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, because he is a liar and the father of it."
verse	43	8	45	And because I tell you the truth, you do not believe Me."
verse	43	8	46	Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me?"
verse	43	8	47	He who is of God hears God's words; therefore you do not hear them, because you are not of God."
verse	43	8	48	Then the Jews replied and said to Him, "Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?"
verse	43	8	49	Jesus answered, "I do not have a demon; but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me."
verse	43	8	50	And I do not seek My own glory; there is One who seeks and judges."
verse	43	8	51	Truly, truly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he will never see death."
verse	43	8	52	Then the Jews said to Him, "Now we know that You have a demon! Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and You say, 'If anyone keeps My word he will never taste death.'"
verse	43	8	53	Are You greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Who do You make Yourself out to be?"
verse	43	8	54	Jesus answered, "If I honor Myself, My honor is nothing. It is My Father who honors Me, of whom you say that He is your God."
verse	43	8	55	Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. And if I should say, 'I do not know Him,' I would be a liar like you; but I do know Him and keep His word."
verse	43	8	56	Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad."
verse	43	8	57	Then the Jews said to Him, "You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?"
verse	43	8	58	Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, before Abraham was, I AM."
verse	43	8	59	Then they took up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
verse	43	9	1	Now as Jesus passed by, He saw a man who was blind from his birth.
verse	43	9	2	And His disciples asked Him, saying, "Teacher, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?"
verse	43	9	3	Jesus answered, "Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but that the works of God should be revealed in him."
verse	43	9	4	I must work the works of Him who sent Me while it is day; the night is coming when no one can work."
verse	43	9	5	As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world."
verse	43	9	6	When He had said these things, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva; and He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay.
verse	43	9	7	And He said to him, "Go, wash in the pool of Siloam" (which is translated, Sent). So he went and washed, and returned seeing.
verse	43	9	8	Therefore the neighbors and those who previously had seen that he was blind said, "Is not this he who sat and begged?"
verse	43	9	9	Some said, "This is he." Others said, "He is like him." But he said, "I am he."
verse	43	9	10	Therefore they said to him, "How were your eyes opened?"
verse	43	9	11	He answered and said, "A Man who is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me, 'Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.' So I went and washed, and I received sight."
verse	43	9	12	Then they said to him, "Where is He?" He said, "I do not know."
verse	43	9	13	They brought him who formerly was blind to the Pharisees.
verse	43	9	14	Now it was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
verse	43	9	15	Then the Pharisees also asked him again how he had received his sight. He said to them, "He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see."
verse	43	9	16	Therefore some of the Pharisees said, "This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath day." Others said, "How can a man who is a sinner do such miracles?" And there was a division among them.
verse	43	9	17	They said to the blind man again, "What do you say about Him because He opened your eyes?" He said, "He is a prophet."
verse	43	9	18	But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight.
verse	43	9	19	And they asked them, saying, "Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?"
verse	43	9	20	His parents answered them and said, "We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
verse	43	9	21	but by what means he now sees we do not know, or who opened his eyes we do not know. He is of age; ask him. He will speak for himself."
verse	43	9	22	His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, because, the Jews had agreed already that if anyone confessed that He was Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.
verse	43	9	23	Therefore his parents said, "He is of age; ask him."
verse	43	9	24	So they again called the man who was blind, and said to him, "Give God the praise! We know that this Man is a sinner."
verse	43	9	25	He replied and said, "Whether He is a sinner or not I do not know. One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see."
verse	43	9	26	Then they said to him again, "What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?"
verse	43	9	27	He answered them, "I have told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?"
verse	43	9	28	Then they reviled him and said, "You are His disciple, but we are Moses' disciples.
verse	43	9	29	We know that God spoke to Moses; as for this fellow, we do not know where He is from."
verse	43	9	30	The man responded and said to them, "Why, this is a marvelous thing, that you do not know where He is from; and yet He has opened my eyes!
verse	43	9	31	Now we know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, He hears him.
verse	43	9	32	Since the world began it has been unheard of that anyone opened the eyes of one who was born blind.
verse	43	9	33	If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing."
verse	43	9	34	They replied and said to him, "You were completely born in sins, and are you teaching us?" And they threw him out.
verse	43	9	35	Jesus heard that they had thrown him out; and when He had found him, He said to him, "Do you believe on the Son of God?"
verse	43	9	36	He answered and said, "Who is He, Lord, that I may believe on Him?"
verse	43	9	37	And Jesus said to him, "You have both seen Him and it is He who is talking with you."
verse	43	9	38	Then he said, "Lord, I believe!" And he worshiped Him.
verse	43	9	39	And Jesus said, "For judgment I have come into this world, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may be made blind."
verse	43	9	40	Then some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, "Are we blind also?"
verse	43	9	41	Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, 'We see.' Therefore your sin remains."
verse	43	10	1	"Truly, truly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber."
verse	43	10	2	But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep."
verse	43	10	3	To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out."
verse	43	10	4	And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice."
verse	43	10	5	Yet they will not follow a stranger, but will flee from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers."
verse	43	10	6	Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they did not understand those things which He spoke to them.
verse	43	10	7	Then Jesus said to them again, "Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep."

verse	43	10	12	But he who is a hireling, and is not the shepherd, who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches them and scatters the sheep."
verse	43	10	13	The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care for the sheep."
verse	43	10	14	I am the good shepherd; and know My sheep, and am known by My own."
verse	43	10	15	As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep."
verse	43	10	16	And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd."
verse	43	10	17	"Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it again."
verse	43	10	18	No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take it again. This command I have received from My Father."
verse	43	10	19	Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings.
verse	43	10	20	And many of them said, "He has a demon and is mad. Why do you listen to Him?"
verse	43	10	21	Others said, "These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?"
verse	43	10	22	Now it was the Feast of Dedication in Jerusalem, and it was winter.
verse	43	10	23	And Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon's porch.
verse	43	10	24	Then the Jews surrounded Him and said to Him, "How long do You keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly."
verse	43	10	25	Jesus answered them, "I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in My Father's name, they bear witness of Me."
verse	43	10	26	But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you."
verse	43	10	27	My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me."

verse	43	10	29	My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of My Father's hand."
verse	43	10	30	I and My Father are one."
verse	43	10	31	Then the Jews took up stones again to stone Him.
verse	43	10	32	Jesus responded to them, "Many good works I have shown you from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?"
verse	43	10	33	The Jews answered Him, saying, "For a good work we do not stone You, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, make Yourself God."
verse	43	10	34	Jesus replied to them, "Is it not written in your law, 'I said, "You are gods" '?
verse	43	10	35	If He called them gods, to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken,"
verse	43	10	36	do you say of Him whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, 'You are blaspheming,' because I said, 'I am the Son of God'?"
verse	43	10	37	If I do not do the works of My Father, do not believe Me;"
verse	43	10	38	but if I do, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him."
verse	43	10	39	Therefore they sought again to seize Him, but He escaped out of their hand.
verse	43	10	40	And He went away again beyond the Jordan to the place where John was baptizing at first, and there He stayed.
verse	43	10	41	Then many came to Him and said, "John performed no miracle, but all the things that John spoke about this Man are true."
verse	43	10	42	And many believed on Him there.
verse	43	11	1	Now a certain man was sick, named Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
verse	43	11	2	It was that Mary who anointed the Lord with fragrant oil and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.
verse	43	11	3	Therefore the sisters sent to Him, saying, "Lord, behold, he whom You love is sick."
verse	43	11	4	When Jesus heard that, He said, "This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it."
verse	43	11	5	Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
verse	43	11	6	So, when He heard that he was sick, He stayed two more days in the place where He was.
verse	43	11	7	Then after this He said to His disciples, "Let us go to Judea again."
verse	43	11	8	His disciples said to Him, "Teacher, lately the Jews sought to stone You, and are You going there again?"
verse	43	11	9	Jesus answered, "Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world."
verse	43	11	10	But if one walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him."
verse	43	11	11	These things He said, and after that He said to them, "Our friend Lazarus sleeps, but I go that I may wake him out of sleep."

verse	43	11	14	Then Jesus said to them plainly, "Lazarus is dead."
verse	43	11	15	And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, that you may believe. Nevertheless let us go to him."

verse	43	11	17	So when Jesus came, He found that he had already been laid in the tomb four days.
verse	43	11	18	Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadiums away.
verse	43	11	19	And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.
verse	43	11	20	Now Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met Him, but Mary was still sitting in the house.
verse	43	11	21	Then Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.
verse	43	11	22	But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You."

verse	43	11	26	And whoever lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?"

verse	43	11	28	And when she had said these things, she went her way and secretly called Mary her sister, saying, "The Teacher has come and is calling for you."
verse	43	11	29	As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly and came to Him.
verse	43	11	30	Now Jesus had not yet come into the town, but was in the place where Martha met Him.
verse	43	11	31	Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and comforting her, when they saw that Mary rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, "She is going to the tomb to weep there."
verse	43	11	32	Then, when Mary came where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died."
verse	43	11	33	Therefore, when Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled,
verse	43	11	34	and said, "Where have you laid him?" They said to Him, "Lord, come and see."

verse	43	11	36	Then the Jews said, "See how He loved him!"

verse	43	11	41	Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. And Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, "Father, I thank You that You have heard Me."
verse	43	11	42	And I know that You always hear Me, but because of the people who are standing by I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me."

verse	43	11	48	If we let Him alone like this, everyone will believe on Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation."
verse	43	11	49	And one of them, named Caiaphas, being the high priest that year, said to them, "You know nothing at all,

verse	43	11	51	Now this he did not say from himself; but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
verse	43	11	52	and not for that nation only, but also that He would gather together in one the children of God who were scattered abroad.

verse	43	11	57	Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a command, that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might seize Him.
verse	43	12	1	Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead.
verse	43	12	2	There they made Him a supper; and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.
verse	43	12	3	Then Mary took a pound of very costly oil of spikenard, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the oil.
verse	43	12	4	But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, who would betray Him, said,
verse	43	12	5	"Why was this fragrant oil not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?"
verse	43	12	6	This he said, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the money bag; and carried what was put in it.
verse	43	12	7	But Jesus said, "Leave her alone; she has kept this for the day of My burial."
verse	43	12	8	Because, the poor you have with you always, but Me you do not have always."

verse	43	12	10	But the chief priests plotted to put Lazarus to death also,
verse	43	12	11	because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed on Jesus.
verse	43	12	12	On the next day many people who had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verse	43	12	13	took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Him, and shouted: "Hosanna! Blessed is the King of Israel who comes in the name of the LORD!"
verse	43	12	14	Then Jesus, when He had found a young donkey, sat on it; as it is written:
verse	43	12	15	"Fear not, daughter of Zion; behold, your King is coming, sitting on a donkey's colt."

verse	43	12	18	For this reason the people also met Him, because they heard that He had done this miracle.

verse	43	12	25	He who loves his life will lose it, and he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life."

verse	43	12	29	Therefore the people who stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, "An angel has spoken to Him."
verse	43	12	30	Jesus responded and said, "This voice did not come because of Me, but for your sake."
verse	43	12	31	Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be cast out."
verse	43	12	32	And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all men to Me."
verse	43	12	33	This He said, signifying by what death He would die.

verse	43	18	38	Pilate said to Him, "What is truth?" And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, "I find no fault in Him at all.
verse	43	18	39	"But you have a custom that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?"
verse	43	18	40	Then they all shouted again, saying, "Not this Man, but Barabbas!" Now Barabbas was a robber.
verse	43	19	1	So then Pilate took Jesus and scourged Him.
verse	43	19	2	And the soldiers twisted a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put a purple robe on Him.
verse	43	19	3	Then they said, "Hail, King of the Jews!" And they struck Him with their hands.
verse	43	19	4	Then Pilate then went out again, and said to them, "Behold, I am bringing Him out to you, that you may know that I find no fault in Him."
verse	43	19	5	Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said to them, "Behold the Man!"
verse	43	19	6	Therefore, when the chief priests and officers saw Him, they shouted out, saying, "Crucify Him, crucify Him!" Pilate said to them, "You take Him and crucify Him, because I find no fault in Him."
verse	43	19	7	The Jews replied to him, "We have a law, and according to our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God."
verse	43	19	8	Therefore, when Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid,
verse	43	19	9	and went again into the judgment hall, and said to Jesus, "Where are You from?" But Jesus gave him no answer.
verse	43	19	10	Then Pilate said to Him, "Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have authority to crucify You, and have authority to release You?"
verse	43	19	11	Jesus answered, "You could have no authority at all against Me unless it had been given you from above. Therefore the one who delivered Me to you has the greater sin."
verse	43	19	12	From then on Pilate sought to release Him, but the Jews shouted out, saying, "If you let this Man go, you are not Caesar's friend. Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar."
verse	43	19	13	When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called The Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.
verse	43	19	14	Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, "Behold your King!"
verse	43	19	15	But they shouted out, "Away with Him, away with Him! Crucify Him!" Pilate said to them, "Shall I crucify your King?" The chief priests answered, "We have no king but Caesar!"
verse	43	19	16	Then he delivered Him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led Him away.
verse	43	19	17	And He, bearing His cross, went out to a place called the Place of a Skull, which is called in the Hebrew, Golgotha,
verse	43	19	18	where they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle.
verse	43	19	19	Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verse	43	19	20	Then many of the Jews read this title, because, the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.
verse	43	19	21	So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, "Do not write, 'The King of the Jews,' but, 'He said, "I am the King of the Jews."'"
verse	43	19	22	Pilate replied, "What I have written, I have written."
verse	43	19	23	Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took His clothes and made four parts, to each soldier a part, and also His coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top in one piece.
verse	43	19	24	Therefore they said among themselves, "Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be," that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says: "They divided My clothes among them, and for My coat they cast lots." Therefore the soldiers did these things.
verse	43	19	25	Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verse	43	19	26	Therefore, when Jesus saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, "Woman, behold your son!"
verse	43	19	27	Then He said to the disciple, "Behold your mother!" And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.
verse	43	19	28	After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, "I thirst!"
verse	43	19	29	Now a vessel full of vinegar was sitting there; and they filled a sponge with vinegar, put it on hyssop, and put it to His mouth.
verse	43	19	30	So when Jesus had received the vinegar, He said, "It is finished!" He bowed His head, and gave up His spirit.
verse	43	19	31	Then since it was the Preparation Day, that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath day (because that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
verse	43	19	32	Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.
verse	43	19	33	But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.
verse	43	19	34	But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and blood and water came out straight away.
verse	43	19	35	And he who saw it bare record, and his record is true; and he knows that he is speaking the truth, so that you may believe.
verse	43	19	36	Because these things were done that the Scripture should be fulfilled, "Not one of His bones will be broken."
verse	43	19	37	And again another Scripture says, "They will look on Him whom they pierced."
verse	43	19	38	After this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly, for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took the body of Jesus.
verse	43	19	39	And Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, weighing about a hundred pounds.
verse	43	19	40	Then they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in strips of linen with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.
verse	43	19	41	Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had yet been laid.
verse	43	19	42	So there they laid Jesus, because of the Jews' Preparation Day, because the tomb was nearby.
verse	43	20	1	The first day of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
verse	43	20	2	Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, "They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him."
verse	43	20	3	Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and came to the tomb.
verse	43	20	4	So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.
verse	43	20	5	And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in.
verse	43	20	6	Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there,
verse	43	20	7	and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself.
verse	43	20	8	Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed.
verse	43	20	9	Because, as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.
verse	43	20	10	Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.
verse	43	20	11	But Mary stood outside by the tomb weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the tomb.
verse	43	20	12	And she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had laid.
verse	43	20	13	Then they said to her, "Woman, why are you weeping?" She said to them, "Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid Him."
verse	43	20	14	Now when she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and did not know that it was Jesus.
verse	43	20	15	Jesus said to her, "Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?" She, supposing Him to be the gardener, said to Him, "Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have laid Him, and I will take Him away."
verse	43	20	16	Jesus said to her, "Mary!" She turned and said to Him, "Rabboni!" (which is to say, Teacher).
verse	43	20	17	Jesus said to her, "Do not cling to Me, because, I have not yet ascended to My Father; but go to My brethren and say to them, 'I am ascending to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God.'"
verse	43	20	18	Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken these things to her.
verse	43	20	19	Then, the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, "Peace be with you."
verse	43	20	20	And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
verse	43	20	21	So Jesus said to them again, "Peace be to you! As My Father has sent Me, so I also send you."
verse	43	20	22	And when He had said this, He breathed on them, and said to them, "Receive the Holy Spirit."
verse	43	20	23	If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; and if you retain the sins of any, they are retained."
verse	43	20	24	Now Thomas, called Didymus, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
verse	43	20	25	The other disciples therefore said to him, "We have seen the Lord." But he said to them, "Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe."
verse	43	20	26	And after eight days His disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Then Jesus came, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, "Peace be to you!"
verse	43	20	27	Then He said to Thomas, "Reach your finger here, and look at My hands; and reach your hand here, and put it into My side. Do not be faithless, but believing."
verse	43	20	28	And Thomas replied and said to Him, "My Lord and my God!"
verse	43	20	29	Jesus said to him, "Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed."
verse	43	20	30	And truly Jesus did many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book;
verse	43	20	31	but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life through His name.
verse	43	21	1	After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and in this way He showed Himself:
verse	43	21	2	Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of His disciples were together.
verse	43	21	3	Simon Peter said to them, "I am going fishing." They said to him, "We are going with you also." They went out and immediately got into the boat, and that night they caught nothing.
verse	43	21	4	But when the morning had now come, Jesus stood on the shore; but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
verse	43	21	5	Then Jesus said to them, "Children, have you any food?" They answered Him, "No."
verse	43	21	6	And He said to them, "Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some." So they cast, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the multitude of fish.
verse	43	21	7	Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, "It is the Lord!" Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his fisherman's coat (because he had removed it), and plunged himself into the sea.
verse	43	21	8	But the other disciples came in the little boat (because they were not far from land, but about two hundred cubits), dragging the net with fish.
verse	43	21	9	Then, as soon as they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
verse	43	21	10	Jesus said to them, "Bring some of the fish which you have just caught."
verse	43	21	11	Simon Peter went up and dragged the net to land, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty three; and although there were so many, the net was not broken.
verse	43	21	12	Jesus said to them, "Come and eat." Yet none of the disciples dared ask Him, "Who are You?" Knowing that it was the Lord.
verse	43	21	13	Jesus then came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish.
verse	43	21	14	This is now the third time Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after He was risen from the dead.
verse	43	21	15	So when they had eaten, Jesus said to Simon Peter, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?" He said to Him, "Yes, Lord; You know that I love You." He said to him, "Feed My lambs."
verse	43	21	16	He said to him again a second time, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?" He said to Him, "Yes, Lord; You know that I love You." He said to him, "Feed My sheep."
verse	43	21	17	He said to him the third time, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?" Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, "Do you love Me?" And he said to Him, "Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You." Jesus said to him, "Feed My sheep.
verse	43	21	18	Truly, truly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you desired; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not desire."
verse	43	21	19	This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, "Follow Me."
verse	43	21	20	Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, "Lord, who is the one who betrays You?"
verse	43	21	21	Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, "Lord, what shall this man do?"
verse	43	21	22	Jesus said to him, "If I will that he remains until I come, what is that to you? You follow Me."
verse	43	21	23	Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, "If I will that he remain until I come, what is that to you?"
verse	43	21	24	This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.
verse	43	21	25	And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if every one was written, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.
verse	44	1	1	The former account I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,
verse	44	1	2	until the day in which He was taken up, after He through the Holy Spirit had given commandments to the apostles whom He had chosen,
verse	44	1	3	to whom He also presented Himself alive after His passion by many infallible proofs, being seen by them for forty days and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God.
verse	44	1	4	And being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the Promise of the Father, "which," He said, "you have heard from Me;
verse	44	1	5	because, John truly baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now."
verse	44	1	6	Therefore, when they had come together, they asked Him, saying, "Lord, will You at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?"
verse	44	1	7	And He said to them, "It is not for you to know the times or the seasons which the Father has put in His own authority."
verse	44	1	8	But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you will be witnesses to Me in Jerusalem, and also in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth."
verse	44	1	9	Now when He had spoken these things, while they watched, He was taken up, and a cloud received Him out of their sight.
verse	44	1	10	And while they looked steadfastly toward heaven as He went up, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing,
verse	44	1	11	who also said, "You men of Galilee, why do you stand gazing up into heaven? This same Jesus, who is taken up from you into heaven, will so come in like manner as you saw Him go into heaven."
verse	44	1	12	Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey.
verse	44	1	13	And when they had entered, they went up into an upper room where, Peter, James, John, and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; James the son of Alphaeus and Simon Zelotes, and Judas the brother of James, were staying.
verse	44	1	14	These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brethren.
verse	44	1	15	And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (altogether the number of names was about a hundred and twenty), and said,
verse	44	1	16	"Men and brethren, this Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand through the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus;
verse	44	1	17	because he was numbered with us and obtained a part in this ministry.
verse	44	1	18	Now this man purchased a field with the wages of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his entrails gushed out.
verse	44	1	19	And it became known to all those dwelling in Jerusalem; so that field is called in their own language, Akel Dama, that is to say, The Field of Blood.
verse	44	1	20	Because, it is written in the Book of Psalms: 'Let his dwelling place be desolate, and let no one live in it'; and, 'Let another take his position.'
verse	44	1	21	Therefore, of these men who have accompanied us the entire time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
verse	44	1	22	beginning from the baptism of John to that day when He was taken up from us, one of these must be ordained to be a witness with us of His resurrection."
verse	44	1	23	And they proposed two: Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
verse	44	1	24	And they prayed and said, "You, O Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which of these two You have chosen,
verse	44	1	25	that he may take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place."
verse	44	1	26	And they put forward their lots, and the lot fell on Matthias. And he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
verse	44	2	1	Now when the Day of Pentecost had fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.
verse	44	2	2	And suddenly there came a sound from heaven, as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled the entire house where they were sitting.
verse	44	2	3	Then there appeared to them divided tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.
verse	44	2	4	And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
verse	44	2	5	And there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven.
verse	44	2	6	And when this sound occurred, the crowd came together, and were confused, because everyone heard them speak in his own language.
verse	44	2	7	Then they were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, "Look, are not all these who speak Galileans?
verse	44	2	8	And how is it that we hear, each man in our own language in which we were born?
verse	44	2	9	Parthians and Medes and Elamites, those dwelling in Mesopotamia, in Judea and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia,
verse	44	2	10	Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and in the parts of Libya adjoining Cyrene, visitors from Rome, Jews and proselytes,
verse	44	2	11	Cretans and Arabs, we hear them speaking in our own languages the wonderful works of God."
verse	44	2	12	So they were all amazed and in doubt, saying to one another, "Whatever could this mean?"
verse	44	2	13	Others mocking said, "They are full of new wine."
verse	44	2	14	But Peter, standing up with the eleven, raised his voice and said to them, "You men of Judea and all of you who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and heed my words.
verse	44	2	15	Because, these are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is only the third hour of the day.
verse	44	2	16	But this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:
verse	44	2	17	'And it will come to pass in the last days, says God, I will pour out of My Spirit on all flesh, and your sons and your daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, and your old men will dream dreams.
verse	44	2	18	And on My menservants and on My maidservants I will pour out of My Spirit in those days; and they will prophesy.
verse	44	2	19	I will show wonders in heaven above and signs in the earth beneath: Blood and fire and vapor of smoke.
verse	44	2	20	The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the coming of the great and awesome day of the LORD comes.
verse	44	2	21	And it will come to pass that whoever calls on the name of the LORD will be saved.'
verse	44	2	22	"You men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a Man approved by God among you by miracles, wonders, and signs which God did by Him in your midst, as you yourselves also know:
verse	44	2	23	Him, being delivered by the determined purpose and foreknowledge of God, you have taken, and by wicked hands, have crucified, and put to death;
verse	44	2	24	whom God raised up, having loosed the pains of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.
verse	44	2	25	Because, David says concerning Him: 'I foresaw the LORD always before my face, because, He is at my right hand, that I may not be shaken.
verse	44	2	26	Therefore my heart rejoiced, and my tongue was glad; moreover my flesh also will rest in hope.
verse	44	2	27	Because, You will not leave my soul in the abode of the dead, nor will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption.
verse	44	2	28	You have made known to me the ways of life; You will make me full of joy in Your presence.'
verse	44	2	29	"Men and brethren, let me speak freely to you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
verse	44	2	30	Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, He would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,
verse	44	2	31	he, foreseeing this, spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that His soul was not left in the abode of the dead, nor did His flesh see corruption.
verse	44	2	32	This Jesus God has raised up, of which we are all witnesses.
verse	44	2	33	Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He poured out this which you now see and hear.
verse	44	2	34	"Because, David did not ascend into the heavens, but he says himself: 'The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit at My right hand,
verse	44	2	35	until I make Your enemies Your footstool."'
verse	44	2	36	"Therefore let all the house of Israel know with certainty that God has made this same Jesus, whom you have crucified, both Lord and Christ."
verse	44	2	37	Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, "Men and brethren, what shall we do?"
verse	44	2	38	Then Peter said to them, "Repent, and let every one of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins; and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verse	44	2	39	Because, the promise is to you and to your children, and to all who are afar off, that is to as many as the Lord our God will call."
verse	44	2	40	And with many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, "Save yourselves from this perverse generation."
verse	44	2	41	Then those who gladly received his word were baptized; and that day about three thousand souls were added to them.
verse	44	2	42	And they continued steadfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers.

verse	44	2	47	praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily those who were being saved.
verse	44	3	1	Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
verse	44	3	2	And a certain man lame from his mother's womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask for charitable gifts from those who entered the temple;
verse	44	3	3	who, seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, asked for charitable gifts.
verse	44	3	4	And fixing his eyes on him, with John, Peter said, "Look at us."
verse	44	3	5	So he gave them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.
verse	44	3	6	Then Peter said, "I do not have any silver and gold, but what I do have I give you: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk."
verse	44	3	7	And he took him by the right hand and lifted him up, and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
verse	44	3	8	So he, leaping up, stood and walked and entered the temple with them, walking, leaping, and praising God.
verse	44	3	9	And all the people saw him walking and praising God.
verse	44	3	10	Then they knew that it was he who sat begging for charitable gifts at the Beautiful Gate of the temple; and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
verse	44	3	11	Now as the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch which is called Solomon's, greatly amazed.
verse	44	3	12	So when Peter saw it, he responded to the people: "You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this? Or why look so intently at us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man walk?
verse	44	3	13	The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, glorified His Son Jesus, whom you delivered up and rejected Him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let Him go.
verse	44	3	14	But you rejected the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted to you,
verse	44	3	15	and killed the Prince of life, whom God has raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.
verse	44	3	16	And His name, through faith in His name, has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which comes by Him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
verse	44	3	17	"Yet now, brethren, I know that you did it in ignorance, as did also your rulers.
verse	44	3	18	But those things which God foretold by the mouth of all His prophets, that Christ would suffer, He has likewise fulfilled.
