verse	44	3	20	and He will send Jesus Christ, who was preached to you beforehand,
verse	44	3	21	whom the heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God has spoken by the mouth of all His holy prophets since the world began.
verse	44	3	22	Because, Moses truly said to the fathers, 'The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your brethren. Him you will hear in all things, whatever He says to you.
verse	44	3	23	And it will be that every soul who shall not hear that Prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.'
verse	44	3	24	Yes, and all the prophets, from Samuel and those who followed later, as many as have spoken, have also foretold these days.
verse	44	3	25	You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, 'And in your seed all the families of the earth will be blessed.'
verse	44	3	26	To you first, God, having raised up His Son Jesus, sent Him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your iniquities."
verse	44	4	1	Now as they spoke to the people, the priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees came upon them,
verse	44	4	2	being greatly disturbed that they taught the people and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verse	44	4	3	And they laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, because it was already evening.
verse	44	4	4	However, many of those who heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.
verse	44	4	5	And it came to pass, on the next day, that their rulers, elders, and scribes,
verse	44	4	6	and Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the family of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.
verse	44	4	7	And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, "By what authority or by what name have you done this?"
verse	44	4	8	Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, "You rulers of the people and elders of Israel:
verse	44	4	9	If we this day are examined for the good deed done to the helpless man, by what means he has been made well,
verse	44	4	10	let it be known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, that by Him this man stands here before you whole.
verse	44	4	11	This is the 'stone which was rejected by you builders, which has become the chief cornerstone.'
verse	44	4	12	Nor is there salvation in any other, because, there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved."
verse	44	4	13	Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were uneducated and untrained men, they marveled. And they recognized them, that they had been with Jesus.
verse	44	4	14	And looking at the man who had been healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
verse	44	4	15	But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
verse	44	4	16	saying, "What shall we do to these men? Because, indeed, that a notable miracle has been done by them is evident to all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
verse	44	4	17	But so that it spreads no further among the people, let us severely threaten them, that from now on they speak to no one in this name."
verse	44	4	18	So they called them and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
verse	44	4	19	But Peter and John replied and said to them, "Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you more than to God, you judge.
verse	44	4	20	Because we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard."
verse	44	4	21	So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way of punishing them, because of the people, since they all glorified God for what had been done.
verse	44	4	22	Because, the man was over forty years old on whom this miracle of healing had been performed.
verse	44	4	23	And being let go, they went to their own companions and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said to them.
verse	44	4	24	So when they heard that, they raised their voice to God with one accord and said: "Lord, You are God, who made heaven and earth and the sea, and everything that is in them,
verse	44	4	25	who by the mouth of Your servant David have said: 'Why did the nations rage, and the people plot vain things?
verse	44	4	26	The kings of the earth took their stand, and the rulers were gathered together against the LORD and against His Christ.'
verse	44	4	27	"Because, truly against Your holy Child Jesus, whom You have anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together
verse	44	4	28	to do whatever Your hand and Your purpose determined beforehand to be done.
verse	44	4	29	And now Lord, look on their threats, and grant to Your servants that with all boldness they may speak Your word,
verse	44	4	30	by stretching out Your hand to heal, and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of Your holy Child Jesus."
verse	44	4	31	And when they had prayed, the place where they were assembled together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness.
verse	44	4	32	Now the multitude of those who believed were of one heart and one soul; neither did anyone say that any of the things he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.
verse	44	4	33	And with great power the apostles gave witness to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And great grace was upon them all.
verse	44	4	34	Nor was there anyone among them who lacked; because, all who were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold,
verse	44	4	35	and laid them down at the apostles' feet. And distribution was made to everyone as they had need.
verse	44	4	36	And Joses, who was surnamed Barnabas by the apostles (which is translated The Son of Encouragement), a Levite, and of the country of Cyprus,
verse	44	4	37	having land, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles' feet.
verse	44	5	1	But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
verse	44	5	2	and kept back part of the proceeds, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part and laid it at the apostles' feet.
verse	44	5	3	But Peter said, "Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the price of the land?
verse	44	5	4	While it remained, was it not your own? And after it was sold, was it not in your own control? Why have you conceived this thing in your heart? You have not lied to men but to God."
verse	44	5	5	Then Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and gave up the spirit. So great fear came upon all those who heard these things.
verse	44	5	6	And the young men arose and wrapped him up, carried him out, and buried him.
verse	44	5	7	Now it was about three hours later when his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
verse	44	5	8	And Peter responded to her, "Tell me whether you sold the land for so much?" And she said, "Yes, for so much."
verse	44	5	9	Then Peter said to her, "How is it that you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out."
verse	44	5	10	Then immediately she fell down at his feet and gave up the spirit. And the young men came in and found her dead, and carrying her out, buried her by her husband.
verse	44	5	11	So great fear came upon all the church and upon all who heard these things.
verse	44	5	12	And by the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. And they were all with one accord in Solomon's Porch.
verse	44	5	13	Yet none of the rest dared join them, but the people esteemed them highly.
verse	44	5	14	And believers were increasingly added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women,
verse	44	5	15	so that they brought the sick out into the streets and laid them on beds and couches, that at least the shadow of Peter passing by might fall on some of them.
verse	44	5	16	Also a multitude came out from the surrounding cities to Jerusalem, bringing sick people and those who were tormented by unclean spirits, and they were all healed.
verse	44	5	17	Then the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with indignation,
verse	44	5	18	and laid their hands on the apostles and put them in the common prison.
verse	44	5	19	But at night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and brought them out, and said,
verse	44	5	20	"Go, stand in the temple and speak to the people all the words of this life."
verse	44	5	21	And when they heard that, they entered into the temple early in the morning and taught. But the high priest and those with him came and called the council together, with all the elders of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verse	44	5	22	But when the officers came and did not find them in the prison, they returned and reported,
verse	44	5	23	saying, "Indeed we found the prison shut securely, and the guards standing outside before the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside!"
verse	44	5	24	Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these things, they wondered what the outcome would be.
verse	44	5	25	So one came and told them, saying, "Look, the men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people!"
verse	44	5	26	Then the captain went with the officers and brought them without violence, because they feared the people, lest they should be stoned.
verse	44	5	27	And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest asked them,
verse	44	5	28	saying, "Did we not strictly command you that you should not teach in this name? And look, you have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this Man's blood on us!"
verse	44	5	29	But Peter and the other apostles answered and said: "We ought to obey God rather than men.
verse	44	5	30	The God of our fathers raised up Jesus whom you hung on a tree and murdered.
verse	44	5	31	Him God has exalted to His right hand to be Prince and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
verse	44	5	32	And we are His witnesses to these things, and so also is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey Him."
verse	44	5	33	When they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and plotted to kill them.
verse	44	5	34	Then one in the council stood up, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law held in respect by all the people, and commanded them to put the apostles outside for a little while.
verse	44	5	35	And he said to them: "You men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what you intend to do regarding these men.
verse	44	5	36	Because, some time ago Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody. A number of men, about four hundred, joined him. He was slain, and all who obeyed him were scattered and came to nothing.
verse	44	5	37	After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the registration for taxation, and drew away many people after him. He also perished, and everyone who obeyed him was dispersed.
verse	44	5	38	And now I say to you, keep away from these men and leave them alone; because, if this plan or this work is of men, it will come to nothing;
verse	44	5	39	but if it is of God, you cannot overthrow it, lest you even be found to fight against God."
verse	44	5	40	And they agreed with him, and when they had called for the apostles and beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verse	44	5	41	So they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for His name.
verse	44	5	42	And daily in the temple, and in every house, they did not cease teaching and preaching Jesus Christ.
verse	44	6	1	Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, there arose a complaint against the Hebrews by the Hellenists, because their widows were neglected in the daily distribution.
verse	44	6	2	Then the twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples to them and said, "It is not desirable that we should leave the word of God and serve tables.
verse	44	6	3	Therefore, brethren, seek out from among you seven men of good reputation, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business;
verse	44	6	4	but we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the word."
verse	44	6	5	And the saying pleased the entire multitude. And they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, and Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte from Antioch,
verse	44	6	6	whom they set before the apostles; and when they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.
verse	44	6	7	Then the word of God spread, and the number of the disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem, and a large company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verse	44	6	8	And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
verse	44	6	9	Then there arose some from what is called the Synagogue of the Libertines (Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and those from Cilicia and Asia), disputing with Stephen.
verse	44	6	10	And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.
verse	44	6	11	Then they secretly induced men to say, "We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God."
verse	44	6	12	And they stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes; and they came upon him, seized him, and brought him to the council.
verse	44	6	13	They also set up false witnesses who said, "This man does not cease to speak blasphemous words against this holy place and the law;
verse	44	6	14	because, we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs which Moses delivered to us."
verse	44	6	15	And all who sat in the council, looking steadfastly at him, saw his face as though it was the face of an angel.
verse	44	7	1	Then the high priest said, "Are these things so?"
verse	44	7	2	And he said, "Men, brethren, and fathers, listen: The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,
verse	44	7	3	and said to him, 'Get out of your country and from your relatives, and come into the land that I will show you.'
verse	44	7	4	Then he came out of the land of the Chaldeans and dwelt in Haran. And from there, when his father was dead, He moved him to this land in which you now dwell.
verse	44	7	5	And He gave him no inheritance in it, not even enough to set his foot on. But even when he had no child, He promised to give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him.
verse	44	7	6	But God spoke in this way: that his seed would dwell in a foreign land, and that they would bring them into bondage and oppress them four hundred years.
verse	44	7	7	'And the nation to whom they will be in bondage I will judge,' said God, 'and after that, they will come out and serve Me in this place.'
verse	44	7	8	Then He gave him the covenant of circumcision; and so Abraham begot Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot the twelve patriarchs.
verse	44	7	9	"And the patriarchs, becoming envious, sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him
verse	44	7	10	and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom in the presence of Pharaoh, king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
verse	44	7	11	Now a famine and great affliction came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and our fathers found no sustenance.
verse	44	7	12	But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.
verse	44	7	13	And during the second occasion Joseph was made known to his brethren, and Joseph's family became known to the Pharaoh.
verse	44	7	14	Then Joseph sent and called his father Jacob and all his relatives to him, seventy five people.
verse	44	7	15	So Jacob went down to Egypt; and died, he and our fathers.
verse	44	7	16	And they were carried back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem.
verse	44	7	17	"But when the time of the promise drew near which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt
verse	44	7	18	until another king arose who did not know Joseph.
verse	44	7	19	This one dealt treacherously with our people, and oppressed our forefathers, making them throw out their babes, so that they would not live.
verse	44	7	20	During this time Moses was born, and was very beautiful; and he was brought up in his father's house for three months.
verse	44	7	21	But when he was thrown out, Pharaoh's daughter took him away and brought him up as her own son.
verse	44	7	22	And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and deeds.
verse	44	7	23	"Now when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren, the children of Israel.
verse	44	7	24	And seeing one of them suffer wrongfully, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, and struck down the Egyptian.
verse	44	7	25	Because, he supposed that his brethren would have understood that God would deliver them by his hand, but they did not understand.
verse	44	7	26	And the next day he appeared to two of them as they were fighting, and tried to reconcile them, saying, 'Men, you are brethren; why do you do wrong one to another?'
verse	44	7	27	But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, 'Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?
verse	44	7	28	Will you kill me as you did the Egyptian yesterday?'
verse	44	7	29	Then, at this saying, Moses fled and became a foreigner in the land of Midian, where he begot two sons.
verse	44	7	30	"And when forty years had passed, an Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire in a bush, in the wilderness of Mount Sinai.
verse	44	7	31	When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight; and as he drew near to observe it, the voice of the Lord came to him,
verse	44	7	32	saying, 'I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' And Moses trembled and dared not look.
verse	44	7	33	'Then the LORD said to him, "Take your sandals off your feet, because the place where you stand is holy ground.
verse	44	7	34	I have seen, I have seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt; I have heard their groaning and have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt."'
verse	44	7	35	"This Moses whom they rejected, saying, 'Who made you a ruler and a judge?' is the one God sent to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the Angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verse	44	7	36	He brought them out, after he had shown wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
verse	44	7	37	"This is that Moses who said to the children of Israel, 'The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your brethren. Him you will hear.'
verse	44	7	38	"This is he who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the Angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received the living oracles to give to us,
verse	44	7	39	whom our fathers would not obey, but rejected Him. And in their hearts they returned back to Egypt,
verse	44	7	40	saying to Aaron, 'Make us gods to go before us; as for this Moses who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.'
verse	44	7	41	And they made a calf in those days, offered sacrifices to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
verse	44	7	42	Then God turned and gave them up to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the Prophets: 'Did you offer Me slaughtered animals and sacrifices during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
verse	44	7	43	But you took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, images which you made to worship them; and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.'
verse	44	7	44	"Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as He had appointed, speaking to Moses, that he should make it according to the pattern that he had seen,
verse	44	7	45	which our fathers also, who came afterwards, brought in with Joshua into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers until the days of David,
verse	44	7	46	who found favor before God and asked to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verse	44	7	47	But Solomon built Him a house.
verse	44	7	48	"However, the Most High does not dwell in temples made with hands, as the prophet says:
verse	44	7	49	'Heaven is My throne, and earth is My footstool. What house will you build for Me? says the LORD, or what is the place of My rest?
verse	44	7	50	Has My hand not made all these things?'
verse	44	7	51	"You stiff necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit; as your fathers did, so do you.
verse	44	7	52	Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they have killed those who foretold the coming of the Just One, of whom you now have become the betrayers and murderers,
verse	44	7	53	who have received the law by the direction of angels and have not kept it."
verse	44	7	54	When they heard these things they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.
verse	44	7	55	But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up gazing into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God,
verse	44	7	56	and said, "Behold! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!"
verse	44	7	57	Then they shouted out with a loud voice, stopped their ears, and ran at him with one accord;
verse	44	7	58	and threw him out of the city and stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their clothes at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verse	44	7	59	And they stoned Stephen as he was calling on God and saying, "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit."
verse	44	7	60	Then he knelt down and shouted out with a loud voice, "Lord, do not charge them with this sin." And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
verse	44	8	1	Now Saul was consenting to his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
verse	44	8	2	And devout men carried Stephen to his burial, and made great lamentation over him.
verse	44	8	3	As for Saul, he made havoc of the church, entering into every house, and dragging men and women away, committing them to prison.
verse	44	8	4	Therefore those who were scattered went everywhere preaching the word.
verse	44	8	5	Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria and preached Christ to them.
verse	44	8	6	And the people with one accord heeded the things spoken by Philip, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
verse	44	8	7	Because, unclean spirits, shouting with a loud voice, came out of many who were possessed with them; and many who were paralyzed and lame were healed.
verse	44	8	8	And there was great joy in that city.
verse	44	8	9	But there was a certain man called Simon, who previously practiced sorcery in the same city and seduced the people of Samaria, claiming that he was some great one,
verse	44	8	10	to whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, "This man is the great power of God."
verse	44	8	11	And they heeded him because he had seduced them with his sorceries for a long time.
verse	44	8	12	But when they believed Philip as he preached the things concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were baptized.
verse	44	8	13	Then Simon himself also believed; and when he was baptized he continued with Philip, and was amazed, seeing the miracles and signs which were done.
verse	44	8	14	Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them,
verse	44	8	15	who, when they had come down, prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit.
verse	44	8	16	Because as yet He had fallen upon none of them. They had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verse	44	8	17	Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
verse	44	8	18	And when Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles' hands the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money,
verse	44	8	19	saying, "Give me this authority also, that whoever I lay hands upon, they may receive the Holy Spirit."
verse	44	8	20	But Peter said to him, "Your money perish with you, because you thought that the gift of God could be purchased with money!
verse	44	8	21	You have neither part nor portion in this matter, because your heart is not right in the sight of God.
verse	44	8	22	Therefore repent of this your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.
verse	44	8	23	Because I perceive that you are poisoned by bitterness and bound by iniquity."
verse	44	8	24	Then Simon replied and said, "Pray to the Lord for me, that none of the things which you have spoken should come upon me."
verse	44	8	25	So when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
verse	44	8	26	Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, "Arise and go toward the south along the road which goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza, which is desert."
verse	44	8	27	So he arose and went. And behold, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge of all her treasury, and had come to Jerusalem to worship,
verse	44	8	28	was returning, and sitting in his chariot, was reading Isaiah the prophet.
verse	44	8	29	Then the Spirit said to Philip, "Go near and join yourself to this chariot."
verse	44	8	30	So Philip ran over to him, and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah, and said, "Do you understand what you are reading?"
verse	44	8	31	And he said, "How can I, unless someone guides me?" And he wanted Philip to come up and sit with him.
verse	44	8	32	The place in the Scripture which he read was this: "He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and as a lamb before its shearer is silent, so He did not open His mouth.
verse	44	8	33	In His humiliation His justice was taken away, and who shall declare His generation? Because His life is taken from the earth."
verse	44	8	34	So the eunuch replied to Philip and said, "I ask you, of whom does the prophet say this, of himself or of some other man?"
verse	44	8	35	Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning at this Scripture, preached Jesus to him.
verse	44	8	36	Now as they went on their way, they came to some water. And the eunuch said, "Look, here is water. What hinders me from being baptized?"
verse	44	8	37	Then Philip said, "If you believe with all your heart, you may." And he replied and said, "I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God."
verse	44	8	38	So he commanded the chariot to stand still. And they went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
verse	44	8	39	Now when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, so that the eunuch did not see him any longer; and he went on his way rejoicing.
verse	44	8	40	But Philip was found at Azotus. And passing through, he preached in all the cities until he came to Caesarea.
verse	44	9	1	Then Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest
verse	44	9	2	and requested letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, so that if he found any who were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
verse	44	9	3	As he journeyed he came near Damascus, and suddenly a light shone around him from heaven.
verse	44	9	4	Then he fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to him, "Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?"
verse	44	9	5	And he said, "Who are You, Lord?" Then the Lord said, "I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting. It is hard for you to kick against the prods."
verse	44	9	6	So he, trembling and astonished, said, "Lord, what do You want me to do?" Then the Lord said to him, "Arise and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do."
verse	44	9	7	And the men who journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice but seeing no one.
verse	44	9	8	Then Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened he saw no one. But they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.
verse	44	9	9	And he was without sight for three days, and neither ate nor drank.

verse	44	9	12	And in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, so that he might receive his sight."
verse	44	9	13	Then Ananias replied, "Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he has done to Your saints in Jerusalem.
verse	44	9	14	And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on Your name."
verse	44	9	15	But the Lord said to him, "Go your way, because, he is a chosen vessel of Mine to bear My name before the Gentiles, kings, and the children of Israel."
verse	44	9	16	Because, I will show him how many things he must suffer for My name's sake."
verse	44	9	17	And Ananias went his way and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him he said, "Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus who appeared to you on the road as you came, has sent me that you may receive your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit."
verse	44	9	18	And immediately there fell from his eyes something like scales, and he received his sight at once; and he arose and was baptized.
verse	44	9	19	So when he had received food, he was strengthened. Then Saul spent some days with the disciples at Damascus.
verse	44	9	20	And immediately he preached the Christ in the synagogues, that He is the Son of God.
verse	44	9	21	Then all who heard him were amazed, and said, "Is this not he who destroyed those who called on this name in Jerusalem, and has come here for that purpose, so that he might bring them bound to the chief priests?"
verse	44	9	22	But Saul increased all the more in strength, and confounded the Jews who dwelt in Damascus, proving that this truly is the Christ.
verse	44	9	23	Now after many days were past, the Jews plotted to kill him.
verse	44	9	24	But their plot became known to Saul. And they watched the gates day and night, to kill him.
verse	44	9	25	Then the disciples took him by night and let him down by the wall in a basket.
verse	44	9	26	And when Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join himself to the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, and did not believe that he was a disciple.
verse	44	9	27	But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. And he declared to them how he had seen the Lord on the road, and that He had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
verse	44	9	28	So he was with them at Jerusalem, coming in and going out.
verse	44	9	29	And he spoke boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and disputed against the Hellenists, but they attempted to kill him.
verse	44	9	30	Which when the brethren found out, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him out to Tarsus.
verse	44	9	31	Then the churches throughout all Judea, Galilee, and Samaria had rest and were edified. And walking in the reverence of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, they were multiplied.
verse	44	9	32	Now it came to pass, as Peter went through every corner of the country, that he also came down to the saints who dwelt in Lydda.
verse	44	9	33	There he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden eight years and was paralyzed.
verse	44	9	34	And Peter said to him, "Aeneas, Jesus Christ makes you whole. Arise and make your bed." Then he arose immediately.
verse	44	9	35	So all who dwelt at Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
verse	44	9	36	Now at Joppa there was a certain disciple named Tabitha, which is translated Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and charitable deeds which she did.
verse	44	9	37	But it happened in those days that she became sick and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.
verse	44	9	38	And since Lydda was near Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent two men to him, imploring him not to delay in coming to them.
verse	44	9	39	Then Peter arose and went with them. When he had come, they brought him into the upper room. And all the widows stood by him weeping, showing the coats and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.
verse	44	9	40	But Peter put them all out, and knelt down and prayed. And turning himself toward the body he said, "Tabitha, arise." And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up.
verse	44	9	41	Then he gave her his hand and lifted her up; and when he had called the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
verse	44	9	42	And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verse	44	9	43	So it was that he stayed many days in Joppa with Simon, a tanner.
verse	44	10	1	There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the regiment called the Italian Regiment,
verse	44	10	2	a devout man and one who reverenced God with all his household, who gave many charitable gifts to the people, and prayed to God always.
verse	44	10	3	About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming in to him, and saying to him, "Cornelius!"
verse	44	10	4	And when he looked at him, he was afraid, and said, "What is it, Lord?" So he said to him, "Your prayers and your charitable gifts have come up as a memorial before God.
verse	44	10	5	And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon whose surname is Peter.
verse	44	10	6	He is lodging with Simon, a tanner, whose house is beside the sea. He will tell you what you must do."
verse	44	10	7	And when the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier from among those who waited on him continually.
verse	44	10	8	So when he had explained all these things to them, he sent them to Joppa.
verse	44	10	9	On the next day, as they went on their journey and drew near the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray, about the sixth hour.
verse	44	10	10	Then he became very hungry and wanted to eat; but while they were preparing, he fell into a trance
verse	44	10	11	and saw heaven opened and a certain object just like a great sheet bound at the four corners, descending to him and let down to the earth.
verse	44	10	12	In it were all kinds of four footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.
verse	44	10	13	And a voice came to him, "Rise, Peter; kill and eat."
verse	44	10	14	But Peter said, "Not so, Lord! Because I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean."
verse	44	10	15	And a voice spoke to him again the second time, "What God has cleansed you must not call common."
verse	44	10	16	This was done three times. And the object was taken up into heaven again.
verse	44	10	17	Now while Peter wondered within himself what this vision which he had seen meant, behold, the men who had been sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon's house, and stood before the gate.
verse	44	10	18	And they called and asked whether Simon, whose surname was Peter, was lodging there.
verse	44	10	19	While Peter thought about the vision, the Spirit said to him, "Behold, three men are seeking you.
verse	44	10	20	Therefore arise, go down and go with them, doubting nothing; because I have sent them."
verse	44	10	21	Then Peter went down to the men who had been sent to him from Cornelius, and said, "Behold, I am he whom you seek. What is the reason then you have come?"
verse	44	10	22	And they said, "Cornelius the centurion, a just man, one who reverences God and has a good reputation among all the nation of the Jews, was advised from God through a holy angel to summon you to his house, and to hear words from you."
verse	44	10	23	Then he invited them in and lodged them. On the next day Peter went away with them, and some brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
verse	44	10	24	And the following day they entered into Caesarea. Now Cornelius was waiting for them, and had called together his relatives and close friends.
verse	44	10	25	As Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him.
verse	44	10	26	But Peter lifted him up, saying, "Stand up; I myself am also a man."
verse	44	10	27	And as he talked with him, he went in and found many who had come together.
verse	44	10	28	Then he said to them, "You know how unlawful it is for a someone who is a Jew to keep company with or go to one of another nation. But God has shown me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
verse	44	10	29	Therefore I came to you without objection as soon as I was sent for. I ask, then, for what reason have you sent for me?"
verse	44	10	30	So Cornelius said, "Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
verse	44	10	31	and said, 'Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your charitable gifts are remembered in the sight of God.
verse	44	10	32	Therefore send away to Joppa and call Simon here, whose surname is Peter. He is lodging in the house of one Simon, a tanner, beside the sea. When he comes, he will speak to you.'
verse	44	10	33	So I sent to you immediately, and you have done well that you came. Now therefore, we are all present before God, to hear all the things that are commanded you from God."
verse	44	10	34	Then Peter opened his mouth and said: "In truth I perceive that God shows no personal favoritism.
verse	44	10	35	But in every nation whoever reverences Him and works righteousness is accepted by Him.
verse	44	10	36	The word which God sent to the children of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ, He is Lord of all,
verse	44	10	37	that word I speak of, you know, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, and began from Galilee after the baptism which John preached:
verse	44	10	38	how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, because God was with Him.
verse	44	10	39	And we are witnesses of all things which He did both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem, whom they hung on a tree and murdered.
verse	44	10	40	Him God raised up on the third day, and showed Him openly,
verse	44	10	41	not to all the people, but to witnesses chosen before by God, even to us who ate and drank with Him after He arose from the dead.
verse	44	10	42	And He commanded us to preach to the people, and to testify that it is He who was ordained by God to be the Judge of the living and the dead.
verse	44	10	43	To Him all the prophets give witness that, through His name, whoever believes in Him will receive remission of sins."
verse	44	10	44	While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all those who heard the word.
verse	44	10	45	And those of the circumcision who believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on the Gentiles also.
verse	44	10	46	Because they heard them speak with tongues and magnify God. Then they responded to Peter,
verse	44	10	47	"Can anyone forbid water, that these should not be baptized who have received the Holy Spirit just as we have?"
verse	44	10	48	And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they asked him to stay a few days.
verse	44	11	1	Now the apostles and brethren who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
verse	44	11	2	And when Peter came up to Jerusalem, those who were of the circumcision contended with him,
verse	44	11	3	saying, "You went in to uncircumcised men and ate with them!"
verse	44	11	4	But Peter explained the issue from the beginning, describing it to them in sequence, saying:
verse	44	11	5	"I was in the city of Joppa praying; and in a trance I saw a vision, an object descending just like a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came to me.
verse	44	11	6	On which, when I observed it intently and considered, I saw four footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.
verse	44	11	7	And I heard a voice saying to me, 'Rise, Peter; kill and eat.'"
verse	44	11	8	But I said, 'Not so, Lord! Because nothing common or unclean has at any time entered my mouth.'
verse	44	11	9	But the voice replied to me again from heaven, 'What God has cleansed you must not call that common.'"
verse	44	11	10	Now this was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.
verse	44	11	11	And, behold, immediately there were three men already standing before the house where I was, having been sent to me from Caesarea.
verse	44	11	12	Then the Spirit told me to go with them, doubting nothing. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered the man's house.
verse	44	11	13	And he told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house, who said to him, 'Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon whose surname is Peter,
verse	44	11	14	who will tell you words by which you and all your household will be saved.'
verse	44	11	15	And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them, as upon us at the beginning.
verse	44	11	16	Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He said, 'John indeed baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.'"
verse	44	11	17	If therefore God gave them the same gift as He did to us when we believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could withstand God?"
verse	44	11	18	When they heard these things they held their peace; and they glorified God, saying, "Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life."
verse	44	11	19	Now those who were scattered after the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to no one but the Jews only.
verse	44	11	20	But some of them were men from Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.
verse	44	11	21	And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.
verse	44	11	22	Then news of these things came to the ears of the church that was in Jerusalem, and they sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch.
verse	44	11	23	Who when he came and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and encouraged them all that with purpose of heart they should continue with the Lord.
verse	44	11	24	Because, he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And many people were added to the Lord.
verse	44	11	25	Then Barnabas departed for Tarsus to seek for Saul.
verse	44	11	26	And when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. So it was that for an entire year they assembled with the church and taught many people. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
verse	44	11	27	And in these days prophets came from Jerusalem to Antioch.
verse	44	11	28	Then one of them, named Agabus, stood up and signified by the Spirit that there was going to be a great famine throughout all the world, which occurred in the days of Claudius Caesar.
verse	44	11	29	Then the disciples, each according to his ability, determined to send relief to the brethren dwelling in Judea.
verse	44	11	30	This they also did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
verse	44	12	1	Now about that time Herod the king stretched out his hand to harass some from the church.
verse	44	12	2	Then he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
verse	44	12	3	And because he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to seize Peter also. These were the Days of Unleavened Bread.
verse	44	12	4	So when he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of soldiers to keep him, intending after Easter to bring him before the people.
verse	44	12	5	Therefore Peter was kept in prison, but constant prayer was offered to God for him by the church.
verse	44	12	6	And when Herod was about to bring him out, that same night Peter was sleeping, bound with two chains between two soldiers; and the guards before the door were guarding the prison.
verse	44	12	7	Now behold, the angel of the Lord stood over him, and a light shone in the prison; and he struck Peter on the side and raised him up, saying, "Rise up quickly!" And his chains fell off from his hands.
verse	44	12	8	Then the angel said to him, "Gird yourself and tie on your sandals"; and so he did. And he said to him, "Put on your clothes and follow me."
verse	44	12	9	So he went out and followed him, and did not know that what was done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.
verse	44	12	10	When they were past the first and the second guard posts, they came to the iron gate that leads to the city, which opened to them of its own accord; and they went out and went down through one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.
verse	44	12	11	And when Peter had come to himself, he said, "Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent His angel, and has delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the Jewish people."
verse	44	12	12	So, when he had considered the matter, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together praying.
verse	44	12	13	And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a girl named Rhoda came to answer.
verse	44	12	14	When she recognized Peter's voice, because of gladness she did not open the gate, but ran in and announced that Peter stood before the gate.
verse	44	12	15	But they said to her, "You are mad!" Yet she kept insisting that it was so. So they said, "It is his angel."
verse	44	12	16	Now Peter continued knocking; and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
verse	44	12	17	But motioning to them with his hand to keep silent, he declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, "Go, tell these things to James and to the brethren." And he departed and went to another place.
verse	44	12	18	Then, as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.
verse	44	12	19	But when Herod had searched for him and did not find him, he examined the guards and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.
verse	44	12	20	Now Herod had been very displeased with the people of Tyre and Sidon; but they came to him with one accord, and having made Blastus the king's personal aide their friend, they desired peace, because their country was supplied with food by the king's country.
verse	44	12	21	So on a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne and gave a speech to them.
verse	44	12	22	And the people shouted out, saying, "It is the voice of a god and not of a man!"
verse	44	12	23	Then immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he did not give glory to God. So he became eaten by worms and gave up the spirit.
verse	44	12	24	But the word of God grew and multiplied.
verse	44	12	25	And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had fulfilled their ministry, and they also took with them John whose surname was Mark.
verse	44	13	1	Now in the church that was at Antioch there were certain prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
verse	44	13	2	As they ministered to the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, "Now separate to Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them."
verse	44	13	3	Then, when they had fasted and prayed, and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
verse	44	13	4	So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they departed to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
verse	44	13	5	And when they arrived in Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. They also had John as their assistant.
verse	44	13	6	Now when they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew whose name was Barjesus,
verse	44	13	7	who was with the proconsul of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man. This man called for Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.
verse	44	13	8	But Elymas the sorcerer (for so his name is translated) opposed them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
verse	44	13	9	Then Saul (who also is called Paul), filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him
verse	44	13	10	and said, "O full of all deceit and all fraud, you child of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease perverting the right ways of the Lord?
verse	44	13	11	And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a season." And immediately a mist fell on him and darkness, and he went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
verse	44	13	12	Then the proconsul believed, when he saw what had been done, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
verse	44	13	13	Now when Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia; and John, departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.
verse	44	13	14	But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.
verse	44	13	15	And after the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying, "You men and brethren, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say on."
verse	44	13	16	Then Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said, "Men of Israel, and you who reverence God, pay attention:
verse	44	13	17	The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and lifted up the people when they dwelt as foreigners in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He brought them out of it.
verse	44	13	18	Now for a time of about forty years He endured with their ways in the wilderness.
verse	44	13	19	And when He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He distributed their land to them by allotment.
verse	44	13	20	"And after that He gave judges to them for the period of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
verse	44	13	21	And afterward they desired a king; so God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for the period of forty years.
verse	44	13	22	And when He had removed him, He raised up for them David to be their king, to whom also He gave testimony and said, 'I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after My own heart, who will fulfill all My will.'
verse	44	13	23	From this man's seed, according to His promise, has God raised up for Israel a Savior, Jesus;
verse	44	13	24	after John had first preached, before His coming, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verse	44	13	25	And as John fulfilled his course, he said, 'Who do you think I am? I am not He. But behold, there comes One after me, the sandals of His feet I am not worthy to loose.'
verse	44	13	26	"Men and brethren, children of the family of Abraham, and those among you who reverence God, to you the word of this salvation has been sent.
verse	44	13	27	Because, those who dwell in Jerusalem, and their rulers, since they did not know Him, nor even the voices of the Prophets which are read every Sabbath day, have fulfilled them in condemning Him.
verse	44	13	28	And though they found no reason for death in Him, they asked Pilate that He should be killed.
verse	44	13	29	Now when they had fulfilled all that was written concerning Him, they took Him down from the tree and laid Him in a tomb.
verse	44	13	30	But God raised Him from the dead.
verse	44	13	31	He was seen for many days by those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are His witnesses to the people.
verse	44	13	32	And we declare to you glad tidings; how that promise which was made to the fathers,
verse	44	13	33	God has fulfilled this for us their children, in that He has raised up Jesus again. As it is also written in the second Psalm: 'You are My Son, today I have begotten You.'
verse	44	13	34	And concerning how He raised Him from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, He has spoken in this way: 'I will give you the sure mercies of David.'
verse	44	13	35	Therefore He also says in another Psalm: 'You will not allow Your Holy One to see corruption.'
verse	44	13	36	"Because David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell asleep, was buried with his fathers, and saw corruption;
verse	44	13	37	but He whom God raised up saw no corruption.
verse	44	13	38	Therefore let it be known to you, men and brethren, that through this Man is preached to you the forgiveness of sins;
verse	44	13	39	and by Him everyone who believes is justified from all things from which you could not be justified by the law of Moses.
verse	44	13	40	Beware therefore, lest what has been spoken in the prophets come upon you:
verse	44	13	41	'Behold, you despisers, marvel and perish! Because, I work a work in your days, a work which you will by no means believe, though one were to declare it to you.'"
verse	44	13	42	So when the Jews had gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.
verse	44	13	43	Now when the congregation had broken up, many of the Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
verse	44	13	44	And the next Sabbath day almost the entire city came together to hear the word of God.
verse	44	13	45	But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with envy; and contradicting and blaspheming, they spoke against the things spoken by Paul.
verse	44	13	46	Then Paul and Barnabas grew bold and said, "It was necessary that the word of God should be spoken to you first; but since you reject it, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.
verse	44	13	47	Because, so has the Lord commanded us, saying 'I have set you as a light to the Gentiles, that you should exist for salvation to the ends of the earth.'"
verse	44	13	48	Now when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and glorified the word of the Lord. And as many as believed were ordained to eternal life.
verse	44	13	49	And the word of the Lord was being spread throughout the entire region.
verse	44	13	50	But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them from their region.
verse	44	13	51	But they shook off the dust from their feet against them, and came to Iconium.
verse	44	13	52	And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
verse	44	14	1	Now it happened in Iconium that they both went together to the synagogue of the Jews, and spoke in such a way that a large crowd both of the Jews and of the Greeks believed.
verse	44	14	2	But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brethren.
verse	44	14	3	Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord, who gave testimony to the word of His grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
verse	44	14	4	But the population of the city was divided: part sided with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
verse	44	14	5	And when a violent attempt was made by both the Gentiles and Jews, with their rulers, to abuse them, and to stone them,
verse	44	14	6	they were aware of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding region.
verse	44	14	7	And they preached the gospel there.
verse	44	14	8	And in Lystra a certain man without strength in his feet was sitting, being a cripple from his mother's womb, who had never walked.
verse	44	14	9	This man heard Paul speaking, who observing him intently and seeing that he had faith to be healed,
verse	44	14	10	said with a loud voice, "Stand up straight on your feet!" And he leaped and walked.
verse	44	14	11	Now when the people saw what Paul had done, they raised their voices, saying in the Lycaonian language, "The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!"
verse	44	14	12	And Barnabas they called Jupiter, and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
verse	44	14	13	Then the priest of Jupiter, who was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, intending to do sacrifice with the people.
verse	44	14	14	But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard this, they tore their clothes and ran in among the people, shouting out
verse	44	14	15	and saying, "Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men with a similar nature to you, and preach to you that you should turn from these useless things to the living God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all things that are in them,
verse	44	14	16	who in times past allowed all nations to walk in their own ways.
verse	44	14	17	Nevertheless He did not leave Himself without witness, in that He did good, gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness."
verse	44	14	18	And with these sayings they could barely restrain the people from sacrificing to them.
verse	44	14	19	Then certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there; who persuaded the people, and having stoned Paul, dragged him out of the city, supposing him to be dead.
verse	44	14	20	However, when the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went into the city. And the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
verse	44	14	21	And when they had preached the gospel to that city and taught many, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,
verse	44	14	22	strengthening the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that through many tribulations we must enter the kingdom of God.
verse	44	14	23	So when they had appointed elders in every church, and prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed.
verse	44	14	24	And after they had passed through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
verse	44	14	25	Now when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia.
verse	44	14	26	From there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had completed.
verse	44	14	27	Now when they had come and gathered the church together, they reported all that God had done with them, and how He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.
verse	44	14	28	So they stayed there a long time with the disciples.
verse	44	15	1	And certain men who came down from Judea taught the brethren, and said "Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved."
verse	44	15	2	Therefore, when Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and dispute with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas and certain others of them should go up to Jerusalem, to the apostles and elders, about this question.
verse	44	15	3	So, being sent on their way by the church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, describing the conversion of the Gentiles; and they caused great joy to all the brethren.
verse	44	15	4	And when they had come to Jerusalem, they were received by the church and by the apostles and the elders; and they declared everything that God had done with them.
verse	44	15	5	But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up, saying, "It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses."
verse	44	15	6	Now the apostles and elders came together to consider this matter.
verse	44	15	7	And when there had been a great disputation, Peter rose up and said to them: "Men and brethren, you know that a good while ago God chose among us, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe.
verse	44	15	8	So God, who knows the heart, bore witness to them by giving them the Holy Spirit, just as He did to us,
verse	44	15	9	and made no distinction between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
verse	44	15	10	Now therefore, why do you test God by putting a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
verse	44	15	11	But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we will be saved in the same manner as they."
verse	44	15	12	Then all the multitude kept silent and listened to Barnabas and Paul declaring what miracles and wonders God had worked through them among the Gentiles.
verse	44	15	13	And after they had become silent, James replied, saying, "Men and brethren, listen to me:
verse	44	15	14	Simon has declared how God at the first visited the Gentiles to take out of them a people for His name.
verse	44	15	15	And with this the words of the prophets agree, as it is written:
verse	44	15	16	'After this I will return and will rebuild the tabernacle of David, which has fallen down; I will rebuild its ruins, and I will set it up;
verse	44	15	17	So that the remainder of the people may seek the Lord, and all the Gentiles who are called by My name, says the Lord who does all these things.'
verse	44	15	18	"Known to God are all His works from the beginning of the world.
verse	44	15	19	Therefore my judgment is that we should not trouble those from among the Gentiles who have turned to God,
verse	44	15	20	but that we write to them that they abstain from things polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from things strangled, and from blood.
verse	44	15	21	Because, Moses has those who preach him in every city from old times, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath day."
verse	44	15	22	Then it pleased the apostles and elders, with the entire church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, leading men among the brethren.
verse	44	15	23	They wrote letters by them according to this manner: The apostles, the elders, and the brethren, send greetings to the brethren who are of the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia.
verse	44	15	24	Since we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, "You must be circumcised and keep the law," to whom we gave no such commandment ,
verse	44	15	25	it seemed good to us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
verse	44	15	26	men who have endangered their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	44	15	27	We have therefore sent Judas and Silas, who will also tell you the same things by mouth.
verse	44	15	28	Because, it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things:
verse	44	15	29	that you abstain from food offered to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from these, you will do well. Farewell.
verse	44	15	30	So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch; and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.
verse	44	15	31	Which when they had read, they rejoiced over its encouragement.
verse	44	15	32	Now Judas and Silas, themselves being prophets also, exhorted the brethren with many words and confirmed them.
verse	44	15	33	And after they had stayed there for a time, they were let go in peace from the brethren to the apostles.
verse	44	15	34	However, it seemed good to Silas to remain there.
verse	44	15	35	Paul and Barnabas also remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
verse	44	15	36	Then after some days Paul said to Barnabas, "Let us now go back and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they are doing."
verse	44	15	37	Now Barnabas was determined to take with them John whose surname was Mark.
verse	44	15	38	But Paul did not think it good to take him with them, who had departed from them in Pamphylia, and had not gone with them to the work.
verse	44	15	39	Then the contention became so sharp that they parted from one another. And so Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus;
verse	44	15	40	but Paul chose Silas and departed, being commended by the brethren to the grace of God.
verse	44	15	41	And he went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
verse	44	16	1	Then he came to Derbe and Lystra. And behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a certain Jewish woman who believed, but his father was a Greek.
verse	44	16	2	He was well reported of by the brethren who were at Lystra and Iconium.
verse	44	16	3	Paul wanted to have him go on with him. And he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in that region, because they all knew that his father was a Greek.
verse	44	16	4	And as they went through the cities, they delivered to them the decrees to keep, which were determined by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem.
verse	44	16	5	And so the churches were established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
verse	44	16	6	Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to preach the word in Asia.
verse	44	16	7	After they had come to Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit did not permit them.
verse	44	16	8	So passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.
verse	44	16	9	And a vision appeared to Paul in the night. A man of Macedonia stood and pleaded with him, saying, "Come over to Macedonia and help us."
verse	44	16	10	Now after he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go to Macedonia, concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the gospel to them.
verse	44	16	11	Therefore, untying from Troas, we ran a straight course to Samothrace, and the next day to Neapolis,
verse	44	16	12	and from there to Philippi, which is the foremost city of that part of Macedonia and a colony. And we were staying in that city for some days.
verse	44	16	13	And on the Sabbath we went out of the city to the riverside, where prayer was customarily made; and we sat down and spoke to the women who met there.
verse	44	16	14	Now a certain woman named Lydia heard us. She was a seller of purple from the city of Thyatira, who worshiped God. The Lord opened her heart to heed the things that were spoken by Paul.
verse	44	16	15	And when she and her household were baptized, she begged us, saying, "If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and stay there." So she persuaded us.
verse	44	16	16	Now it happened, as we went to prayer, that a certain girl possessed with a spirit of divination met us, who brought her masters much profit by fortune telling.
verse	44	16	17	This girl followed Paul and us, and shouted, saying, "These men are the servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us the way of salvation."
verse	44	16	18	And this she did for many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, "I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her." And he came out that very hour.
verse	44	16	19	But when her masters saw that their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace to the authorities.
verse	44	16	20	And they brought them to the magistrates, and said, "These men, being Jews, greatly trouble our city;
verse	44	16	21	and they teach customs which are not lawful for us to receive or to observe being Romans."
verse	44	16	22	Then the crowd rose up together against them; and the magistrates tore off their clothes and commanded them to beat them.
verse	44	16	23	And when they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, commanding the jailer to keep them securely.
verse	44	16	24	Having received such an order, he put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.
verse	44	16	25	But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing praises to God, and the prisoners listened to them.
verse	44	16	26	Then suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone's chains were loosed.
verse	44	16	27	And the keeper of the prison, awaking from sleep and seeing the prison doors open, supposing the prisoners had fled, drew his sword and would have killed himself.
verse	44	16	28	But Paul shouted with a loud voice, saying, "Do yourself no harm, because we are all here."
verse	44	16	29	Then he called for a light, ran in, and fell down trembling before Paul and Silas.
verse	44	16	30	And he brought them out and said, "Men, what must I do to be saved?"
verse	44	16	31	So they said, "Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and you and your household will be saved."
verse	44	16	32	Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house.
verse	44	16	33	And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their stripes. And immediately he and all his family were baptized.
verse	44	16	34	Now when he had brought them into his house, he set food before them; and he rejoiced, having believed in God with his entire household.
verse	44	16	35	And when it was day, the magistrates sent the officers, saying, "Let those men go."
verse	44	16	36	So the keeper of the prison reported these words to Paul, saying, "The magistrates have sent to let you go. Now therefore depart, and go in peace."
verse	44	16	37	But Paul said to them, "They have beaten us openly, being uncondemned Romans, and have thrown us into prison. And now do they put us out secretly? No indeed! But let them come themselves and get us out."
verse	44	16	38	And the officers told these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans.
verse	44	16	39	Then they came and pleaded with them and brought them out, and asked them to depart from the city.
verse	44	16	40	So they went out of the prison and entered the house of Lydia; and when they had seen the brethren, they encouraged them and departed.
verse	44	17	1	Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.
verse	44	17	2	Then Paul, as his custom was, went in to them, and for three Sabbath days reasoned with them from the Scriptures,
verse	44	17	3	explaining and demonstrating that Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead, and saying, "This Jesus whom I preach to you is Christ."
verse	44	17	4	And some of them believed; and a large multitude of the devout Greeks, and not a few of the leading women, joined Paul and Silas.
verse	44	17	5	But the Jews who did not believe, becoming envious, took some of the wicked men of a vulgar sort, and gathering a mob, set the entire city in an uproar and attacked the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
verse	44	17	6	But when they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some brethren to the rulers of the city, shouting, "These who have turned the world upside down have come here also,
verse	44	17	7	Jason has harbored them, and these are all acting contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying there is another king, one Jesus."
verse	44	17	8	And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city when they heard these things.
verse	44	17	9	So when they had taken enough security from Jason and from the rest, they let them go.
verse	44	17	10	Then the brethren immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea. When they arrived, they went into the synagogue of the Jews.
verse	44	17	11	These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the Scriptures daily whether these things were so.
verse	44	17	12	Therefore many of them believed, and also not a few of the Greeks, prominent women as well as men.
verse	44	17	13	But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was preached by Paul at Berea, they came there also and stirred up the people.
verse	44	17	14	And then immediately the brethren sent Paul away, to go as it were to the sea; but both Silas and Timothy remained there.
verse	44	17	15	So those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens; and receiving a command for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they departed.
verse	44	17	16	Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred within him when he saw that the city was entirely given over to idolatry.
verse	44	17	17	Therefore he disputed in the synagogue with the Jews and with the devout people, and in the marketplace daily with those who met with him.
verse	44	17	18	Then some of the Epicurean and of the Stoic philosophers encountered him. And some said, "What does this babbler say?" Others said, "He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods," because he preached to them Jesus and the resurrection.
verse	44	17	19	And they took him and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, "May we know what this new doctrine is of which you speak?
verse	44	17	20	Because, you are bringing some strange things to our ears. Therefore we want to know what these things mean."
verse	44	17	21	Because, all the Athenians and the foreigners who were there spent their time in nothing else except to tell or to hear something new.
verse	44	17	22	Then Paul stood in the midst of the Mars' Hill and said, "You men of Athens, I perceive that in all things you are too superstitious;
verse	44	17	23	because, as I was passing by and considering the objects of your worship, I found an altar with this inscription: TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Therefore, the One whom you ignorantly worship, Him I proclaim to you:
verse	44	17	24	"God, who made the world and everything in it, since He is Lord of heaven and earth, does not dwell in temples made with hands.
verse	44	17	25	Nor is He worshiped with men's hands, as though He needed anything, since He gives to all life, breath, and all things.
verse	44	17	26	And He has made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the face of the earth, and has determined their preappointed times and the boundaries of their dwellings,
verse	44	17	27	so that they should seek the Lord, in the hope that they might seek for Him and find Him, though He is not far from each one of us;
verse	44	17	28	because in Him we live and move and have our being, as also some of your own poets have said, 'because we are also His offspring.'
verse	44	17	29	Therefore, since we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like gold or silver or stone, something shaped by art and man's devising.
verse	44	17	30	And, these times of such ignorance God overlooked, but now commands all men everywhere to repent,
verse	44	17	31	because He has appointed a day on which He will judge the world in righteousness by that Man whom He has ordained. He has given assurance of this to all people by raising Him from the dead."
verse	44	17	32	And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked, while others said, "We will hear you again on this matter."
verse	44	17	33	So Paul departed from among them.
verse	44	17	34	However, some men joined him and believed, among them was Dionysius the Areopagite, a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
verse	44	18	1	After these things Paul departed from Athens and came to Corinth.
verse	44	18	2	And he found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla (because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome); and he came to them.
verse	44	18	3	So, because he was of the same trade, he stayed with them and worked; because by occupation they were tentmakers.
verse	44	18	4	And he reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded both Jews and Greeks.
verse	44	18	5	And when Silas and Timothy had come from Macedonia, Paul was compelled by the Spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ.
verse	44	18	6	But when they opposed themselves and blasphemed, he shook his clothes and said to them, "Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean. From now on I will go to the Gentiles."
verse	44	18	7	And he departed from there and entered the house of a certain man named Justus, one who worshiped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.
verse	44	18	8	Then Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with his entire household. And many of the Corinthians, hearing, believed and were baptized.
verse	44	18	9	Now the Lord spoke to Paul in the night by a vision, "Do not be afraid, but speak, and do not keep silent;"
verse	44	18	10	because I am with you, and no one will attack you to hurt you; because I have many people in this city."
verse	44	18	11	And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
verse	44	18	12	When Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him to the judgment seat,
verse	44	18	13	saying, "This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law."
verse	44	18	14	And when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, "If it were a matter of wrongdoing or wicked crimes, O Jews, there would be reason why I should bear with you.
verse	44	18	15	But if it is a question of words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves; because I do not want to be a judge of such matters."
verse	44	18	16	And he drove them from the judgment seat.
verse	44	18	17	Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. But Gallio took no notice of these things.
verse	44	18	18	So after this Paul still remained there a good while. Then he took leave of the brethren and sailed there into Syria, and Priscilla and Aquila were with him; having shaved his head at Cenchrea, because he had taken a vow.
verse	44	18	19	And he came to Ephesus, and left them there; but he himself entered the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.
verse	44	18	20	When they asked him to stay a longer time with them, he did not consent,
verse	44	18	21	but bid them goodbye, saying, "I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem; but I will return again to you, God willing." And he sailed from Ephesus.
verse	44	18	22	And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up and greeted the church, he went down to Antioch.
verse	44	18	23	After he had spent some time there, he departed and went over the entire region of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
verse	44	18	24	Now a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man and mighty in the Scriptures, came to Ephesus.
verse	44	18	25	This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught diligently the things of the Lord, though he knew only the baptism of John.
verse	44	18	26	So he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Aquila and Priscilla heard him, they took him aside and explained to him the way of God more exactly.
verse	44	18	27	And when he desired to cross to Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him; and when he arrived, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace;
verse	44	18	28	because he effectively refuted the Jews, doing so publicly, showing from the Scriptures that Jesus is the Christ.
verse	44	19	1	And it happened, while Apollos was at Corinth, that Paul, having passed through the upper regions, came to Ephesus. And finding certain disciples
verse	44	19	2	he said to them, "Have you received the Holy Spirit since you believed?" But they said to him, "We have not so much as heard whether there is a Holy Spirit."
verse	44	19	3	And he said to them, "Into what then were you baptized?" And they said, "Into John's baptism."
