verse	45	8	39	nor height nor depth, nor any other creature, will be able to separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verse	45	9	1	I tell the truth in Christ, I am not lying, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Spirit,
verse	45	9	2	that I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.
verse	45	9	3	Because, I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my countrymen according to the flesh,
verse	45	9	4	who are Israelites, to whom pertain the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service of God, and the promises;
verse	45	9	5	of whom are the fathers and of whom, according to the flesh, Christ came, who is over all, blessed by God forever. Amen.
verse	45	9	6	But it is not that the word of God has taken no effect. Because, they are not all Israel who are of Israel,
verse	45	9	7	nor are they all children because they are the seed of Abraham; but, "In Isaac your seed will be called."
verse	45	9	8	That is, those who are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God; but the children of the promise are counted as the seed.
verse	45	9	9	Because, this is the word of promise: "At this time I will come and Sarah will have a son."
verse	45	9	10	And not only this, but when Rebecca also had conceived by one man, that is by our father Isaac
verse	45	9	11	(because, the children being not yet born, nor having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works but of Him who calls),
verse	45	9	12	it was said to her, "The older will serve the younger."
verse	45	9	13	As it is written, "Jacob I have loved, but Esau I have hated."
verse	45	9	14	What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? God forbid!
verse	45	9	15	Because, He says to Moses, "I will have mercy on whomever I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whomever I will have compassion."
verse	45	9	16	So then it is not of him who wills, nor of him who runs, but of God who shows mercy.
verse	45	9	17	Because, the Scripture says to the Pharaoh, "For this very purpose I have raised you up, that I may show My power in you, and that My name may be declared throughout all the earth."
verse	45	9	18	Therefore He has mercy on whom He will have mercy, and whom He wills He hardens.
verse	45	9	19	You will say to me then, "Why does He still find fault? Because who has resisted His will?"
verse	45	9	20	But indeed, O man, who are you to reply against God? Shall the thing formed say to him who formed it, "Why have you made me like this?"
verse	45	9	21	Does not the potter have power over the clay, from the same lump to make one vessel for honor and another for dishonor?
verse	45	9	22	What if God, wanting to show His wrath and to make His power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath prepared for destruction,
verse	45	9	23	and that He might make known the riches of His glory on the vessels of mercy, which He had prepared beforehand for glory,
verse	45	9	24	even us whom He has called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?
verse	45	9	25	As He says also in Hosea: "I will call them My people, who were not My people, and her beloved, who was not beloved."
verse	45	9	26	"And it will come to pass that in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not My people,' There they will be called children of the living God."
verse	45	9	27	Isaiah also proclaims concerning Israel: "Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant will be saved.
verse	45	9	28	Because, He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness, because the Lord will make a short work upon the earth."
verse	45	9	29	And as Isaiah said before: "Unless the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we would have become like Sodom, and we would have been made like Gomorrah."
verse	45	9	30	What shall we say then? That Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith;
verse	45	9	31	but Israel, pursuing the law of righteousness, has not attained to the law of righteousness.
verse	45	9	32	Why? Because, they did not seek it by faith, but as it were, by the works of the law. Because they stumbled at that stumbling stone.
verse	45	9	33	As it is written: "Behold, I lay in Zion a stumbling stone and rock of offense, and whoever believes on Him will not be put to shame."
verse	45	10	1	Brethren, my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they might be saved.
verse	45	10	2	Because, I bear them record that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.
verse	45	10	3	Because, they being ignorant of God's righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves to the righteousness of God.
verse	45	10	4	Because Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.
verse	45	10	5	Because, Moses writes about the righteousness which is of the law, "That the man who does those things shall live by them."
verse	45	10	6	But the righteousness that is of faith speaks in this way, "Do not say in your heart, 'Who shall ascend into heaven?'" (that is, to bring Christ down from above)
verse	45	10	7	or, "'Who shall descend into the abyss?'" (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).
verse	45	10	8	But what does it say? "The word is near you, even in your mouth and in your heart" (that is, the word of faith which we preach):
verse	45	10	9	that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and will believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.
verse	45	10	10	Because, with the heart one believes to righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made to salvation.
verse	45	10	11	Because, the Scripture says, "Whoever believes on Him will not be put to shame."
verse	45	10	12	Because, there is no distinction between the Jew and the Greek, because the same Lord over all is rich to all who call upon Him.
verse	45	10	13	Because "whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved."
verse	45	10	14	How then shall they call on Him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in Him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher?
verse	45	10	15	And how shall they preach unless they are sent? As it is written: "How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!"
verse	45	10	16	But they have not all obeyed the gospel. Because, Isaiah says, "LORD, who has believed our report?"
verse	45	10	17	So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
verse	45	10	18	But I say, have they not heard? Yes indeed: "Their sound has gone out to all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world."
verse	45	10	19	But I say, did Israel not know? First Moses says: "I will provoke you to jealousy by those who are not a people, and I will move you to anger by a foolish nation."
verse	45	10	20	But Isaiah is very bold and says: "I was found by those who did not seek Me; I was made manifest to those who did not ask for Me."
verse	45	10	21	But to Israel he says: "All day long I have stretched out My hands to a disobedient and contrary people."
verse	45	11	1	I say then, has God cast away His people? God forbid! Because, I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
verse	45	11	2	God has not cast away His people whom He foreknew. Or do you not know what the Scripture says of Elijah, how he makes intercession to God against Israel, saying,
verse	45	11	3	"LORD, they have killed Your prophets and torn down Your altars, and I alone am left, and they seek my life"?
verse	45	11	4	But what does God reply to him? "I have reserved for Myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal."
verse	45	11	5	Even so then, at this present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
verse	45	11	6	And if by grace, then it is no longer of works; otherwise grace is no longer grace. But if it is of works, it is no longer grace; otherwise work is no longer work.
verse	45	11	7	What then? Israel has not obtained what it seeks after; but the elect have obtained it, and the rest were blinded.
verse	45	11	8	Just as it is written: "God has given them a spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see and ears that they should not hear, to this very day."
verse	45	11	9	And David says: "Let their table become a snare and a trap, a stumbling block and a retribution to them.
verse	45	11	10	Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see, and bow down their back always."
verse	45	11	11	I say then, have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid! But rather through their fall, salvation has come to the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy,
verse	45	11	12	Now if their fall became riches of the world, and their failure the riches of the Gentiles, how much more their fullness!
verse	45	11	13	Because, I speak to you Gentiles; inasmuch as I am an apostle to the Gentiles, I magnify my ministry,
verse	45	11	14	if by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh and might save some of them.
verse	45	11	15	Because, if their rejection is the reconciling of the world, what shall their acceptance be but life from the dead?
verse	45	11	16	Because, if the firstfruit is holy, the lump is also holy; and if the root is holy, so are the branches.
verse	45	11	17	And if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive tree, were grafted in among them, and with them became a partaker of the root and nourishment of the olive tree,
verse	45	11	18	do not boast against the branches. But if you do boast, remember that you do not support the root, but the root supports you.
verse	45	11	19	You will say then, "Branches were broken off that I might be grafted in."
verse	45	11	20	Well said. Because of unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by faith. Do not be highminded, but have reverence.
verse	45	11	21	Because, if God did not spare the natural branches, He may not spare you either.
verse	45	11	22	Therefore consider the goodness and severity of God: on those who fell, severity; but toward you, goodness, if you continue in His goodness. Otherwise you also will be cut off.
verse	45	11	23	And they also, if they do not continue in unbelief, will be grafted in, because God is able to graft them in again.
verse	45	11	24	Because, if you were cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and were grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree, how much more will these, who are natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?
verse	45	11	25	Because, I do not desire, brethren, that you should be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own opinion, that blindness in part has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in.
verse	45	11	26	And so all Israel will be saved, as it is written: "The Deliverer will come out of Zion, and He will turn away ungodliness from Jacob;
verse	45	11	27	Because, this is My covenant with them, when I will take away their sins."
verse	45	11	28	Concerning the gospel they are enemies for your sake, but concerning the election they are beloved because of the fathers.
verse	45	11	29	Because the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.
verse	45	11	30	Because, as you previously did not believe God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief,
verse	45	11	31	even so these also have now not believed, that through the mercy shown you they also may obtain mercy.
verse	45	11	32	Because, God has concluded them all in unbelief, that He might have mercy on all.
verse	45	11	33	Oh, the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and His ways past finding out!
verse	45	11	34	"Because, who has known the mind of the LORD? Or who has become His counselor?"
verse	45	11	35	"Or who has first given to Him and it will be repaid back to him?"
verse	45	11	36	Because, of Him and through Him and to Him are all things, to whom be glory forever. Amen.
verse	45	12	1	I urge you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.
verse	45	12	2	And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.
verse	45	12	3	Because I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think soberly, just as God has dealt to each one a measure of faith.
verse	45	12	4	Because, as we have many members in one body, but all the members do not have the same function,
verse	45	12	5	so we, being many, are one body in Christ, and individually members of one another.
verse	45	12	6	Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us: if prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;
verse	45	12	7	or ministry, let us use it in our ministering; he who teaches, in teaching;
verse	45	12	8	he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives, let him do it with liberality; he who leads, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.
verse	45	12	9	Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor what is evil. Cling to what is good.
verse	45	12	10	Be kindly affectionate to one another with brotherly love, in honor giving preference to one another;
verse	45	12	11	not lagging in diligence, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord;
verse	45	12	12	rejoicing in hope, patient in tribulation, continuing steadfastly in prayer;
verse	45	12	13	distributing to the needs of the saints, given to hospitality.
verse	45	12	14	Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.
verse	45	12	15	Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.
verse	45	12	16	Be of the same mind toward one another. Do not set your mind on high things, but associate with the humble. Do not be wise in your own opinion.
verse	45	12	17	Repay no one evil for evil. Provide things that are honest in the sight of everyone.
verse	45	12	18	If it is possible, as much as depends on you, live peaceably with everyone.
verse	45	12	19	Beloved, do not avenge yourselves, but rather give place to wrath; because it is written, "Vengeance is Mine, I will repay," says the Lord.
verse	45	12	20	Therefore "If your enemy hungers, feed him; if he thirsts, give him a drink; because in so doing you will heap coals of fire on his head."
verse	45	12	21	Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
verse	45	13	1	Let every soul be subject to the governing authorities. Because, there is no authority except from God; the authorities that exist are appointed by God.
verse	45	13	2	Therefore whoever resists the authority resists the ordinance of God, and those who resist will bring damnation on themselves.
verse	45	13	3	Because, rulers are not a terror to good conduct, but to evil. Do you want to be unafraid of the authority? Do what is good, and you will have praise from the same.
verse	45	13	4	Because, he is God's minister to you for good. But if you do that which is evil, be afraid; because he does not bear the sword in vain; because he is God's minister, an avenger to execute wrath on him who does evil.
verse	45	13	5	Therefore you must be subject, not only because of wrath but also for conscience' sake.
verse	45	13	6	Because, for this reason you also pay taxes, because they are God's ministers attending continually to this very thing.
verse	45	13	7	Render therefore to all their due: taxes to whom taxes are due, customs to whom customs, reverence to whom reverence, honor to whom honor.
verse	45	13	8	Owe no one anything except to love one another, because he who loves another has fulfilled the law.
verse	45	13	9	Because these, "You shall not commit adultery," "You shall not murder," "You shall not steal," "You shall not bear false witness," "You shall not covet," and if there is any other commandment, are all summed up in this saying, namely, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself."
verse	45	13	10	Love does no harm to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.
verse	45	13	11	And this, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep; because now our salvation is nearer than when we first believed.
verse	45	13	12	The night is well advanced, the day is at hand. Therefore let us cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.
verse	45	13	13	Let us walk honestly, as in the day, not in revelry and drunkenness, not in lewdness and lust, not in strife and envy.
verse	45	13	14	But you, put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, to fulfill its lusts.
verse	45	14	1	Receive one who is weak in the faith, but not to disputes over doubtful things.
verse	45	14	2	Because, one believes he may eat all things, but he who is weak eats only vegetables.
verse	45	14	3	Let not him who eats despise him who does not eat, and let not him who does not eat judge him who eats; because God has received him.
verse	45	14	4	Who are you to judge another's servant? To his own master he stands or falls. Indeed, he will be able to stand, because God is able to make him stand.
verse	45	14	5	One person esteems one day above another; another esteems every day alike. Let each be fully convinced in his own mind.
verse	45	14	6	He who observes the day, observes it to the Lord; and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it. He who eats, eats to the Lord, because he gives God thanks; and he who does not eat, to the Lord he does not eat, and gives God thanks.
verse	45	14	7	Because none of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself.
verse	45	14	8	Because, if we live, we live to the Lord; and if we die, we die to the Lord. So whether we live or die, we are the Lord's.
verse	45	14	9	Because, for this purpose Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living.
verse	45	14	10	But why do you judge your brother? Or why do you show contempt for your brother? Because we will all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
verse	45	14	11	Because, it is written: "As I live, says the LORD, every knee will bow to Me, and every tongue will confess to God."
verse	45	14	12	So then each of us will give account of himself to God.
verse	45	14	13	Therefore let us not judge one another anymore, but rather resolve this, not to put a stumbling block or a reason to fall in his brother's way.
verse	45	14	14	I know and am convinced by the Lord Jesus that there is nothing unclean of itself; but to him who considers anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
verse	45	14	15	But if your brother is grieved because of your food, you are no longer walking in love. Do not destroy with your food the one who Christ died for.
verse	45	14	16	Therefore do not let your good be spoken of as evil;
verse	45	14	17	because, the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
verse	45	14	18	Because, he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men.
verse	45	14	19	Therefore let us pursue the things which make for peace and the things by which one may edify another.
verse	45	14	20	Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All things indeed are pure, but it is evil for the man who eats with offense.
verse	45	14	21	It is good neither to eat meat nor drink grape juice nor do anything by which your brother stumbles or is offended or is made weak.
verse	45	14	22	Do you have faith? Have it to yourself before God. Happy is he who does not condemn himself in those things which he approves.
verse	45	14	23	But he who doubts is damned if he eats, because he does not eat from faith; because whatever is not from faith is sin.
verse	45	15	1	We then who are strong ought to bear with the failures of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
verse	45	15	2	Let each of us please his neighbor for his good, leading to edification.
verse	45	15	3	Because, even Christ did not please Himself; but as it is written, "The reproaches of those who reproached You fell on Me."
verse	45	15	4	Because, whatever things were written beforehand were written for our learning, that we through the patience and comfort of the Scriptures might have hope.
verse	45	15	5	Now may the God of patience and comfort grant you to be like minded toward one another, according to Christ Jesus,
verse	45	15	6	that you may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	45	15	7	You therefore, receive one another, just as Christ also received us, to the glory of God.
verse	45	15	8	Now I say that Jesus Christ has become a servant to the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises made to the fathers,
verse	45	15	9	and that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy, as it is written: "For this reason I will confess to You among the Gentiles, and sing to Your name."
verse	45	15	10	And again he says: "Rejoice, O Gentiles, with His people!"
verse	45	15	11	And again: "Praise the LORD, all you Gentiles! Laud Him, all you people!"
verse	45	15	12	And again, Isaiah says: "There will be a root of Jesse; and He who will rise to reign over the Gentiles, in Him the Gentiles will trust."
verse	45	15	13	Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope through the power of the Holy Spirit.
verse	45	15	14	Now I myself am persuaded concerning you, my brethren, that you also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.
verse	45	15	15	Nevertheless, brethren, I have written more boldly to you on some points, as reminding you, because of the grace given to me by God,
verse	45	15	16	that I might be a minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
verse	45	15	17	Therefore I have reason to glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.
verse	45	15	18	Because, I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not accomplished through me, in word and deed, to make the Gentiles obedient,
verse	45	15	19	in mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and round about to Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.
verse	45	15	20	Yes, so I have striven to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build on another man's foundation,
verse	45	15	21	but as it is written: "To whom He was not announced, they will see; and those who have not heard will understand."
verse	45	15	22	For this reason I also have been often hindered from coming to you.
verse	45	15	23	But now no longer having a place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come to you,
verse	45	15	24	whenever I take my journey to Spain, I will come to you. Because, I hope to see you on my journey, and to be helped on my way there by you, once I have enjoyed your company for a while.
verse	45	15	25	But now I am going to Jerusalem to minister to the saints.
verse	45	15	26	Because, it pleased those from Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints who are in Jerusalem.
verse	45	15	27	It has pleased them indeed, and they are their debtors. Because, if the Gentiles have been partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister to them in material things.
verse	45	15	28	Therefore, when I have performed this and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come via you into Spain.
verse	45	15	29	But I know that when I come to you, I will come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.
verse	45	15	30	Now I urge you, brethren, for the sake of the Lord Jesus Christ, and for the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in prayers to God for me,
verse	45	15	31	that I may be delivered from those in Judea who do not believe, and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be accepted by the saints,
verse	45	15	32	that I may come to you with joy by the will of God, and may be refreshed together with you.
verse	45	15	33	Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
verse	45	16	1	I commend to you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church in Cenchrea,
verse	45	16	2	that you may receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of the saints, and that you assist her in whatever business she has need of you; because she has been a helper of many and of myself also.
verse	45	16	3	Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my helpers in Christ Jesus,
verse	45	16	4	who risked their own necks for my life, to whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.
verse	45	16	5	Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Greet my beloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia to Christ.
verse	45	16	6	Greet Mary, who labored much for us.
verse	45	16	7	Greet Andronicus and Junia, my countrymen and my fellow prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.
verse	45	16	8	Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.
verse	45	16	9	Greet Urbanus, our helper in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.
verse	45	16	10	Greet Apelles, approved in Christ. Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus.
verse	45	16	11	Greet Herodion, my countryman. Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.
verse	45	16	12	Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Greet the beloved Persis, who labored much in the Lord.
verse	45	16	13	Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
verse	45	16	14	Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren who are with them.
verse	45	16	15	Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.
verse	45	16	16	Greet one another with a holy kiss. The churches of Christ greet you.
verse	45	16	17	Now I urge you, brethren, note those who cause divisions and offenses, contrary to the doctrine which you learned, and avoid them.
verse	45	16	18	Because, those who are such do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly, and by smooth words and flattering speech deceive the hearts of the simple.
verse	45	16	19	Because, your obedience has become known to everyone. Therefore I am glad on your behalf; but I want you to be wise in what is good, and simple concerning evil.
verse	45	16	20	And the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
verse	45	16	21	Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my countrymen, greet you.
verse	45	16	22	I, Tertius, who wrote this letter, greet you in the Lord.
verse	45	16	23	Gaius, my host and the host of the entire church, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, and Quartus, a brother.
verse	45	16	24	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verse	45	16	25	Now to Him who is mighty to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery kept secret since the ages began
verse	45	16	26	but is now made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, made known to all nations, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, for obedience to the faith,
verse	45	16	27	to God, alone wise, be glory through Jesus Christ forever. Amen.
verse	46	1	1	Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,
verse	46	1	2	To the church of God which is at Corinth, to those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all who in every place call on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:
verse	46	1	3	Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	46	1	4	I thank my God always concerning you for the grace of God which was given to you by Jesus Christ,
verse	46	1	5	that you are enriched in everything by Him in all utterance and in all knowledge,
verse	46	1	6	even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you,
verse	46	1	7	so that you come short in no gift, waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	46	1	8	who will also confirm you to the end, that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	46	1	9	God is faithful, by whom you were called into the fellowship of His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
verse	46	1	10	Now I plead with you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
verse	46	1	11	Because, it has been declared to me concerning you, my brethren, by those of Chloe's household, that there are contentions among you.
verse	46	1	12	Now I say this, that each of you says, "I am of Paul," or "I am of Apollos," or "I am of Cephas," or "I am of Christ."
verse	46	1	13	Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?
verse	46	1	14	I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius,
verse	46	1	15	lest anyone should say that I had baptized in my own name.
verse	46	1	16	And, I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Besides, I do not know whether I baptized any other.
verse	46	1	17	Because, Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of no effect.
verse	46	1	18	Because, the preaching of the cross is foolishness to those who perish, but to us who are saved it is the power of God.
verse	46	1	19	Because it is written: "I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent."
verse	46	1	20	Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the disputer of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?
verse	46	1	21	Because since, in the wisdom of God, the world by wisdom did not know God, it pleased God through the foolishness of preaching to save those who believe.
verse	46	1	22	Because, Jews request a sign, and Greeks seek after wisdom;
verse	46	1	23	but we preach Christ crucified, to the Jews a stumbling block and to the Greeks foolishness,
verse	46	1	24	but to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
verse	46	1	25	Because, the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verse	46	1	26	Because, you see your calling, brethren, that not many wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, are called.
verse	46	1	27	But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to put to shame the wise, and God has chosen the weak things of the world to put to shame the things which are mighty;
verse	46	1	28	and the base things of the world and the things which are despised God has chosen, yes and the things which are not, to bring to nothing the things that are,
verse	46	1	29	that no flesh should glory in His presence.
verse	46	1	30	But of Him you are in Christ Jesus, who, from God, became for us wisdom and righteousness and sanctification and redemption,
verse	46	1	31	that, according to as it is written, "He who glories, let him glory in the Lord."
verse	46	2	1	And I, brethren, when I came to you, did not come with excellence of speech or of wisdom declaring to you the testimony of God.
verse	46	2	2	Because, I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified.
verse	46	2	3	And I was with you in weakness, in fear, and in much trembling.
verse	46	2	4	And my speech and my preaching was not with persuasive words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power,
verse	46	2	5	that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men but in the power of God.
verse	46	2	6	However, we speak wisdom among those who are perfect, yet not the wisdom of this age, nor of the rulers of this age, who come to nothing.
verse	46	2	7	But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, even the hidden wisdom which God ordained before the ages for our glory,
verse	46	2	8	which none of the rulers of this age knew; because, had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
verse	46	2	9	But as it is written: "Eye has not seen, nor ear heard, nor have entered into the heart of man the things which God has prepared for those who love Him."
verse	46	2	10	But God has revealed them to us by His Spirit. Because, the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God.
verse	46	2	11	Because, what man knows the things of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? Even so no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God.
verse	46	2	12	Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, that we might know the things that have been freely given to us from God.
verse	46	2	13	These things we also speak, not in words which man's wisdom teaches but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual.
verse	46	2	14	But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, because they are foolishness to him; nor can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned.
verse	46	2	15	But he who is spiritual judges all things, yet he himself is judged by no one.
verse	46	2	16	Because, "who has known the mind of the Lord that he may instruct Him?" But we have the mind of Christ.
verse	46	3	1	And I, brethren, could not speak to you as to spiritual people but as to carnal, even as to babes in Christ.
verse	46	3	2	I have fed you with milk and not with solid food; because until now you were not able to receive it, and even now you are still not able;
verse	46	3	3	because you are still carnal. Because where there is envy, strife, and divisions among you, are you not carnal and walk like men?
verse	46	3	4	Because when one says, "I am of Paul," and another, "I am of Apollos," are you not carnal?
verse	46	3	5	Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom you believed, as the Lord gave to each person?
verse	46	3	6	I have planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase.
verse	46	3	7	So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase.
verse	46	3	8	Now he who plants and he who waters are one, and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
verse	46	3	9	Because, we are God's coworkers; you are God's field, you are God's building.
verse	46	3	10	According to the grace of God which was given to me, as a wise master builder I have laid the foundation, and another builds on it. But let each one take heed how he builds on it.
verse	46	3	11	Because no other foundation can anyone lay than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
verse	46	3	12	Now if anyone builds on this foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, straw,
verse	46	3	13	each one's work will be revealed; because the Day will declare it, because it will be revealed by fire; and the fire will test each one's work, of what sort it is.
verse	46	3	14	If anyone's work which he has built on it endures, he will receive a reward.
verse	46	3	15	If anyone's work is burned, he will suffer loss; but he himself will be saved, yet so as through fire.
verse	46	3	16	Do you not know that you are the temple of God and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
verse	46	3	17	If anyone defiles the temple of God, God will destroy him. Because the temple of God is holy, which temple you are.
verse	46	3	18	Let no one deceive himself. If anyone among you seems to be wise in this age, let him become a fool that he may be wise.
verse	46	3	19	Because the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. Because it is written, "He traps the wise in their own craftiness";
verse	46	3	20	and again, "The LORD knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain."
verse	46	3	21	Therefore let no one boast in men. Because all things are yours:
verse	46	3	22	whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas, or the world or life or death, or things present or things to come; all are yours.
verse	46	3	23	And you are Christ's, and Christ is God's.
verse	46	4	1	Let a man so consider us, as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.
verse	46	4	2	Moreover it is required in stewards that one be found faithful.
verse	46	4	3	But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you or by a man's judgment. In fact, I do not even judge myself.
verse	46	4	4	Because, I know of nothing against myself, yet I am not justified by this; but He who judges me is the Lord.
verse	46	4	5	Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness and reveal the counsels of the hearts. And then each one's praise will come from God.
verse	46	4	6	Now these things, brethren, I have figuratively transferred to myself and Apollos for your sakes, that you may learn in us not to think about people beyond what is written, that none of you may be puffed up on behalf of one against the other.
verse	46	4	7	Because who makes you differ from another? And what do you have that you did not receive? Now if you did indeed receive it, why do you boast as if you had not received it?
verse	46	4	8	You are already full! You are already rich! You have reigned as kings without us; and indeed I could wish you did reign, that we also might reign with you!
verse	46	4	9	Because, I think that God has displayed us, the apostles, last, as men condemned to death; because we have been made a spectacle to the world, to angels and to men.
verse	46	4	10	We are fools for Christ's sake, but you are wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are honorable, but we are despised!
verse	46	4	11	Even to the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and we are unclothed, and beaten, and have no permanent home.
verse	46	4	12	And we labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we endure it;
verse	46	4	13	being defamed, we entreat. We have been made as the scum of the earth, and are the offscouring of all things to this day.
verse	46	4	14	I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn you.
verse	46	4	15	Because, though you might have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers; because in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.
verse	46	4	16	Therefore I urge you all, be followers of me.
verse	46	4	17	For this reason I have sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved and faithful son in the Lord, who will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every church.
verse	46	4	18	Now some are puffed up, as though I were not coming to you.
verse	46	4	19	But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord wills, and I will know, not the speech of those who are puffed up, but the power.
verse	46	4	20	Because the kingdom of God is not in word but in power.
verse	46	4	21	What do you want? Shall I come to you with a rod, or in love and in the spirit of meekness?
verse	46	5	1	It is commonly reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and such sexual immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles, that a man has his father's wife!
verse	46	5	2	And you are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he who has done this deed might be taken away from among you.
verse	46	5	3	Because, I indeed, as absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged (as though I were present) concerning him who has so done this deed,
verse	46	5	4	in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when you are gathered together, along with my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	46	5	5	to deliver such a one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verse	46	5	6	Your glorying is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the entire lump?
verse	46	5	7	Therefore purge out the old leaven, that you may be a new lump, since you truly are unleavened. Because, even Christ, our Passover, was sacrificed for us.
verse	46	5	8	Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
verse	46	5	9	I wrote to you in a letter not to keep company with sexually immoral people.
verse	46	5	10	Yet I certainly did not mean with the sexually immoral people of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or idolaters, since then you would need to go out of the world.
verse	46	5	11	But now I have written to you not to keep company with anyone that is named a brother, who is sexually immoral, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; not even to eat with such a person.
verse	46	5	12	Because, what have I to do with judging those also who are outside? Do you not judge those who are inside?
verse	46	5	13	But those who are outside God judges. Therefore "put away from yourselves that evil person."
verse	46	6	1	Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?
verse	46	6	2	Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? And if the world will be judged by you, are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters?
verse	46	6	3	Do you not know that we will judge angels? How much more, things that pertain to this life?
verse	46	6	4	If then you have judgments concerning things pertaining to this life, appoint those who are least esteemed in the church to judge!
verse	46	6	5	I say this to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you, not even one, who will be able to judge between his brethren?
verse	46	6	6	But brother goes to law against brother, and that before the unbelievers!
verse	46	6	7	Now therefore, it is already an utter failure for you, because you go to law against one another. Why do you not rather accept wrong? Why do you not rather allow yourselves be defrauded?
verse	46	6	8	No, you do wrong and defraud, and that to your brethren!
verse	46	6	9	Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived. Neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor abusers of themselves with mankind,
verse	46	6	10	nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God.
verse	46	6	11	And such were some of you. But you are washed, but you are sanctified, but you are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus and by the Spirit of our God.
verse	46	6	12	All things are lawful for me, but all things are not helpful. All things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the authority of any.
verse	46	6	13	Foods for the stomach and the stomach for foods, but God will destroy both it and them. Now the body is not for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
verse	46	6	14	And God has both raised up the Lord and will also raise us up by His own power.
verse	46	6	15	Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and make them the members of a harlot? God forbid!
verse	46	6	16	Or do you not know that he who is joined to a harlot is one body with her? Because "the two," He says, "will be one flesh."
verse	46	6	17	But he who is joined to the Lord is one spirit with Him.
verse	46	6	18	Flee sexual immorality. Every sin that a man does is outside the body, but he who commits sexual immorality sins against his own body.
verse	46	6	19	Or do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have from God, and you are not your own?
verse	46	6	20	Because, you were bought at a price; therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit, which are God's.
verse	46	7	1	Now concerning the things of which you wrote to me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman.
verse	46	7	2	Nevertheless, to avoid sexual immorality, let each man have his own wife, and let each woman have her own husband.
verse	46	7	3	Let the husband render to his wife the affection due her, and likewise also the wife to her husband.
verse	46	7	4	The wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does. And likewise the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does.
verse	46	7	5	Do not deprive one another except it be with consent for a time, that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again so that Satan does not tempt you because of your lack of self control.
verse	46	7	6	But I say this by permission, and not as a commandment.
verse	46	7	7	Because I wish that all men were even as I myself. But each one has his own gift from God, one in this manner and another in that.
verse	46	7	8	Therefore, I say to the unmarried and to the widows: It is good for them if they remain even as I am;
verse	46	7	9	but if they cannot exercise self control, let them marry. Because it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
verse	46	7	10	Now to the married I command, yet not I but the Lord: A wife is not to depart from her husband.
verse	46	7	11	But even if she does depart, let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband. And do not let a husband divorce his wife.
verse	46	7	12	But to the rest I, not the Lord, say: If any brother has a wife who does not believe, and she is willing to live with him, let him not divorce her.
verse	46	7	13	And a woman who has a husband who does not believe, if he is willing to live with her, let her not divorce him.
verse	46	7	14	Because, the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband; otherwise your children would be unclean, but now they are holy.
verse	46	7	15	But if the unbeliever departs, let him depart; a brother or a sister is not under bondage in such cases. But God has called us to peace.
verse	46	7	16	Because, how do you know, O wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, O husband, whether you will save your wife?
verse	46	7	17	But as God has distributed to each one, as the Lord has called each one, so let him walk. And so I ordain in all the churches.
verse	46	7	18	Was anyone called while circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Was anyone called while uncircumcised? Let him not be circumcised.
verse	46	7	19	Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing, but keeping the commandments of God.
verse	46	7	20	Let each one remain in the same calling in which he was called.
verse	46	7	21	Were you called while a servant? Do not be concerned about it; but if you can be made free, rather use it.
verse	46	7	22	Because he who is called in the Lord while a servant is the Lord's freedman. Likewise he who is called while free is Christ's servant.
verse	46	7	23	You were bought with a price; do not become servants of men.
verse	46	7	24	Brethren, let each one remain with God in that state in which he was called.
verse	46	7	25	Now concerning virgins: I have no commandment from the Lord; yet I give my judgment as one who has received mercy from the Lord to be faithful.
verse	46	7	26	I suppose therefore that this is good because of the present distress, I say that it is good for a man to remain as he is:
verse	46	7	27	Are you bound to a wife? Do not seek to be loosed. Are you loosed from a wife? Do not seek a wife.
verse	46	7	28	But even if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Nevertheless such will have trouble in the flesh, but I would spare you that.
verse	46	7	29	But this I say, brethren, the time is short, so that from now on even those who have wives should be as though they had none,
verse	46	7	30	those who weep as though they did not weep, those who rejoice as though they did not rejoice, those who buy as though they did not possess,
verse	46	7	31	and those who use this world as not misusing it. Because the form of this world is passing away.
verse	46	7	32	But I want you to be without worry. He who is unmarried cares for the things that pertain to the Lord, how he may please the Lord.
verse	46	7	33	But he who is married cares about the things that are of the world, how he may please his wife.
verse	46	7	34	There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares about the things of the world, how she may please her husband.
verse	46	7	35	And this I say for your own profit, not that I may put a snare on you, but for what is proper, and that you may serve the Lord without distraction.
verse	46	7	36	But if any man thinks he is behaving improperly toward his virgin, if she is past the flower of her age, and thus it must be, let him do what he wishes. He does not sin; let them marry.
verse	46	7	37	Nevertheless he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has power over his own will, and has so determined in his heart that he will keep his virgin, does well.
verse	46	7	38	So then he who gives her in marriage does well, but he who does not give her in marriage does better.
verse	46	7	39	A wife is bound by law as long as her husband lives; but if her husband dies, she is at liberty to be married to whom she wills, only in the Lord.
verse	46	7	40	But she is happier if she remains as she is, according to my judgment; and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.
verse	46	8	1	Now concerning things offered to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love edifies.
verse	46	8	2	And if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know.
verse	46	8	3	But if anyone loves God, this one is known of Him.
verse	46	8	4	Therefore concerning the eating of things that are offered in sacrifice to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God but one.
verse	46	8	5	Because, even if there are so called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as there are many gods and many lords),
verse	46	8	6	yet for us there is only one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we in Him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, even ourselves by Him.
verse	46	8	7	However, not everyone possesses that knowledge; but some, with consciousness of the idol, until now eat it as a thing offered to an idol; and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.
verse	46	8	8	But food does not commend us to God; because neither if we eat are we better off, nor if we do not eat are we worse off.
verse	46	8	9	But beware lest somehow this liberty of yours becomes a stumbling block to those who are weak.
verse	46	8	10	Because, if anyone sees you who have knowledge eating in an idol's temple, shall not the conscience of him who is weak be emboldened to eat those things offered to idols?
verse	46	8	11	And because of your knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?
verse	46	8	12	But when you all sin like this against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, you all sin against Christ.
verse	46	8	13	Therefore, if food makes my brother stumble, I will never eat meat while the world stands, lest I make my brother stumble.
verse	46	9	1	Am I not an apostle? Am I not free? Have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?
verse	46	9	2	If I am not an apostle to others, yet doubtless I am to you. Because, you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.
verse	46	9	3	My defense to those who examine me is this:
verse	46	9	4	Do we have no right to eat and drink?
verse	46	9	5	Do we have no right to take along a sister, a wife, as do also the other apostles, the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?
verse	46	9	6	Or is it only Barnabas and I who have no right to refrain from working?
verse	46	9	7	Who ever goes to war at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit? Or who tends a flock and does not drink of the milk of the flock?
verse	46	9	8	Do I say these things as a mere man? Or does not the law say the same also?
verse	46	9	9	Because, it is written in the law of Moses, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain." Is it oxen God is concerned about?
verse	46	9	10	Or does He say it entirely for our sakes? No doubt, this is written for our sakes, that he who plows should plow in hope, and he who threshes in hope should be partaker of his hope.
verse	46	9	11	If we have sown spiritual things for you, is it a great thing if we reap your material things?
verse	46	9	12	If others are partakers of this authority over you, are we not even more? Nevertheless we have not used this authority, but endure all things lest we hinder the gospel of Christ.
verse	46	9	13	Do you not know that those who minister the holy things eat of the things of the temple, and those who serve at the altar partake of the altar?
verse	46	9	14	Even so the Lord has ordained that those who preach the gospel should live from the gospel.
verse	46	9	15	But I have used none of these things, nor have I written these things that it should be done so to me; because it would be better for me to die than that anyone should make my boasting empty.
verse	46	9	16	Because, though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast about, because necessity is laid upon me; yes, woe is me if I do not preach the gospel!
verse	46	9	17	Because, if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward; but if against my will, I have been entrusted with a stewardship of the gospel.
verse	46	9	18	What is my reward then? Truly, that when I preach the gospel, I may present the gospel of Christ free of charge, that I may not abuse my authority in the gospel.
verse	46	9	19	Because, though I am free from all men, I have made myself a servant to all, that I might win the more;
verse	46	9	20	and to the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might win Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might win those who are under the law;
verse	46	9	21	to those who are without law, as without law (not being without law toward God, but under the law toward Christ), that I might win those who are without law;
verse	46	9	22	to the weak I became as weak, that I might win the weak. I have become all things to all men, that I might by all means save some.
verse	46	9	23	Now this I do for the gospel's sake, that I may be partaker of it with you.
verse	46	9	24	Do you not know that those who run in a race all run, but one receives the prize? Run in such a way that you may obtain it.
verse	46	9	25	And everyone who strives for dominance has self control in all things. Now they do it to obtain a perishable crown, but we for the imperishable.
verse	46	9	26	Therefore I do not run with uncertainty. So I do not fight as one who beats the air.
verse	46	9	27	But I discipline my body and bring it into subjection, lest in any way when I have preached to others, I myself should become an outcast.
verse	46	10	1	Moreover, brethren, I do not want you to be ignorant that all our fathers were under the cloud, all passed through the sea,
verse	46	10	2	all were baptized under Moses in the cloud and in the sea,
verse	46	10	3	all ate the same spiritual food,
verse	46	10	4	and all drank the same spiritual drink. Because, they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them, and that Rock was Christ.
verse	46	10	5	But with most of them God was not well pleased, because they were scattered in the wilderness.
verse	46	10	6	Now these things became our examples, to the intent that we should not lust after evil things as they also lusted.
verse	46	10	7	And do not become idolaters as were some of them. As it is written, "The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play."
verse	46	10	8	Nor let us commit sexual immorality, as some of them committed, and in one day twenty three thousand fell;
verse	46	10	9	nor let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed by serpents;
verse	46	10	10	nor complain, as some of them also complained, and were destroyed by the destroyer.
verse	46	10	11	Now all these things happened to them as examples, and they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages have come.
verse	46	10	12	Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed lest he fall.
verse	46	10	13	There is no temptation that has come upon you except such as is common to everyone; but God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation will also make the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it.
verse	46	10	14	Therefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.
verse	46	10	15	I speak as to wise men; judge for yourselves what I say.
verse	46	10	16	The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?
verse	46	10	17	Because we, though many, are one bread and one body; because we all partake of that one bread.
verse	46	10	18	Observe Israel according to the flesh: Are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?
verse	46	10	19	What am I saying then? That an idol is anything, or what is offered in sacrifice to idols is anything?
verse	46	10	20	Rather, I am saying that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God, and I do not want that you would have fellowship with demons.
verse	46	10	21	You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons; you cannot partake of the Lord's table and of the table of demons.
verse	46	10	22	Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than He?
verse	46	10	23	All things are lawful for me, but not all things are helpful; all things are lawful for me, but not all things edify.
verse	46	10	24	Let no one seek his own, but each one the other's well being.
verse	46	10	25	Eat whatever is sold in the meat market, asking no questions for conscience' sake;
verse	46	10	26	because "the earth is the LORD'S, and all its fullness."
verse	46	10	27	If any of those who do not believe invites you to a meal, and you desire to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no question for conscience' sake.
verse	46	10	28	But if anyone says to you, "This was offered to idols," do not eat it for the sake of the one who told you, and for conscience' sake; because "the earth is the LORD'S, and all its fullness."
verse	46	10	29	I do not say your own conscience, but that of the others. Because why is my liberty judged by another man's conscience?
verse	46	10	30	But if I partake with thanks, why am I evil spoken of for that over which I give thanks?
verse	46	10	31	Therefore, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.
verse	46	10	32	Give no offense, either to the Jews or to the Gentiles or to the church of God,
verse	46	10	33	just as I also please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.
verse	46	11	1	Be followers of me, just as I also am of Christ.
verse	46	11	2	Now I praise you, brethren, that you remember me in all things and keep the traditions just as I delivered them to you.
verse	46	11	3	But I want you to know that the head of every man is Christ, the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.
verse	46	11	4	Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonors his head.
verse	46	11	5	But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head, because, that is one and the same as if her head were shaved.
verse	46	11	6	Because, if a woman is not covered, let her also be shorn. But if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved, let her be covered.
verse	46	11	7	Because, a man indeed ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man.
verse	46	11	8	Because, the man is not from the woman, but the woman from the man.
verse	46	11	9	Nor was man created for the woman, but woman for the man.
verse	46	11	10	For this reason the woman ought to have a symbol of authority on her head, because of the angels.
verse	46	11	11	Nevertheless, neither is man independent of woman, nor woman independent of man, in the Lord.
verse	46	11	12	Because, as woman came from man, even so man also comes through woman; but all things are from God.
verse	46	11	13	Judge among yourselves. Is it proper for a woman to pray to God uncovered?
verse	46	11	14	Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?
verse	46	11	15	But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her; because her hair is given to her for a covering.
verse	46	11	16	But if anyone seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor do the churches of God.
verse	46	11	17	Now in giving these instructions to you I do not praise you, since you come together not for the better but for the worse.
verse	46	11	18	Because, first of all, when you come together in the church, I hear that there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it.
verse	46	11	19	Because, there must also be heresies among you, that those who are approved may be identified among you.
verse	46	11	20	Therefore when you come together into one place, this is not to eat the Lord's Supper.
verse	46	11	21	Because, in eating, each one takes his own supper ahead of others; and one is hungry and another drinks to the full.
verse	46	11	22	What! Do you not have houses to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and shame those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you in this? I do not praise you.
verse	46	11	23	Because, I received from the Lord that which I also delivered to you: that the Lord Jesus on the same night in which He was betrayed took bread;
verse	46	11	24	and when He had given thanks, He broke it and said, "Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me."
verse	46	11	25	In the same manner He also took the cup after supper, saying, "This cup is the new testament in My blood. This do, each time you drink it, in remembrance of Me."
verse	46	11	26	Because, every time you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord's death until He comes.
verse	46	11	27	Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
verse	46	11	28	But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup.
verse	46	11	29	Because, he who eats and drinks in an unworthy manner eats and drinks damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.
verse	46	11	30	For this reason many are weak and sick among you, and many sleep.
verse	46	11	31	Because if we would judge ourselves, we would not be judged.
verse	46	11	32	But when we are judged, we are chastened by the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.
verse	46	11	33	Therefore, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.
verse	46	11	34	But if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, lest you come together for condemnation. And the rest I will set in order when I come.
verse	46	12	1	Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I do not want you to be ignorant:
verse	46	12	2	You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these mute idols, however you were led.
verse	46	12	3	Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed, and that no one can say that Jesus is the Lord except by the Holy Spirit.
verse	46	12	4	Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.
verse	46	12	5	And there are differences of ministries, but the same Lord.
verse	46	12	6	And there are diversities of activities, but it is the same God who empowers them all in everyone.
verse	46	12	7	But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one for everyone's benefit.
verse	46	12	8	Because, to one is given the word of wisdom by the Spirit, to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit,
verse	46	12	9	to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by the same Spirit,
verse	46	12	10	to another the working of miracles, to another prophecy, to another discerning of spirits, to another different kinds of tongues, to another the interpretation of tongues.
verse	46	12	11	But these are empowered by one and the same Spirit, distributing to each one individually as He wills.
verse	46	12	12	Because, as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of that one body, being many, are one body, so also is Christ.
verse	46	12	13	Because, by one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether we are Jews or Greeks, whether we are slaves or free, and have all been made to drink into one Spirit.
verse	46	12	14	Because the body is not one member but many.
verse	46	12	15	If the foot should say, "Because I am not a hand, I am not of the body," is it therefore not of the body?
verse	46	12	16	And if the ear should say, "Because I am not an eye, I am not of the body," is it therefore not of the body?
verse	46	12	17	If the whole body were an eye, where would be the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where would be the smelling?
verse	46	12	18	But now God has arranged the members, each one of them, in the body just as He pleased.
verse	46	12	19	And if they were all one member, where would the body be?
verse	46	12	20	But now indeed there are many members, yet one body.
verse	46	12	21	And the eye cannot say to the hand, "I have no need of you"; nor again the head to the feet, "I have no need of you."
verse	46	12	22	No, on the contrary, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.
verse	46	12	23	And those members of the body which we think to be less honorable, on these we bestow more abundant honor; and our unpresentable parts have more abundant modesty,
verse	46	12	24	but our presentable parts have no lack. But God assembled together the body, having given more abundant honor to that part which lacked,
verse	46	12	25	that there should be no division in the body, but that the members should have the same care for one another.
verse	46	12	26	And if one member suffers, all the members suffer with it; or if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.
verse	46	12	27	Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually.
verse	46	12	28	And God has arranged these in the church: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, administrations, varieties of tongues.
verse	46	12	29	Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all workers of miracles?
verse	46	12	30	Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak with tongues? Do all interpret?
verse	46	12	31	But earnestly desire the best gifts. And yet I show you a more excellent way.
verse	46	13	1	Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but do not have love, I have become as sounding brass or a clanging cymbal.
verse	46	13	2	And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.
verse	46	13	3	And though I give all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, but have not love, it profits me nothing.
verse	46	13	4	Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up;
verse	46	13	5	does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not easily provoked, thinks no evil;
verse	46	13	6	does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth;
verse	46	13	7	bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
verse	46	13	8	Love never fails. But if there are prophecies, they will fail; if there are tongues, they will cease; if there is knowledge, it will vanish away.
verse	46	13	9	Because, we know in part and we prophesy in part.
verse	46	13	10	But when that which is perfect has come, then that which is in part will be done away.
verse	46	13	11	When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
verse	46	13	12	Because, now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I will know just as I also am known.
verse	46	13	13	So now faith, hope, and love, abide, these three; but the greatest of these is love.
verse	46	14	1	Pursue love, and desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.
verse	46	14	2	Because, he who speaks in an unknown tongue does not speak to men but to God, because no one understands him; however, in the spirit he speaks mysteries.
verse	46	14	3	But he who prophesies speaks edification and exhortation and comfort to men.
verse	46	14	4	He who speaks in an unknown tongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church.
verse	46	14	5	I wish you all spoke with tongues, but even more that you prophesied; because, he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks with tongues, unless he interprets, that the church may receive edification.
verse	46	14	6	Now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you unless I speak to you either by revelation, by knowledge, by prophesying, or by doctrine?
verse	46	14	7	Even things without life, whether flute or harp, when they make a sound, unless they make a distinction in the notes, how will it be known what is piped or played?
verse	46	14	8	Because, if the trumpet makes an uncertain sound, who will prepare themself for battle?
verse	46	14	9	So likewise you, unless you utter by the tongue words easy to understand, how will it be known what is spoken? Because you will be speaking into the air.
verse	46	14	10	There are, it may be, so many kinds of languages in the world, and none of them is without significance.
verse	46	14	11	Therefore, if I do not know the meaning of the language, I will be a foreigner to him who speaks, and he who speaks will be a foreigner to me.
verse	46	14	12	Even so you, since you are zealous for spiritual gifts, seek that you may excel for the edification of the church.
verse	46	14	13	Therefore let him who speaks in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret.
verse	46	14	14	Because, if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.
verse	46	14	15	What is the conclusion then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will also pray with the understanding. I will sing with the spirit, and I will also sing with the understanding.
verse	46	14	16	Otherwise, if you bless with the spirit, how will he who occupies the place of the uninformed say "Amen" at your giving of thanks, since he does not understand what you say?
verse	46	14	17	Because, you indeed give thanks well, but the other is not edified.
verse	46	14	18	I thank my God I speak with tongues more than you all;
verse	46	14	19	yet in the church I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that by my voice I may teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.
verse	46	14	20	Brethren, do not be children in understanding; however, in malice be children, but in understanding be mature.
verse	46	14	21	In the law it is written: "With people of other tongues and other lips I will speak to this people; and yet, for all that, they will not hear Me," says the Lord.
verse	46	14	22	Therefore tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe but to unbelievers; but prophesying is not for unbelievers but serves for those who believe.
verse	46	14	23	Therefore if the entire church comes together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in those who are uninformed or unbelievers, will they not say that you are crazy?
verse	46	14	24	But if all prophesy, and an unbeliever or an uninformed person comes in, he is convinced by all, he is convicted by all.
verse	46	14	25	And so the secrets of his heart are revealed; and so, falling down on his face, he will worship God and report that God is truly among you.
verse	46	14	26	How is it then, brethren? Whenever you come together, each of you has a psalm, has a doctrine, has a tongue, has a revelation, has an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification.
verse	46	14	27	If anyone speaks in an unknown tongue, let there be two or at the most three, each in turn, and let one interpret.
verse	46	14	28	But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in church, and let him speak to himself and to God.
verse	46	14	29	Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge.
verse	46	14	30	But if anything is revealed to another who sits by, let the first keep silent.
verse	46	14	31	Because, you can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all may be encouraged.
verse	46	14	32	And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
verse	46	14	33	Because, God is not the author of confusion but of peace, as in all the churches of the saints.
verse	46	14	34	Let your women keep silent in the churches, because they are not permitted to speak; but they are commanded to be submissive, as the law also says.
verse	46	14	35	And if they want to learn something, let them ask their husbands at home; because it is shameful for women to speak in the church.
verse	46	14	36	What? Did the word of God originate from you? Or was it to you only that it has come?
verse	46	14	37	If anyone thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things which I write to you are the commandments of the Lord.
verse	46	14	38	But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant.
verse	46	14	39	Therefore, brethren, earnestly desire to prophesy, and do not forbid to speak with tongues.
verse	46	14	40	Let all things be done decently and in order.
verse	46	15	1	Moreover, brethren, I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received and in which you stand,
verse	46	15	2	by which also you are saved, if you keep in memory that which I preached to you, unless you have believed in vain.
verse	46	15	3	Because, I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: how Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
verse	46	15	4	and that He was buried, and that He rose again the third day according to the Scriptures,
verse	46	15	5	and that He was seen by Cephas, then by the twelve.
verse	46	15	6	After that He was seen by over five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain to the present, but some have fallen asleep.
verse	46	15	7	After that He was seen by James, then by all the apostles.
verse	46	15	8	Then last of all He was seen by me also, as by one born out of due time.
verse	46	15	9	Because, I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
verse	46	15	10	But by the grace of God I am what I am, and His grace which was imparted to me was not in vain; but I labored more abundantly than they all, yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verse	46	15	11	Therefore, whether it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed.
verse	46	15	12	Now if Christ is preached that He rose from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verse	46	15	13	But if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ is not risen.
verse	46	15	14	And if Christ is not risen, then our preaching is in vain and your faith is also in vain.
verse	46	15	15	Yes, and we are found to be false witnesses of God, because we have testified of God that He raised up Christ, whom He did not raise up, if in fact the dead do not rise.
verse	46	15	16	Because, if the dead do not rise, then Christ is not risen.
verse	46	15	17	And if Christ is not risen, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins!
verse	46	15	18	Then also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
verse	46	15	19	If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men the most miserable.
verse	46	15	20	But now Christ is risen from the dead, and has become the firstfruits of those who sleep.
verse	46	15	21	Because, since by man came death, by Man also came the resurrection of the dead.
verse	46	15	22	Because as in Adam all die, even so in Christ all will be made alive.
verse	46	15	23	But each one in his own order: Christ the firstfruits, afterward those who are Christ's at His coming.
verse	46	15	24	Then comes the end, when He will have delivered the kingdom to God, even the Father, when He puts down all rule and all authority and power.
verse	46	15	25	Because, He must reign until He has put all enemies under His feet.
verse	46	15	26	The last enemy that will be destroyed is death.
verse	46	15	27	Because "He has put all things under His feet." But when He says "all things are put under Him," it is evident that He who put all things under Him is the exception.
verse	46	15	28	Now when all things are made subject to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subject to Him who put all things under Him, that God may be all in all.
verse	46	15	29	Otherwise, what shall they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? Why then are they baptized for the dead?
verse	46	15	30	And why do we stand in danger every hour?
verse	46	15	31	I affirm, by the boasting which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
verse	46	15	32	If, in the manner of men, I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantage is it to me? If the dead do not rise, "Let us eat and drink, because tomorrow we die!"
verse	46	15	33	Do not be deceived: "Evil company corrupts good morals."
verse	46	15	34	Awake to righteousness, and do not sin; because some do not have the knowledge of God. I speak this to your shame.
verse	46	15	35	But someone will say, "How are the dead raised up? And with what body do they come?"
verse	46	15	36	Foolish one, what you sow is not made alive unless it dies.
verse	46	15	37	And what you sow, you do not sow that body that will be, but mere grain, perhaps wheat or some other grain.
verse	46	15	38	But God gives it a body as it has pleased Him, and to each seed its own body.
verse	46	15	39	All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds.
verse	46	15	40	There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
verse	46	15	41	There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; because one star differs from another star in glory.
verse	46	15	42	So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption.
verse	46	15	43	It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power.
verse	46	15	44	It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
verse	46	15	45	And so it is written, "The first man Adam became a living soul." The last Adam became a life giving spirit.
verse	46	15	46	However, the spiritual is not first, but the natural, and afterward that which is spiritual.
verse	46	15	47	The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second Man is the Lord from heaven.
verse	46	15	48	As was the man of dust, so also are those who are made of dust; and as is the heavenly Man, so also are those who are heavenly.
verse	46	15	49	And as we have borne the image of the man of dust, we will also bear the image of the Heavenly.
verse	46	15	50	Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; nor does corruption inherit incorruption.
verse	46	15	51	Behold, I show you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,
verse	46	15	52	in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. Because, the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed.
verse	46	15	53	Because, this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
verse	46	15	54	So when this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then will be brought to pass the saying that is written: "Death is swallowed up in victory."
