verse	46	15	55	"O Death, where is your sting? O grave, where is your victory?"
verse	46	15	56	The sting of death is sin, and the strength of sin is the law.
verse	46	15	57	But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	46	15	58	Therefore, my beloved brethren, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.
verse	46	16	1	Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have directed the churches of Galatia, so you must do also:
verse	46	16	2	On the first day of the week let each one of you lay something aside, storing up as God has prospered him, that there be no collections when I come.
verse	46	16	3	And when I come, whomever you approve by your letters I will send to bear your gift to Jerusalem.
verse	46	16	4	But if it is fitting that I go also, they will go with me.
verse	46	16	5	Now I will come to you when I pass through Macedonia (because I am passing through Macedonia).
verse	46	16	6	And it may be that I will remain, or even spend the winter with you, that you may send me on my journey, wherever I go.
verse	46	16	7	Because, I do not wish to see you now along the way; but I hope to stay a while with you, if the Lord permits.
verse	46	16	8	But I will stay in Ephesus until Pentecost.
verse	46	16	9	Because, a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.
verse	46	16	10	Now if Timothy comes, see that he may be with you without fear; because, he does the work of the Lord, as I also do.
verse	46	16	11	Therefore let no one despise him. But send him on his journey in peace, that he may come to me; because I am expecting him with the brethren.
verse	46	16	12	Now concerning our brother Apollos, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brethren, but he was quite unwilling to come at this time; however, he will come when he has a convenient time.
verse	46	16	13	Watch, stand fast in the faith, act like men, be strong.
verse	46	16	14	Let all that you do be done with love.
verse	46	16	15	I urge you, brethren, you know the household of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to the ministry of the saints,
verse	46	16	16	that you also submit to such, and to everyone who works and labors with us.
verse	46	16	17	I am glad about the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus, because what was lacking on your part they supplied.
verse	46	16	18	Because they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge such people.
verse	46	16	19	The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
verse	46	16	20	All the brethren greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verse	46	16	21	The salutation from me Paul with my own hand.
verse	46	16	22	If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha!
verse	46	16	23	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verse	46	16	24	My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verse	47	1	1	Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:
verse	47	1	2	Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	47	1	3	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
verse	47	1	4	who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
verse	47	1	5	Because, as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds by Christ.
verse	47	1	6	Now if we are afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effective for enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer. Or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
verse	47	1	7	And our hope for you is unshaken, because, we know that as you are partakers of the sufferings, so also you will also be of the consolation.
verse	47	1	8	Because, we do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, of our trouble which came to us in Asia: that we were burdened beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life.
verse	47	1	9	But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead,
verse	47	1	10	who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver us; in whom we trust that He will still deliver,
verse	47	1	11	you also helping together in prayer for us, that thanks may be given by the means of many people on our behalf for the gift granted to us through many.
verse	47	1	12	Because our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience that we conducted ourselves in the world in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God, and more abundantly toward you.
verse	47	1	13	Because, we are not writing any other things to you than what you read or acknowledge, and I trust you will acknowledge, even to the end;
verse	47	1	14	as also you have acknowledged us partially, that we are your rejoicing, just as you also are ours, in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verse	47	1	15	And in this confidence I intended to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit;
verse	47	1	16	to visit you on the way to Macedonia, to return again from Macedonia to you, and be brought on my way toward Judea.
verse	47	1	17	Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do it lightly? Or the things I plan, do I plan according to the flesh, that with me there should be Yes, Yes, and No, No?
verse	47	1	18	But as God is true, our word to you was not Yes and No.
verse	47	1	19	Because, the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me, Silvanus, and Timothy, was not Yes and No, but in Him was Yes.
verse	47	1	20	Because, all the promises of God in Him are Yes, and in Him Amen, to the glory of God by us.
verse	47	1	21	Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us is God,
verse	47	1	22	who also has sealed us and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee.
verse	47	1	23	Moreover I call God to record against my soul, that to spare you I have not yet come to Corinth.
verse	47	1	24	Not that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers for your joy; because by faith you stand.
verse	47	2	1	But I determined this within myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.
verse	47	2	2	Because, if I make you sorrowful, then who is he who makes me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me?
verse	47	2	3	And I wrote this very thing to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from those of whom I ought to rejoice, having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all.
verse	47	2	4	Because, out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you, with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have so abundantly for you.
verse	47	2	5	But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, except partially; so that I may not be harsh to you all.
verse	47	2	6	This punishment which was inflicted by many is sufficient for such a man,
verse	47	2	7	so that, on the contrary, you ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with too much sorrow.
verse	47	2	8	Therefore I urge you to reaffirm your love to him.
verse	47	2	9	Because, this is why I also wrote, that I might put you to the test, whether you are obedient in all things.
verse	47	2	10	To whom you forgive anything, I also forgive. Because, if I have forgiven anything, to whom I forgive it, I have forgiven it for your sakes in the person of Christ,
verse	47	2	11	lest Satan should get a favorable position over us; because we are not ignorant of his devices.
verse	47	2	12	Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ's gospel, and a door was opened to me by the Lord,
verse	47	2	13	I had no rest in my spirit, because I did not find Titus my brother; but taking my leave of them, I departed from there into Macedonia.
verse	47	2	14	Now thanks be to God who always causes us to triumph in Christ, and makes manifest the fragrance of His knowledge in every place through us.
verse	47	2	15	Because, we are to God the sweet fragrance of Christ among those who are saved and among those who are perishing.
verse	47	2	16	To the one we are the aroma of death leading to death, and to the other the aroma of life leading to life. And who is sufficient for these things?
verse	47	2	17	Because, we are not, like so many, who corrupt the word of God; but as of sincerity, but as from God, in the sight of God we speak in Christ.
verse	47	3	1	Do we begin again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as some others, letters of commendation to you or letters of commendation from you?
verse	47	3	2	You are our letter written in our hearts, known and read by everyone;
verse	47	3	3	in as much as you are clearly declared to be a letter of Christ, delivered by us, written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of flesh, that is, of the heart.
verse	47	3	4	And we have such confidence through Christ toward God.
verse	47	3	5	Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think of anything as originating from ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God,
verse	47	3	6	who also has made us competent ministers of the new testament, not of the letter but of the Spirit; because the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.
verse	47	3	7	But if the ministry of death, written and engraved on stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly at Moses' face because of the glory of his countenance, which glory was passing away,
verse	47	3	8	how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious?
verse	47	3	9	Because, if the ministry of condemnation is glory, the ministry of righteousness exceeds much more in glory.
verse	47	3	10	Because, even what was made glorious had no glory in this respect, because of the glory that excels.
verse	47	3	11	Because, if what is passing away was glorious, what remains is much more glorious.
verse	47	3	12	Therefore, seeing we have such hope, we use much freedom of speech;
verse	47	3	13	unlike Moses, who put a veil over his face so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly at the outcome of what was passing away.
verse	47	3	14	But their minds were blinded. Because, until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the Old Testament. This veil is taken away in Christ.
verse	47	3	15	But even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil is upon their heart.
verse	47	3	16	Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the veil will be taken away.
verse	47	3	17	Now the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.
verse	47	3	18	But we all, with unveiled face, beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, just as by the Spirit of the Lord.
verse	47	4	1	Therefore, seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we do not lose heart.
verse	47	4	2	But we have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
verse	47	4	3	But even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing,
verse	47	4	4	whose minds the god of this age has blinded, who do not believe, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them.
verse	47	4	5	Because, we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.
verse	47	4	6	Because God, who commanded light to shine out of darkness, has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
verse	47	4	7	But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us.
verse	47	4	8	We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;
verse	47	4	9	persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed;
verse	47	4	10	always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our body.
verse	47	4	11	Because, we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus' sake, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh.
verse	47	4	12	So then death is working in us, but life in you.
verse	47	4	13	We having the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, "I believed and therefore I spoke," we also believe and therefore speak,
verse	47	4	14	knowing that He who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up by Jesus, and will present us with you.
verse	47	4	15	Because, all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace may through the thanksgiving of many, abound to the glory of God.
verse	47	4	16	Therefore we do not lose heart. Even though our outward man is perishing, yet the inward man is being renewed day by day.
verse	47	4	17	Because, our light affliction, which is only for a moment, is working for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory,
verse	47	4	18	while we do not look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen. Because, the things which are seen are temporary, but the things which are not seen are eternal.
verse	47	5	1	Because, we know that if our earthly house, this tent, is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
verse	47	5	2	Because, in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven,
verse	47	5	3	if indeed, having been clothed, we will not be found naked.
verse	47	5	4	Because, we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, not because we want to be unclothed, but further clothed, that mortality may be swallowed up by life.
verse	47	5	5	Now He who has prepared us for this very thing is God, who also has given to us the Spirit as a guarantee.
verse	47	5	6	Therefore we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body we are absent from the Lord.
verse	47	5	7	Because we walk by faith, not by sight.
verse	47	5	8	We are confident, I proclaim, and willing rather to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord.
verse	47	5	9	Therefore we labor, so that whether present or absent, we may be accepted of Him.
verse	47	5	10	Because, we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive the things done in the body, according to what he has done, whether it is good or bad.
verse	47	5	11	Knowing, therefore, the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest to God, and I also trust are made manifest in your consciences.
verse	47	5	12	Because, we do not commend ourselves again to you, but give you opportunity to boast on our behalf, that you may have something to answer them who boast in appearance and not in heart.
verse	47	5	13	Because, if we are beside ourselves, it is for God; or if we are sober, it is for you.
verse	47	5	14	Because, the love of Christ compels us, because we have judged thus: that if One died for all, then all died;
verse	47	5	15	and that He died for all, that those who live should live no longer for themselves, but for Him who died for them and rose again.
verse	47	5	16	Therefore, from now on, we regard no one according to the flesh. Even though we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet from now on we know Him like this no longer.
verse	47	5	17	Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creature; old things have passed away; behold, all things have become new.
verse	47	5	18	Now all these things are from God, who has reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ, and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation,
verse	47	5	19	that is, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not imputing their trespasses to them, and has committed to us the word of reconciliation.
verse	47	5	20	Now then, we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading to you through us: we urge you on Christ's behalf, be reconciled to God.
verse	47	5	21	Because, He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might be made the righteousness of God in Him.
verse	47	6	1	We then, as workers together with Him also urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain.
verse	47	6	2	Because, He says: "In an acceptable time I have heard you, and in the day of salvation I have helped you." Behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation.
verse	47	6	3	Giving no offense in anything, that the ministry may not be faulted.
verse	47	6	4	But in all things we commend ourselves as the ministers of God: in much patience, in afflictions, in needs, in distresses,
verse	47	6	5	in stripes, in imprisonments, in riots, in labors, in sleeplessness, in fastings;
verse	47	6	6	by purity, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by genuine love,
verse	47	6	7	by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,
verse	47	6	8	by honor and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true;
verse	47	6	9	as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold we live; as chastened, and yet not killed;
verse	47	6	10	as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.
verse	47	6	11	O you Corinthians! Our mouth is open to you, our heart is wide open.
verse	47	6	12	You are not restricted by us, but you are restricted by your own affections.
verse	47	6	13	Now in return for the same (I speak as to my children), you also be open.
verse	47	6	14	Do not be unequally yoked together with unbelievers. Because, what fellowship has righteousness with unrighteousness? And what communion has light with darkness?
verse	47	6	15	And what accord has Christ with Belial? Or what part has he who believes with an infidel?
verse	47	6	16	And what agreement has the temple of God with idols? Because, you are the temple of the living God. As God has said: "I will dwell in them and walk in them. And I will be their God, and they will be My people."
verse	47	6	17	Therefore "Come out from among them and be separate, says the Lord. Do not touch what is unclean, and I will receive you."
verse	47	6	18	"I will be a Father to you, and you will be My sons and daughters, says the LORD Almighty."
verse	47	7	1	Therefore, having these promises, greatly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the reverence of God.
verse	47	7	2	Receive us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have cheated no one.
verse	47	7	3	I do not say this to condemn you; because I have said before that you are in our hearts, to die together and to live together with you.
verse	47	7	4	Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my boasting on your behalf. I am filled with comfort. I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation.
verse	47	7	5	Because, when we came to Macedonia, our bodies had no rest, but we were troubled on every side. Outside were conflicts, inside were fears.
verse	47	7	6	Nevertheless God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus,
verse	47	7	7	and not only by his coming, but also by the consolation with which he was comforted in you, when he told us of your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind towards me, so that I rejoiced even more.
verse	47	7	8	Because, even though I made you sorry with my letter, I do not regret it; though I did regret it. Because, I perceive that the same letter made you sorry, though only for a season.
verse	47	7	9	Now I rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that your sorrow led to repentance. Because you were made sorry in a godly manner, that you might suffer loss from us in nothing.
verse	47	7	10	Because, godly sorrow produces repentance leading to salvation, not to be regretted; but the sorrow of the world produces death.
verse	47	7	11	Because, observe this very thing, that you sorrowed in a godly manner: yes what diligence it produced in you, yes what clearing of yourselves, yes what indignation, yes what fear, what vehement desire, what zeal, what vindication! In all things you have proven yourselves to be clear in this matter.
verse	47	7	12	Therefore, although I wrote to you, I did not do it because of him who had done the wrong, nor because of him who suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear to you.
verse	47	7	13	Therefore we have been comforted in your comfort. And we rejoiced exceedingly more for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.
verse	47	7	14	Because, if in anything I have boasted to him about you, I am not ashamed. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, even so our boasting which I made before Titus was found true.
verse	47	7	15	And his inner affections are greater for you as he remembers the obedience of you all, how with reverence and trembling you received him.
verse	47	7	16	Therefore I rejoice that I have confidence in you in all things.
verse	47	8	1	Moreover, brethren, we make known to you the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia:
verse	47	8	2	how that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their extreme poverty abounded in the riches of their liberality.
verse	47	8	3	Because, I bear record that according to their ability, yes, and beyond their ability, they were freely willing,
verse	47	8	4	urging us with many requests that we would receive the gift and take on us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
verse	47	8	5	And this they did, not just as we hoped, but they first gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us by the will of God.
verse	47	8	6	So that we urged Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete this grace in you also.
verse	47	8	7	Therefore, as you abound in everything, in faith, in speech, in knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love for us, see that you abound in this grace also.
verse	47	8	8	I speak not by commandment, but I am testing the sincerity of your love by the diligence of others.
verse	47	8	9	Because, you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that you through His poverty might be rich.
verse	47	8	10	And in this I give my advice: It is to your advantage not only to be doing what you began and were desiring to do a year ago;
verse	47	8	11	but now you also must complete the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to desire it, so there also may be a completion out of what you have.
verse	47	8	12	Because, if there is first a willing mind, it is accepted according to what one has, and not according to what he does not have.
verse	47	8	13	Because, I do not mean that others should be eased and you burdened;
verse	47	8	14	but by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their lack, that their abundance also may be a supply for your lack, that there may be equality.
verse	47	8	15	As it is written, "He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack."
verse	47	8	16	But thanks be to God who put the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus.
verse	47	8	17	Because, he not only accepted the exhortation, but being more diligent, he went to you of his own accord.
verse	47	8	18	And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches,
verse	47	8	19	and not only that, but who was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the Lord Himself and to show your ready mind,
verse	47	8	20	avoiding this: that anyone should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us,
verse	47	8	21	providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
verse	47	8	22	And we have sent with them our brother whom we have often proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, because of the great confidence which I have in you.
verse	47	8	23	If anyone inquires about Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker concerning you. Or if our brethren are inquired about, they are messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.
verse	47	8	24	Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf.
verse	47	9	1	Now concerning the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you;
verse	47	9	2	Because, I know your willingness, about which I boast of you to the Macedonians, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has stirred up the majority.
verse	47	9	3	Yet I have sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this respect, that, you may be ready, as I said;
verse	47	9	4	lest if some Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we (that we do not mention you) should be ashamed of this confident boasting.
verse	47	9	5	Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren to go to you ahead of time, and prepare your generous gift beforehand, of which you had previous notification, that it may be ready as a matter of generosity and not as a grudging obligation.
verse	47	9	6	But this I say: He who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
verse	47	9	7	So let each one give, according as he purposes in his heart, not grudgingly or of necessity; because, God loves a cheerful giver.
verse	47	9	8	And God is able to make all grace abound toward you, that you, always having all sufficiency in all things, may have an abundance for every good work.
verse	47	9	9	As it is written: "He has dispersed abroad, he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures forever."
verse	47	9	10	Now He who supplies seed to the sower, also supply bread for your food, multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness,
verse	47	9	11	being enriched in everything for all abundance, which causes thanksgiving through us to God.
verse	47	9	12	Because, the administration of this service not only supplies the needs of the saints, but also is abounding through many thanksgivings to God,
verse	47	9	13	while, through the proof of this ministry, they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal distribution to them and all people,
verse	47	9	14	and by their prayer for you, who long for you because of the exceeding grace of God in you.
verse	47	9	15	Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift!
verse	47	10	1	Now I, Paul, myself urge with you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you.
verse	47	10	2	But I urge you that when I am present I may not be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
verse	47	10	3	Because, though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh.
verse	47	10	4	Because, the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty through God for the pulling down of strongholds,
verse	47	10	5	casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ,
verse	47	10	6	and being ready to punish all disobedience when your obedience is fulfilled.
verse	47	10	7	Do you look at things according to the outward appearance? If anyone is convinced in himself that he is Christ's, let him again consider this in himself, that just as he is Christ's, even so we are Christ's.
verse	47	10	8	Because, even if I should boast somewhat more about our authority, which the Lord gave us for edification and not for your destruction, I will not be ashamed,
verse	47	10	9	lest I seem as if I would to terrify you by letters.
verse	47	10	10	"Because, his letters," they say, "are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible."
verse	47	10	11	Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such we will also be in deed when we are present.
verse	47	10	12	Because, we dare not classify ourselves or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves. But they, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.
verse	47	10	13	We, however, will not boast of things beyond our measure, but according to the measure of the influence which God has distributed to us, a measure to reach to you also.
verse	47	10	14	Because, we do not stretch ourselves beyond our measure, as though we did not extend to you, because, we have come as far as to you also with the preaching of the gospel of Christ;
verse	47	10	15	not boasting of things beyond our measure, that is, in other men's labors, but having hope, that as your faith is increased, that we will be enlarged abundantly by you according to our influence,
verse	47	10	16	to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's sphere of accomplishment.
verse	47	10	17	But "he who glories, let him glory in the LORD."
verse	47	10	18	Because, not he who commends himself is approved, but whom the Lord commends.
verse	47	11	1	Oh, that you would bear with me in a little in my folly, and indeed you do bear with me.
verse	47	11	2	Because, I am jealous for you with godly jealousy. Because, I have betrothed you to one husband, that I may present you as a pure virgin to Christ.
verse	47	11	3	But I fear, lest somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness, so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.
verse	47	11	4	Because, if he who comes preaches another Jesus whom we have not preached, or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or a different gospel which you have not accepted, you may well put up with him!
verse	47	11	5	Because, I consider that I am not at all inferior to the most eminent apostles.
verse	47	11	6	Even though I am untrained in speech, yet I am not in knowledge. But we have been thoroughly manifested among you in all things.
verse	47	11	7	Did I commit sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I have preached the gospel of God to you free of charge?
verse	47	11	8	I took from other churches, taking wages from them to minister to you.
verse	47	11	9	And when I was present with you, and in need, I was a burden to no one, because, what I lacked the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied. And in all things I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and so I will keep myself.
verse	47	11	10	As the truth of Christ is in me, no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
verse	47	11	11	Why? Because I do not love you? God knows!
verse	47	11	12	But what I do, I will also continue to do, that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be regarded just as we are in the things of which they boast.
verse	47	11	13	Because, such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ.
verse	47	11	14	And no wonder! Because, Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.
verse	47	11	15	Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also are transformed into ministers of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.
verse	47	11	16	I say again, let no one think me a fool. If otherwise, at least receive me as a fool, that I also may boast a little.
verse	47	11	17	What I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as it were, foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
verse	47	11	18	Seeing that many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast.
verse	47	11	19	Because, you put up with fools gladly, since you yourselves are wise!
verse	47	11	20	because, you put up with it if one brings you into bondage, if one devours you, if one takes from you, if one exalts himself, if one strikes you on the face.
verse	47	11	21	To our shame I say that we were too weak for that! But in whatever anyone is bold, I speak foolishly, I am bold also.
verse	47	11	22	Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.
verse	47	11	23	Are they ministers of Christ? I speak as a fool, I am more: in labors more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths often.
verse	47	11	24	From the Jews five times I received forty stripes minus one.
verse	47	11	25	Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I was shipwrecked; a night and a day I have been in the deep;
verse	47	11	26	in frequent journeys, in danger from waters, in danger from robbers, in danger from my own countrymen, in danger from the Gentiles, in danger in the city, in danger in the wilderness, in danger in the sea, in danger among false brethren;
verse	47	11	27	in weariness and toil, in sleeplessness often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness,
verse	47	11	28	besides those things that are external, what comes upon me daily: the concern for all the churches.
verse	47	11	29	Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is offended, and I do not burn with indignation?
verse	47	11	30	If I must boast, I will boast in the things which concern my weakness.
verse	47	11	31	The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
verse	47	11	32	In Damascus the governor, under Aretas the king, was guarding the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me;
verse	47	11	33	but I was let down in a basket through a window by the wall, and escaped from his hands.
verse	47	12	1	It is obviously not profitable for me to boast. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord:
verse	47	12	2	I knew a man in Christ who over fourteen years ago (whether in the body I do not know, or whether out of the body I do not know, God knows) such a one was caught up to the third heaven.
verse	47	12	3	And I knew such a man (whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows)
verse	47	12	4	how he was caught up into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
verse	47	12	5	Of such a one I will boast; yet of myself I will not boast, except in my weaknesses.
verse	47	12	6	Because though I might desire to boast, I will not be a fool; because I will speak the truth. But now I refrain, lest anyone should think of me above what he sees me to be or that he hears from me.
verse	47	12	7	And lest I should be exalted above measure by the abundance of the revelations, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Satan to wound me, lest I be exalted above measure.
verse	47	12	8	Concerning this thing I sought the Lord three times that it might depart from me.
verse	47	12	9	And He said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, because My strength is made perfect in weakness." Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my weaknesses, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
verse	47	12	10	Therefore I take pleasure in weaknesses, in reproaches, in needs, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ's sake. Because when I am weak, then I am strong.
verse	47	12	11	I have become a fool in boasting; you have compelled me. Because, I ought to have been commended by you; because, in nothing was I behind the most eminent apostles, though I am nothing.
verse	47	12	12	Truly the signs of an apostle were accomplished among you with all perseverance, in signs and wonders and mighty deeds.
verse	47	12	13	Because, what is it in which you were inferior to other churches, except it is that I myself was not burdensome to you? Forgive me this wrong!
verse	47	12	14	Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you. And I will not be burdensome to you; because, I do not seek yours, but you. Because, the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
verse	47	12	15	And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I am loved.
verse	47	12	16	But be that as it may, I did not burden you. Nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with craftiness!
verse	47	12	17	Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you?
verse	47	12	18	I urged Titus, and sent our brother with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? Did we not walk in the same spirit? Did we not walk in the same steps?
verse	47	12	19	Again, do you think that we excuse ourselves to you? We speak before God in Christ. But we do all things, beloved, for your edification.
verse	47	12	20	Because, I fear lest, when I come, I will not find you such as I wish, and that I will be found by you such as you do not wish; lest there be debates, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, backbitings, whisperings, puffed up pride, commotion;
verse	47	12	21	and lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I will mourn for many who have sinned already and have not repented of the uncleanness, fornication, and lewdness which they have committed.
verse	47	13	1	This is the third time I am coming to you. "By the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established."
verse	47	13	2	I have told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present the second time, and now being absent I write to those who have sinned already, and to all the rest, that if I come again I will not spare
verse	47	13	3	since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, who is not weak toward you, but mighty in you.
verse	47	13	4	Because, though He was crucified in weakness, yet He lives by the power of God. Because, we also are weak in Him, but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you.
verse	47	13	5	Examine yourselves as to whether you are in the faith. Test yourselves. Do you not know yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you? Unless indeed you are reprobates.
verse	47	13	6	But I trust that you shall know that we are not reprobates.
verse	47	13	7	Now I pray to God that you do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that you should do what is honest, even though we are as reprobates.
verse	47	13	8	Because, we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.
verse	47	13	9	Because, we are glad when we are weak and you are strong. And this also we desire, even your perfection.
verse	47	13	10	Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the authority which the Lord has given me for edification and not for destruction.
verse	47	13	11	Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect. Be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you.
verse	47	13	12	Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verse	47	13	13	All the saints greet you.
verse	47	13	14	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all. Amen.
verse	48	1	1	Paul, an apostle (not from men nor by man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead),
verse	48	1	2	and all the brethren who are with me, to the churches of Galatia:
verse	48	1	3	Grace be to you and peace from God the Father and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	48	1	4	who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,
verse	48	1	5	to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verse	48	1	6	I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you into the grace of Christ, to another gospel,
verse	48	1	7	which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.
verse	48	1	8	But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed.
verse	48	1	9	As we have said before, so now I say again, if anyone preaches any other gospel to you than what you have received, let him be accursed.
verse	48	1	10	So am I now persuading men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? Because if I still pleased men, I would not be the servant of Christ.
verse	48	1	11	But I make known to you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man.
verse	48	1	12	Because, I neither received it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verse	48	1	13	Because, you have heard of my former conduct in Judaism, how I persecuted the church of God beyond measure and destroyed it.
verse	48	1	14	And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries in my own nation, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.
verse	48	1	15	But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb and called me by His grace,
verse	48	1	16	to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood,
verse	48	1	17	nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.
verse	48	1	18	Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and remained with him fifteen days.
verse	48	1	19	But I saw none of the other apostles except James, the Lord's brother.
verse	48	1	20	(Now concerning the things which I write to you, indeed, before God, I do not lie.)
verse	48	1	21	Afterward I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
verse	48	1	22	And I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea which were in Christ.
verse	48	1	23	But they had heard only, "He who formerly persecuted us now preaches the faith which he once destroyed."
verse	48	1	24	And they glorified God in me.
verse	48	2	1	Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.
verse	48	2	2	And I went up by revelation, and communicated to them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to those who were of reputation, lest by any means I might run, or had run, in vain.
verse	48	2	3	Yet not even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.
verse	48	2	4	And this arose because of false brethren secretly brought in (who came in secretly to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage),
verse	48	2	5	to whom we did not yield submission even for an hour, that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
verse	48	2	6	But from those who seemed to be something (whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God shows personal favoritism to no man) because, those who seemed to be something added nothing to me.
verse	48	2	7	But on the contrary, when they saw that the gospel for the uncircumcised had been committed to me, as the gospel for the circumcised was to Peter
verse	48	2	8	(because, He who worked effectively in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised also worked effectively in me toward the Gentiles),
verse	48	2	9	and when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that had been given to me, they gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.
verse	48	2	10	Desiring only that we should remember the poor, the very thing which I also was eager to do.
verse	48	2	11	But when Peter had come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed;
verse	48	2	12	because, before certain men came from James, he would eat with the Gentiles; but when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision.
verse	48	2	13	And the rest of the Jews also played the hypocrite with him, so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.
verse	48	2	14	But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before them all, "If you, being a Jew, live in the manner of Gentiles and not as the Jews, why do you compel Gentiles to live as Jews?
verse	48	2	15	We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
verse	48	2	16	knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ and not by the works of the law; because by the works of the law no flesh will be justified.
verse	48	2	17	"But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ therefore a minister of sin? God forbid!
verse	48	2	18	Because, if I build again those things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.
verse	48	2	19	Because, I through the law died to the law that I might live to God.
verse	48	2	20	I am crucified with Christ; nevertheless I live, yet not I but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.
verse	48	2	21	I do not reject the grace of God; because, if righteousness comes through the law, then Christ died in vain."
verse	48	3	1	O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you that you should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed among you as crucified?
verse	48	3	2	This only I want to learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verse	48	3	3	Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now being made perfect by the flesh?
verse	48	3	4	Have you suffered so many things in vain, if indeed it was in vain?
verse	48	3	5	Therefore He who supplies the Spirit to you and works miracles among you, does He do it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verse	48	3	6	Just as Abraham "believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness."
verse	48	3	7	Therefore know that those who are of faith, the same are children of Abraham.
verse	48	3	8	And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles through faith, preached the gospel to Abraham beforehand, saying, "In you all the nations will be blessed."
verse	48	3	9	So then those who are of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
verse	48	3	10	Because, as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse; because it is written, "Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things which are written in the book of the law, to do them."
verse	48	3	11	But that no one is justified by the law in the sight of God is evident, because "the just will live by faith."
verse	48	3	12	Yet the law is not of faith, but "the man who does them will live in them."
verse	48	3	13	Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us (because it is written, "Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree"),
verse	48	3	14	that the blessing of Abraham might come upon the Gentiles through Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verse	48	3	15	Brethren, I speak in the manner of men: Though it is only a man's covenant, yet if it is confirmed, no one annuls or adds to it.
verse	48	3	16	Now to Abraham and his Seed were the promises made. He does not say, "And to seeds," as of many, but as of one, "And to your Seed," who is Christ.
verse	48	3	17	And this I say, that the law, which was four hundred and thirty years later, cannot annul the covenant that was confirmed before by God in Christ, that it should make the promise of no effect.
verse	48	3	18	Because, if the inheritance is of the law, it is no longer of promise; but God gave it to Abraham by promise.
verse	48	3	19	What purpose then does the law serve? It was added because of transgressions, until the Seed should come to whom the promise was made; and it was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.
verse	48	3	20	Now a mediator does not mediate for one only, but God is one.
verse	48	3	21	Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid! Because, if there had been a law given which could have given life, truly righteousness would have been by the law.
verse	48	3	22	But the Scripture has concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith, of Jesus Christ, might be given to those who believe.
verse	48	3	23	But before faith came, we were preserved by the law, preserved for the faith which would afterward be revealed.
verse	48	3	24	Therefore the law was an instructor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
verse	48	3	25	But after faith has come, we are no longer under an instructor.
verse	48	3	26	Because, you are all sons of God by faith in Christ Jesus.
verse	48	3	27	Because, as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
verse	48	3	28	There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is neither male nor female; because you are all one in Christ Jesus.
verse	48	3	29	And if you are Christ's, then you are Abraham's seed, and heirs according to the promise.
verse	48	4	1	Now I say that the heir, as long as he is a child, does not differ at all from a servant, though he is master of all,
verse	48	4	2	but is under instructors and stewards until the time appointed by the father.
verse	48	4	3	Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world.
verse	48	4	4	But when the fullness of the time had come, God sent forth His Son, born of a woman, born under the law,
verse	48	4	5	to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons.
verse	48	4	6	And because you are sons, God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts, crying, "Abba, Father!"
verse	48	4	7	Therefore you are no longer a servant but a son, and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
verse	48	4	8	But then, indeed, when you did not know God, you served those which by nature are not gods.
verse	48	4	9	But now after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage?
verse	48	4	10	You observe days and months and seasons and years.
verse	48	4	11	I am afraid for you, lest I have labored for you in vain.
verse	48	4	12	Brethren, I urge you to be as I am, because I am as you are. You have not injured me at all.
verse	48	4	13	You know that because of physical weakness I preached the gospel to you at the first.
verse	48	4	14	And my trial which was in my flesh you did not despise or reject, but you received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
verse	48	4	15	What then was the blessing you spoke of? Because, I bear you witness that, if possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me.
verse	48	4	16	Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?
verse	48	4	17	They are zealous for you, but for no good; yes, they want to exclude you, that you may be zealous for them.
verse	48	4	18	But it is good to be zealous in a good thing always, and not only when I am present with you.
verse	48	4	19	My little children, for whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you,
verse	48	4	20	I desire to be present with you now and to change my tone; because I stand in doubt concerning you.
verse	48	4	21	Tell me, you who desire to be under the law, do you not hear the law?
verse	48	4	22	Because, it is written that Abraham had two sons: the one by a bondwoman, the other by a freewoman.
verse	48	4	23	But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh, and he of the freewoman was by promise,
verse	48	4	24	which things are an allegory. Because, these are the two covenants: the one from Mount Sinai which gives birth to bondage, which is Hagar.
verse	48	4	25	Because, this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children.
verse	48	4	26	But the Jerusalem above is free, which is the mother of us all.
verse	48	4	27	Because, it is written: "Rejoice, you barren, you who do not bear! Break forth and cry, you who are not in labor! Because, the desolate has many more children than she who has a husband."
verse	48	4	28	Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise.
verse	48	4	29	But, as he who was born according to the flesh then persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, even so it is now.
verse	48	4	30	Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? "Cast out the bondwoman and her son, because, the son of the bondwoman will not be heir with the son of the freewoman."
verse	48	4	31	So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman but of the free.
verse	48	5	1	Stand fast therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and do not be entangled again with a yoke of bondage.
verse	48	5	2	Behold I, Paul, say to you that if you become circumcised, Christ will profit you nothing.
verse	48	5	3	And I testify again to every man who becomes circumcised that he is a debtor to keep the entire law.
verse	48	5	4	Christ has become of no effect to you, those of you who are justified by law; you have fallen from grace.
verse	48	5	5	Because, we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.
verse	48	5	6	Because, in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but faith working through love.
verse	48	5	7	You ran well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth?
verse	48	5	8	This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you.
verse	48	5	9	A little leaven leavens the entire lump.
verse	48	5	10	I have confidence in you, through the Lord, that you will have no other mind; but he who troubles you will bear his judgment, whoever he is.
verse	48	5	11	And I, brethren, if I still preach circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the offense of the cross has ceased.
verse	48	5	12	I desire that those who trouble you were cut off.
verse	48	5	13	Because you, brethren, have been called to liberty; only do not use liberty as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another.
verse	48	5	14	Because all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: "You shall love your neighbor as yourself."
verse	48	5	15	But if you bite and devour one another, beware that you are not consumed by one another!
verse	48	5	16	This I say then: Walk in the Spirit, and you will not fulfill the lust of the flesh.
verse	48	5	17	Because, the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; and these are contrary to one another, so that you do not do the things that you want.
verse	48	5	18	But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.
verse	48	5	19	Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are these: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lustfulness,
verse	48	5	20	idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, fights, jealousies, rage, selfish ambitions, rebellion, heresies,
verse	48	5	21	envy, murders, drunkenness, partying, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
verse	48	5	22	But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faith,
verse	48	5	23	meekness, self control. Against such there is no law.
verse	48	5	24	And those who are Christ's have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.
verse	48	5	25	If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
verse	48	5	26	Let us not desire vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
verse	48	6	1	Brethren, if anyone is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of meekness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.
verse	48	6	2	Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
verse	48	6	3	Because, if anyone thinks himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
verse	48	6	4	But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
verse	48	6	5	Because each one shall bear his own load.
verse	48	6	6	Let him who is taught the word communicate in every good thing with him who teaches.
verse	48	6	7	Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; because whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.
verse	48	6	8	Because, he who sows to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption, but he who sows to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap everlasting life.
verse	48	6	9	And let us not grow weary while doing good, because in due season we will reap if we do not lose heart.
verse	48	6	10	Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to everyone, especially to those who are of the household of faith.
verse	48	6	11	You see what a large letter I have written to you with my own hand!
verse	48	6	12	As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these compel you to be circumcised, only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.
verse	48	6	13	Because, not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh.
verse	48	6	14	But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.
verse	48	6	15	Because, in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creature.
verse	48	6	16	And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.
verse	48	6	17	From now on let no one trouble me, because I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
verse	48	6	18	Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verse	49	1	1	Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints who are in Ephesus, and faithful in Christ Jesus:
verse	49	1	2	Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	49	1	3	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ,
verse	49	1	4	just as He has chosen us in Him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before Him in love,
verse	49	1	5	having predestined us to adoption as children by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will,
verse	49	1	6	to the praise of the glory of His grace, by which He has made us accepted in the Beloved.
verse	49	1	7	In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace
verse	49	1	8	which He made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,
verse	49	1	9	having made known to us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He has purposed in Himself,
verse	49	1	10	that in the dispensation of the fullness of the times He might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven and which are on earth, even in Him.
verse	49	1	11	In Him also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestined according to the purpose of Him who works all things according to the counsel of His own will,
verse	49	1	12	that we who first trusted in Christ should be to the praise of His glory.
verse	49	1	13	In Him you also trusted, after you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation; in whom also, after you believed, you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise,
verse	49	1	14	who is the guarantee of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, to the praise of His glory.
verse	49	1	15	Therefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints,
verse	49	1	16	do not cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers:
verse	49	1	17	that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him,
verse	49	1	18	the eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that you may know what is the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints,
verse	49	1	19	and what is the exceeding greatness of His power toward us who believe, according to the working of His mighty power
verse	49	1	20	which He worked in Christ when He raised Him from the dead and seated Him at His own right hand in the heavenly places,
verse	49	1	21	far above all principality and power and might and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in that which is to come.
verse	49	1	22	And has put all things under His feet, and gave Him to be the head over all things to the church,
verse	49	1	23	which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all.
verse	49	2	1	And you He has made alive, who were dead in trespasses and sins,
verse	49	2	2	in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in the children of disobedience,
verse	49	2	3	among whom also we all once conducted ourselves in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, just as the others.
verse	49	2	4	But God, who is rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us,
verse	49	2	5	even when we were dead in sins, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you are saved),
verse	49	2	6	and has raised us up together, and made us sit together in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
verse	49	2	7	that in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
verse	49	2	8	Because, it is by grace you are saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God,
verse	49	2	9	not of works, lest anyone should boast.
verse	49	2	10	Because, we are His workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand that we should walk in them.
verse	49	2	11	Therefore remember that you, once Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by what is called the Circumcision made in the flesh by hands,
verse	49	2	12	that at that time you were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
verse	49	2	13	But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ.
verse	49	2	14	Because, He is our peace, who has made both one, and has broken down the middle wall of separation between us,
verse	49	2	15	having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to make in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace,
verse	49	2	16	and that He might reconcile them both to God in one body by the cross, thereby putting to death the enmity.
verse	49	2	17	And came and preached peace to you who were afar off and to those who were near.
verse	49	2	18	Because, through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father.
verse	49	2	19	Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God,
verse	49	2	20	and are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone,
verse	49	2	21	in whom the entire building, being fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord,
verse	49	2	22	in whom you also are being built together for a dwelling place of God through the Spirit.
verse	49	3	1	For this reason I, Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,
verse	49	3	2	if indeed you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which was given to me for you,
verse	49	3	3	how that by revelation He made known to me the mystery (as I have briefly written already,
verse	49	3	4	by which, when you read, you may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ),
verse	49	3	5	which in other ages was not made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets:
verse	49	3	6	that the Gentiles should be fellow heirs, of the same body, and partakers of His promise in Christ through the gospel,
verse	49	3	7	of which I became a minister according to the gift of the grace of God given to me by the effective working of His power.
verse	49	3	8	To me, who am less than the least of all the saints, this grace was given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,
verse	49	3	9	and to make all people see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the ages has been hidden in God who created all things by Jesus Christ;
verse	49	3	10	to the intent that now the manifold wisdom of God might be made known by the church to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places,
verse	49	3	11	according to the eternal purpose which He accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord,
verse	49	3	12	in whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of Him.
verse	49	3	13	Therefore I ask that you do not lose heart at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.
verse	49	3	14	For this reason I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	49	3	15	from whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,
verse	49	3	16	that He would grant you, according to the riches of His glory, to be strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man,
verse	49	3	17	that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you, being rooted and grounded in love,
verse	49	3	18	may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and depth and height,
verse	49	3	19	to know the love of Christ which passes knowledge; that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
verse	49	3	20	Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,
verse	49	3	21	to Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, forever and ever. Amen.
verse	49	4	1	I, therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, urge you to walk worthy of the calling with which you were called,
verse	49	4	2	with all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, bearing with one another in love,
verse	49	4	3	endeavoring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
verse	49	4	4	There is one body and one Spirit, just as you are called in one hope of your calling;
verse	49	4	5	one Lord, one faith, one baptism;
verse	49	4	6	one God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all.
verse	49	4	7	But to each one of us grace is given according to the measure of the gift of Christ.
verse	49	4	8	Therefore He says: "When He ascended on high, He led captivity captive, and gave gifts to men."
verse	49	4	9	(Now this, "He ascended," what does it mean but that He also first descended into the lower parts of the earth?
verse	49	4	10	He who descended is also the same who ascended up far above all the heavens, that He might fill all things.)
verse	49	4	11	And He gave some to be apostles, some prophets, some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers,
verse	49	4	12	for the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ,
verse	49	4	13	until we all come to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to a perfect man, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ;
verse	49	4	14	that we should no longer be children, tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, and cunning craftiness, in which they make plans to deceive,
verse	49	4	15	but, speaking the truth in love, may grow up in all things into Him who is the head, who is Christ,
verse	49	4	16	from whom the entire body, joined and knit together by what every joint supplies, according to the effective working by which every part does its share, causes growth of the body for the edifying of itself in love.
verse	49	4	17	This I say, therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk, in the vanity of their mind,
verse	49	4	18	having their understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God, through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart;
verse	49	4	19	who, being past feeling, have given themselves over to filthiness, to work all uncleanness with greediness.
verse	49	4	20	But you have not so learned Christ,
verse	49	4	21	if indeed you have heard Him and have been taught by Him, as the truth is in Jesus:
verse	49	4	22	that you put off, concerning your former conduct, the old man which is corrupted according to the deceitful lusts,
verse	49	4	23	and be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
verse	49	4	24	and that you put on the new man which was created according to God, in righteousness and true holiness.
verse	49	4	25	Therefore, putting away lying, "every one speak truth with his neighbor," because we are members of one another.
verse	49	4	26	"Be angry, and do not sin": do not let the sun go down on your wrath,
verse	49	4	27	nor give place to the devil.
verse	49	4	28	Let him who stole steal no longer, but rather let him labor, working with his hands that which is good, that he may have something to give him who has need.
verse	49	4	29	Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but what is good for necessary edification, that it may minister grace to the hearers.
verse	49	4	30	And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
verse	49	4	31	Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice.
verse	49	4	32	And be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God forgave you because of Christ.
verse	49	5	1	You therefore be followers of God as dear children.
verse	49	5	2	And walk in love, as Christ also has loved us and given Himself for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet smelling aroma.
verse	49	5	3	But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as is fitting for saints;
verse	49	5	4	neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor coarse jesting, which are not fitting, but rather giving of thanks.
verse	49	5	5	Because, you know this; that no fornicator, unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
verse	49	5	6	Let no one deceive you with vain words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the children of disobedience.
verse	49	5	7	Therefore do not be partakers with them.
verse	49	5	8	Because, you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light
verse	49	5	9	(because, the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness, righteousness, and truth),
verse	49	5	10	finding out what is acceptable to the Lord.
verse	49	5	11	And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
verse	49	5	12	Because, it is shameful even to speak of those things which are done by them in secret.
verse	49	5	13	But all things that are exposed are made manifest by the light, because whatever makes manifest is light.
verse	49	5	14	Therefore He says: "Awake, you who sleep, arise from the dead, and Christ will give you light."
verse	49	5	15	See then that you walk circumspectly, not as fools but as wise,
verse	49	5	16	redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
verse	49	5	17	Therefore do not be unwise, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
verse	49	5	18	And do not be drunk with wine, in which is dissipation; but be filled with the Spirit,
verse	49	5	19	speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord,
verse	49	5	20	giving thanks always for all things to God, even the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	49	5	21	submitting yourselves to one another in the reverence of God.
verse	49	5	22	Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands, as to the Lord.
verse	49	5	23	Because, the husband is the head of the wife, just as Christ is head of the church; and He is the Savior of the body.
verse	49	5	24	Therefore, just as the church is subject to Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in everything.
verse	49	5	25	Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for her,
verse	49	5	26	that He might sanctify and cleanse her with the washing of water by the word,
verse	49	5	27	that He might present her to Himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that she should be holy and without blemish.
verse	49	5	28	So husbands ought to love their wives as their own bodies; he who loves his wife loves himself.
verse	49	5	29	Because, no one ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, just as the Lord does the church.
verse	49	5	30	Because, we are members of His body, of His flesh and of His bones.
verse	49	5	31	"For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and will be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh."
verse	49	5	32	This is a great mystery, but I speak concerning Christ and the church.
verse	49	5	33	Nevertheless let each one of you in particular so love his own wife just as himself, and let the wife see that she reverence her husband.
verse	49	6	1	Children, obey your parents in the Lord, because this is right.
verse	49	6	2	"Honor your father and mother," which is the first commandment with promise:
verse	49	6	3	"that it may be well with you and you may live long on the earth."
verse	49	6	4	And you, fathers, do not provoke your children to wrath, but bring them up in the training and admonition of the Lord.
verse	49	6	5	Servants, be obedient to those who are your masters according to the flesh, with reverence and trembling, in sincerity of heart, as to Christ;
verse	49	6	6	not with eye service, as men pleasers, but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart,
verse	49	6	7	with goodwill doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men,
verse	49	6	8	knowing that whatever good anyone does, he will receive the same from the Lord, whether he is a servant or free.
verse	49	6	9	And you, masters, do the same things to them, giving up threatening, knowing that your own Master also is in heaven, and there is no personal favoritism with Him.
verse	49	6	10	Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might.
verse	49	6	11	Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil.
verse	49	6	12	Because, we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this age, against spiritual wickedness in the heavenly places.
verse	49	6	13	Therefore take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done everything, to stand.
verse	49	6	14	Stand therefore, having wrapped your waist with truth, having put on the breastplate of righteousness,
verse	49	6	15	and shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace;
verse	49	6	16	above all, taking the shield of faith with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.
verse	49	6	17	And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God;
verse	49	6	18	praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, being watchful to this end with all perseverance and supplication for all the saints;
verse	49	6	19	and for me, that utterance may be given to me, that I may open my mouth boldly to make known the mystery of the gospel,
verse	49	6	20	for which I am an ambassador in chains; that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.
verse	49	6	21	But that you also may know my affairs and how I am doing, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, will make all things known to you;
verse	49	6	22	whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that you may know our affairs, and that he may comfort your hearts.
verse	49	6	23	Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	49	6	24	Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
verse	50	1	1	Paul and Timothy, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:
verse	50	1	2	Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	50	1	3	I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,
verse	50	1	4	always in every prayer of mine making request for you all with joy,
verse	50	1	5	for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now,
verse	50	1	6	being confident of this very thing, that He who has begun a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ;
verse	50	1	7	just as it is right for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart, inasmuch as both in my chains and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, you all are partakers of my grace.
verse	50	1	8	Because, God is my witness, how greatly I long for you all with the affection of Jesus Christ.
verse	50	1	9	And this I pray, that your love may abound still more and more in knowledge and in all discernment,
verse	50	1	10	that you may approve the things that are excellent, that you may be sincere and without offense until the day of Christ,
verse	50	1	11	being filled with the fruits of righteousness which are by Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.
verse	50	1	12	But I want you to understand, brethren, that the things which happened to me have actually turned out for the furtherance of the gospel,
verse	50	1	13	so that it has become evident to the entire palace, and to every other place, that my chains are in Christ;
verse	50	1	14	and most of the brethren in the Lord, having become confident by my chains, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
verse	50	1	15	Some indeed preach Christ even from envy and strife, and some also from goodwill:
verse	50	1	16	The former preach Christ from contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my chains;
verse	50	1	17	but the other out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the gospel.
verse	50	1	18	What then? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is preached; and in this I rejoice, yes, and will rejoice.
verse	50	1	19	Because, I know that this will turn out for my deliverance through your prayer and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
verse	50	1	20	according to my earnest expectation and my hope that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ will be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death.
verse	50	1	21	Because to me, to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
verse	50	1	22	But if I live on in the flesh, this will mean fruit from my labor; yet what I shall choose I do not know.
verse	50	1	23	Because, I am hard pressed between the two, having a desire to depart and be with Christ, which is far better.
verse	50	1	24	Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.
verse	50	1	25	And being confident of this, I know that I will abide and continue with you all for your progress and joy of faith,
verse	50	1	26	that your rejoicing for me may be more abundant in Jesus Christ by my coming to you again.
verse	50	1	27	Only let your conduct be worthy of the gospel of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or am absent, I may hear of your affairs, that you stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel,
verse	50	1	28	and not in any way terrified by your adversaries, which is to them a proof of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that from God.
verse	50	1	29	Because, to you it has been granted on behalf of Christ, not only to believe on Him, but also to suffer for His sake,
verse	50	1	30	having the same conflict which you saw in me and now hear is in me.
verse	50	2	1	Therefore if there is any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any affection and mercy,
verse	50	2	2	fulfill my joy by being likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.
verse	50	2	3	Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory, but in lowliness of mind let each esteem others better than themselves.
