verse	50	2	4	Let each of you look out not only for his own interests, but also for the interests of others.
verse	50	2	5	Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus,
verse	50	2	6	who, being in the form of God, did not consider it robbery to be equal with God,
verse	50	2	7	but made Himself of no reputation, and took on Himself the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men.
verse	50	2	8	And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to death, even the death of the cross.
verse	50	2	9	Therefore God also has highly exalted Him and given Him a name which is above every name,
verse	50	2	10	that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth,
verse	50	2	11	and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
verse	50	2	12	Therefore, my beloved, as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with reverence and trembling;
verse	50	2	13	because, it is God who works in you both to will and to do for His good pleasure.
verse	50	2	14	Do all things without complaining and disputing,
verse	50	2	15	that you may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God without fault in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you shine as lights in the world,
verse	50	2	16	holding forth the word of life, so that I may rejoice in the day of Christ that I have not run in vain or labored in vain.
verse	50	2	17	Yes, and if I am being offered on the sacrifice and service of your faith, I am glad and rejoice with you all.
verse	50	2	18	For the same reason you also be glad and rejoice with me.
verse	50	2	19	But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you shortly, that I also may be encouraged when I know your state.
verse	50	2	20	Because I have no one likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
verse	50	2	21	Because all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ's.
verse	50	2	22	But you know his proven character, that like a son with his father, he served with me in the gospel.
verse	50	2	23	Therefore I hope to send him at once, as soon as I see how it will go with me.
verse	50	2	24	But I trust in the Lord that I myself shall also come shortly.
verse	50	2	25	Yet I considered it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, and fellow soldier, but your messenger and he who ministered to my need;
verse	50	2	26	since he was longing for you all, and was full of heaviness, because you had heard that he had been sick.
verse	50	2	27	Because, indeed he was sick almost to death; but God had mercy on him, and not only on him but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
verse	50	2	28	Therefore I sent him the more eagerly, that when you see him again you may rejoice, and I may be less sorrowful.
verse	50	2	29	Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness, and hold such men in esteem;
verse	50	2	30	because for the work of Christ he came close to death, not regarding his life, to supply what was lacking in your service toward me.
verse	50	3	1	Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. For me to write the same things to you is not tedious, but for you it is safe.
verse	50	3	2	Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the mutilation!
verse	50	3	3	Because, we are the circumcision, who worship God in the Spirit, rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh,
verse	50	3	4	though I also might have confidence in the flesh. If anyone else thinks he may have confidence in the flesh, I more so:
verse	50	3	5	circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of the Hebrews; concerning the law, a Pharisee;
verse	50	3	6	concerning zeal, persecuting the church; concerning the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.
verse	50	3	7	But what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ.
verse	50	3	8	Yet indeed I also count all things as loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as manure, that I may gain Christ
verse	50	3	9	and be found in Him, not having my own righteousness, which is from the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith;
verse	50	3	10	that I may know Him and the power of His resurrection, and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death,
verse	50	3	11	if, by any means, I may attain to the resurrection from the dead.
verse	50	3	12	Not that I have already attained, or am already perfected; but I press on, that I may apprehend that for which Christ Jesus has also laid hold of me.
verse	50	3	13	Brethren, I do not count myself to have attained; but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind and reaching forward to those things which are ahead,
verse	50	3	14	I press toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
verse	50	3	15	Therefore let us, as many as are perfect, have this mind; and if in anything you think otherwise, God will reveal even this to you.
verse	50	3	16	Nevertheless, to the degree that we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us be of the same mind.
verse	50	3	17	Brethren, join in following my example, and note those who so walk, as you have us for an example.
verse	50	3	18	Because many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ:
verse	50	3	19	whose end is destruction, whose god is their belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things.
verse	50	3	20	Because, our citizenship is in heaven, from which we also eagerly wait for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	50	3	21	who will transform our vile body that it may be conformed to His glorious body, according to the working by which He is able even to subdue all things to Himself.
verse	50	4	1	Therefore, my greatly beloved and longed for brethren, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my greatly beloved.
verse	50	4	2	I implore Euodia and I implore Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord.
verse	50	4	3	And I urge you also, true companion, help those women who labored with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the Book of Life.
verse	50	4	4	Rejoice in the Lord always. And again I will say, rejoice!
verse	50	4	5	Let your moderation be known to all men. The Lord is at hand.
verse	50	4	6	Be anxious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God;
verse	50	4	7	and the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
verse	50	4	8	Finally, brethren, whatever things are true, whatever things are honest, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report, if there is any virtue and if there is anything praiseworthy, meditate on these things.
verse	50	4	9	Those things which you learned and received and heard and saw in me, these do also, and the God of peace will be with you.
verse	50	4	10	But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at last your care for me has flourished again; though you surely did care, but you lacked opportunity.
verse	50	4	11	Not that I speak in regard to need, because I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content with it:
verse	50	4	12	I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound. Everywhere and in all things I have learned both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.
verse	50	4	13	I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
verse	50	4	14	Nevertheless you have done well that you shared in my affliction.
verse	50	4	15	Now you Philippians know also that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church shared with me concerning giving and receiving but you alone.
verse	50	4	16	Because even in Thessalonica you sent aid once and again for my necessities.
verse	50	4	17	Not because I desire the gift, but I desire the fruit that abounds to your account.
verse	50	4	18	But I have all and abound. I am full, having received from Epaphroditus the things that were sent from you, a sweet smelling aroma, an acceptable sacrifice, well pleasing to God.
verse	50	4	19	And my God will supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
verse	50	4	20	Now to our God and Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verse	50	4	21	Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren who are with me greet you.
verse	50	4	22	All the saints greet you, but especially those who are of Caesar's household.
verse	50	4	23	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verse	51	1	1	Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verse	51	1	2	To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ who are at Colosse: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	51	1	3	We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, always praying for you,
verse	51	1	4	since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of your love for all the saints;
verse	51	1	5	because of the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel,
verse	51	1	6	which has come to you, as it has also in all the world, and is bearing fruit, as it is also among you since the day you heard about it, and knew the grace of God in truth;
verse	51	1	7	as you also learned from Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf,
verse	51	1	8	who also declared to us your love in the Spirit.
verse	51	1	9	For this reason we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that you may be filled with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
verse	51	1	10	that you may walk worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing Him, being fruitful in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God;
verse	51	1	11	strengthened with all might, according to His glorious power, for all patience and longsuffering with joy;
verse	51	1	12	giving thanks to the Father who has qualified us to be partakers in the inheritance of the saints in the light,
verse	51	1	13	who has delivered us from the power of darkness and translated us into the kingdom of His beloved Son,
verse	51	1	14	in whom we have redemption through His blood even the forgiveness of sins.
verse	51	1	15	He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation.
verse	51	1	16	Because, all things were created by Him that are in heaven and that are on earth, visible and invisible, whether they are thrones or dominions or principalities or powers. All things were created by Him and for Him.
verse	51	1	17	And He is before all things, and by Him all things consist.
verse	51	1	18	And He is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things He may have the preeminence.
verse	51	1	19	Because, it pleased the Father that in Him all the fullness should dwell,
verse	51	1	20	and by Him, having made peace through the blood of His cross, to reconcile all things to Himself, by Him, whether things on earth or things in heaven.
verse	51	1	21	And you, who once were alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now He has reconciled
verse	51	1	22	in the body of His flesh through death, to present you holy, and blameless, and above reproach in His sight,
verse	51	1	23	if you continue in the faith, grounded and steadfast, and are not moved away from the hope of the gospel which you heard, and which was preached to every creature under heaven, of which I, Paul, became a minister.
verse	51	1	24	I now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up in my flesh what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ, for the sake of His body, which is the church,
verse	51	1	25	of which I became a minister according to the stewardship from God which was given to me for you, to fulfill the word of God,
verse	51	1	26	even the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations, but now has been revealed to His saints.
verse	51	1	27	To them God desired to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles: which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
verse	51	1	28	Him we preach, warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus.
verse	51	1	29	To this end I also labor, striving according to His working which works in me mightily.
verse	51	2	1	Because, I want you to know what a great conflict I have for you and for those in Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh,
verse	51	2	2	that their hearts may be encouraged, being knit together in love, and attaining to all the riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the knowledge of the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ,
verse	51	2	3	in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verse	51	2	4	Now this I say lest anyone should deceive you with persuasive words.
verse	51	2	5	Because, though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in the spirit, rejoicing to see your order and the firmness of your faith in Christ.
verse	51	2	6	Therefore, as you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him,
verse	51	2	7	rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith, just as you have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving.
verse	51	2	8	Beware lest anyone rob you through philosophy and vain deceit, according to the tradition of men, according to the basic principles of the world, and not according to Christ.
verse	51	2	9	Because, in Him dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily;
verse	51	2	10	and you are complete in Him, who is the head of all principality and power.
verse	51	2	11	In Him you were also circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, by putting off the body of the sins of the flesh, by the circumcision of Christ,
verse	51	2	12	buried with Him in baptism, in which you also were raised with Him through the faith of the working of God, who has raised Him from the dead.
verse	51	2	13	And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He has made alive together with Him, having forgiven you all trespasses,
verse	51	2	14	having erased the written record of commands that were against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to the cross.
verse	51	2	15	Having disarmed principalities and powers, He made a spectacle of them, triumphing over them in it.
verse	51	2	16	Therefore let no man judge you in food or in drink, or regarding a holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath days,
verse	51	2	17	which are a shadow of things to come, but the body is of Christ.
verse	51	2	18	Let no one rob you of your reward, delighting in false humility and worship of angels, meddling into those things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verse	51	2	19	And not clinging to the Head, from whom all the body, nourished and knit together by joints and ligaments, increases with the increase from God.
verse	51	2	20	Therefore, if you are dead with Christ from the basic principles of the world, why, as though living in the world, are you subject to regulations,
verse	51	2	21	("Do not touch, do not taste, do not handle,"
verse	51	2	22	which all concern things which perish with the using) according to the commandments and doctrines of men?
verse	51	2	23	These things certainly have an appearance of wisdom in self imposed worship and humility, and neglecting of the body, but have no value against the indulgence of the flesh.
verse	51	3	1	If then you are risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ is sitting at the right hand of God.
verse	51	3	2	Set your affections on things above, not on things on the earth.
verse	51	3	3	Because, you are dead, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verse	51	3	4	When Christ who is our life appears, then you also will appear with Him in glory.
verse	51	3	5	Therefore put to death your members which are on the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry.
verse	51	3	6	Because of these things the wrath of God is coming upon the children of disobedience,
verse	51	3	7	in which you also once walked when you lived in them.
verse	51	3	8	But now you also put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy language out of your mouth.
verse	51	3	9	Do not lie to one another, seeing you have put off the old man with his deeds,
verse	51	3	10	and have put on the new man, who is renewed in knowledge according to the image of Him who created him,
verse	51	3	11	where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcised nor uncircumcised, Barbarian, Scythian, slave nor free: but Christ is all and in all.
verse	51	3	12	Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, put on tender mercies, kindness, humility of mind, meekness, longsuffering;
verse	51	3	13	bearing with one another, and forgiving one another, if anyone has a complaint against another; just as Christ forgave you, so you do likewise.
verse	51	3	14	And above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfection.
verse	51	3	15	And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which you also were called in one body; and be thankful.
verse	51	3	16	Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
verse	51	3	17	And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by Him.
verse	51	3	18	Wives, submit to your own husbands, as is acceptable in the Lord.
verse	51	3	19	Husbands, love your wives, and do not be bitter against them.
verse	51	3	20	Children, obey your parents in all things, because this is well pleasing to the Lord.
verse	51	3	21	Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, lest they become discouraged.
verse	51	3	22	Servants, obey your masters according to the flesh in all things, not with eye service, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, reverencing God.
verse	51	3	23	And whatever you do, do it with all your heart, as to the Lord and not to men,
verse	51	3	24	knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; because you serve the Lord Christ.
verse	51	3	25	But he who does wrong will be repaid for the wrong that he has done, and there is no personal favoritism.
verse	51	4	1	Masters, give to your servants that which is just and balanced, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
verse	51	4	2	Continue in prayer, and watch in it with thanksgiving;
verse	51	4	3	meanwhile praying also for us, that God would open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in chains,
verse	51	4	4	that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
verse	51	4	5	Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time.
verse	51	4	6	Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each person.
verse	51	4	7	Tychicus, who is a beloved brother, a faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you about my state of affairs
verse	51	4	8	whom I have sent to you for the same purpose, that he might know your circumstances, and comfort your hearts,
verse	51	4	9	with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all things that are happening here.
verse	51	4	10	Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, with Mark, the sister's son of Barnabas, (about whom you received instructions: if he comes to you, receive him),
verse	51	4	11	and Jesus, who is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These are my only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who have proven to be a comfort to me.
verse	51	4	12	Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, greets you, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verse	51	4	13	Because, I bear him record, that he has a great zeal for you, and those who are in Laodicea, and those in Hierapolis.
verse	51	4	14	Luke, the beloved physician and Demas greet you.
verse	51	4	15	Greet the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church that is in his house.
verse	51	4	16	Now when this letter is read among you, see that it is read in the church of the Laodiceans also, and that you likewise read the letter from Laodicea.
verse	51	4	17	And say to Archippus, "Take heed to the ministry that you have received in the Lord, that you fulfill it."
verse	51	4	18	The salutation of Paul, by my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you. Amen.
verse	52	1	1	Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	52	1	2	We always give thanks to God for you all, making mention of you in our prayers,
verse	52	1	3	remembering without ceasing your work of faith, labor of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ in the sight of God even our Father,
verse	52	1	4	knowing, beloved brethren, your election by God.
verse	52	1	5	Because, our gospel did not come to you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit and in much assurance, as you know what sort of men we were among you for your sake.
verse	52	1	6	And you became followers of us and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Spirit,
verse	52	1	7	so that you were examples to all who believe in Macedonia and Achaia.
verse	52	1	8	Because, from you the word of the Lord sounded forth, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith towards God is proclaimed, so that we do not need to say anything.
verse	52	1	9	Because, they themselves declare concerning us what sort of entry we had to you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God,
verse	52	1	10	and to wait for His Son from heaven, whom He raised from the dead, even Jesus, who delivered us from the wrath to come.
verse	52	2	1	Because, you yourselves know brethren, that our coming to you was not in vain.
verse	52	2	2	But even after we had suffered beforehand and were disgraced at Philippi, as you know, we were bold in our God to speak to you the gospel of God in much conflict.
verse	52	2	3	Because, our exhortation did not come from deception, nor of uncleanness, nor in trickery.
verse	52	2	4	But as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, even so we speak, not as pleasing men, but God, who tests our hearts.
verse	52	2	5	Because, neither at any time did we use flattering words, as you know, nor a cloak of covetousness, God is witness.
verse	52	2	6	Nor did we seek glory from men, either from you or from others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.
verse	52	2	7	But we were gentle among you, even as a nursing mother cherishes her children.
verse	52	2	8	So affectionately longing for you, we were willing to impart to you, not just the gospel of God, but also our own souls, because you were dear to us.
verse	52	2	9	Because you remember, brethren, our labor and toil; because, laboring night and day, since we did not want to be a burden to any of you, we preached to you the gospel of God.
verse	52	2	10	You are witnesses, and God also, how holy and justly and blamelessly we behaved ourselves among you who believe;
verse	52	2	11	as you know how we exhorted and comforted and commanded every one of you, as a father does to his children,
verse	52	2	12	that you would walk worthy of God, who has called you into His kingdom and glory.
verse	52	2	13	For this reason also we thank God without ceasing, because when you received the word of God which you heard from us, you did not receive it as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which also effectually works in you who believe.
verse	52	2	14	Because you, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judea are in Christ Jesus. Because, you also have suffered similar things from your own countrymen, just as they have from the Jews,
verse	52	2	15	who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they do not please God, and are contrary to all men,
verse	52	2	16	forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved, to always fill up their sins; because of which the wrath is coming upon them to the uttermost.
verse	52	2	17	But we, brethren, being taken away from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavored more eagerly to see your face with great longing.
verse	52	2	18	Therefore we wanted to come to you, even I, Paul, time and again, but Satan hindered us.
verse	52	2	19	Because what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Is it not even you in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at His coming?
verse	52	2	20	Because you are our glory and joy.
verse	52	3	1	Therefore when we could no longer endure it, we thought it good to be left in Athens alone,
verse	52	3	2	and sent Timothy, our brother and minister of God, and our fellow laborer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you and to encourage you concerning your faith,
verse	52	3	3	that no one should be shaken by these afflictions; because you yourselves know that we are appointed to this.
verse	52	3	4	Because indeed, we told you before when we were with you that we would suffer tribulation, just as it came to pass, and you know.
verse	52	3	5	Because of this reason, when I could no longer endure it, I sent to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor might be in vain.
verse	52	3	6	But now when Timothy came to us from you, and brought us good news of your faith and love, and that you always have good remembrance of us, earnestly desiring to see us, as we also to see you,
verse	52	3	7	therefore, brethren, in all our affliction and distress we were comforted concerning you by your faith.
verse	52	3	8	Because now we live, if you stand firmly in the Lord.
verse	52	3	9	Because, what thanks can we offer back to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sake before our God,
verse	52	3	10	night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face and would perfect that which is lacking in your faith?
verse	52	3	11	Now may God Himself even our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way to you.
verse	52	3	12	And the Lord make you to increase and abound in love towards one another, and towards all men, just as we do towards you,
verse	52	3	13	so that He may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints.
verse	52	4	1	Furthermore then brethren, we urge you and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that just as you have received from us how you ought to walk and to please God, that you should abound more and more.
verse	52	4	2	Because, you know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus.
verse	52	4	3	Because, this is the will of God, your sanctification: that you should abstain from sexual immorality;
verse	52	4	4	that every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honor,
verse	52	4	5	not in the passion of lust, just as the Gentiles who do not know God;
verse	52	4	6	that no one should take advantage of and defraud his brother in any matter, because the Lord is the avenger of all such, as we have also forewarned you and testified.
verse	52	4	7	Because, God has not called us to uncleanness, but to holiness.
verse	52	4	8	Therefore he who despises, does not despise man, but God, who has also given to us His Holy Spirit.
verse	52	4	9	But concerning brotherly love you do not need that I should write to you, because you yourselves are taught by God to love one another;
verse	52	4	10	and indeed you do so toward all the brethren who are in all Macedonia. But we urge you, brethren, that you increase more and more;
verse	52	4	11	that you also study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you,
verse	52	4	12	that you may walk honestly toward those who are outside, and that you may lack nothing.
verse	52	4	13	But I do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning those who are asleep, that you do not mourn just like others who have no hope.
verse	52	4	14	Because, if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, in the same way, God will bring with Him those who sleep in Jesus.
verse	52	4	15	Because, we say this to you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will not go before those who are asleep.
verse	52	4	16	Because, the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet of God. Then the dead in Christ will rise first.
verse	52	4	17	Then we who are alive and remain will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And then we will always be with the Lord.
verse	52	4	18	Therefore comfort one another with these words.
verse	52	5	1	But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, you do not have any need that I write to you.
verse	52	5	2	Because, you yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord comes as a thief in the night.
verse	52	5	3	Because, when they say, "Peace and safety!" then sudden destruction comes upon them, like labor pains upon a pregnant woman. And they will not escape.
verse	52	5	4	But you, brethren, are not in darkness, that this Day should overtake you like a thief.
verse	52	5	5	You are all the children of light, and the children of the day, we are not of the night, nor of darkness.
verse	52	5	6	Therefore let us not sleep, as others do, but let us watch and be sober.
verse	52	5	7	Because, those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who are drunk are drunk at night.
verse	52	5	8	But let us who are of the day be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet, the hope of salvation.
verse	52	5	9	Because, God has not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	52	5	10	who died for us, that whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with Him.
verse	52	5	11	Therefore comfort each other and edify one another, just as you also are doing.
verse	52	5	12	And we urge you, brethren, to recognize those who labor among you, and are over you in the Lord and advise you,
verse	52	5	13	and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. And be at peace among yourselves.
verse	52	5	14	Now we exhort you, brethren, warn those who are disorderly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient towards everyone.
verse	52	5	15	See that no one renders evil for evil to anyone, but always pursue that which is good both for yourselves, and for everyone.
verse	52	5	16	Rejoice always,
verse	52	5	17	pray without ceasing,
verse	52	5	18	in everything give thanks; because this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.
verse	52	5	19	Do not quench the Spirit.
verse	52	5	20	Do not despise prophecies.
verse	52	5	21	Test all things; hold firmly to that which is good.
verse	52	5	22	Abstain from every appearance of evil.
verse	52	5	23	And may the God of peace sanctify you completely; and I ask God that your entire spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	52	5	24	He who calls you is faithful, who also will do it.
verse	52	5	25	Brethren, pray for us.
verse	52	5	26	Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss.
verse	52	5	27	I command you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the holy brethren.
verse	52	5	28	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
verse	53	1	1	Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
verse	53	1	2	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	53	1	3	We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is fitting, because your faith grows exceptionally, and the love of every one of you all abounds toward each other,
verse	53	1	4	so that we ourselves boast about you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and afflictions that you endure,
verse	53	1	5	which is clear evidence of the righteous judgment of God, that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you also suffer;
verse	53	1	6	seeing it is a righteous thing with God to repay with affliction those who trouble you,
verse	53	1	7	and you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus will be revealed from heaven with His mighty angels,
verse	53	1	8	in flaming fire taking vengeance on those who do not know God, and who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	53	1	9	These will be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of His power,
verse	53	1	10	when He comes in that day to be glorified in His saints, and to be admired among all those who believe, because our testimony among you was believed.
verse	53	1	11	Therefore we also pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfill all the good pleasure of His goodness, and the work of faith with power,
verse	53	1	12	that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and you in Him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	53	2	1	Now brethren, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and concerning our gathering together to Him, we urge you,
verse	53	2	2	not to be suddenly shaken in mind or to be troubled, either by a spirit or by a word, or by a letter as if from us, as though the Day of Christ is at hand.
verse	53	2	3	Let no one deceive you by any means; because, that Day will not come unless a falling away comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of perdition,
verse	53	2	4	who opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God or that is worshiped, so that he sits as God in the temple of God, declaring that he himself is God.
verse	53	2	5	Do you not remember that when I was still with you, I told you these things?
verse	53	2	6	And now you know what is restraining that he might be revealed in his time.
verse	53	2	7	Because, the mystery of iniquity is at work already; only He who now restrains will restrain, until He is taken out of the way.
verse	53	2	8	And then that wicked one will be revealed, whom the Lord will consume with the Spirit of His mouth and will destroy with the brightness of His coming.
verse	53	2	9	Even him, whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power, signs, and lying wonders,
verse	53	2	10	and with all unrighteous deception amongst those who perish, because they did not receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved.
verse	53	2	11	And for this reason God will send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie,
verse	53	2	12	that they all might be damned who did not believe the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
verse	53	2	13	But we are bound to give thanks to God always for you, brethren beloved by the Lord, because God has chosen you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth,
verse	53	2	14	to which He called you by our gospel, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	53	2	15	Therefore, brethren, stand firm, and hold the traditions which you were taught, whether by word or our letter.
verse	53	2	16	Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself, and God, even our Father, who has loved us and has given us everlasting help and good hope through grace,
verse	53	2	17	encourage your hearts and establish you in every good word and work.
verse	53	3	1	Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have a free course, and be glorified, just as it is with you,
verse	53	3	2	and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men; because not everyone has faith.
verse	53	3	3	But the Lord is faithful, who will establish you and keep you from evil.
verse	53	3	4	And we have confidence in the Lord concerning you, both that you do and will do the things that we command you.
verse	53	3	5	Now may the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the perseverance for Christ.
verse	53	3	6	Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw yourselves from every brother who walks disorderly and not according to the tradition which he received from us.
verse	53	3	7	Because you yourselves know how you ought to follow us, because we were not disorderly among you;
verse	53	3	8	Neither did we eat anyone's bread free of charge, but worked with labor and toil night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you,
verse	53	3	9	not because we do not have authority, but to make of ourselves an example of how you should follow us.
verse	53	3	10	Because, even when we were with you, we commanded you this: That if anyone will not work, neither should he eat.
verse	53	3	11	Because, we hear that there are some who walk among you in a disorderly manner, not working at all, but are busybodies.
verse	53	3	12	Now those who are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ that they work in quietness and eat their own bread.
verse	53	3	13	But as for you, brethren, do not become weary in doing good.
verse	53	3	14	And if anyone does not obey our word in this letter, note that person, and do not keep company with him, that he may be ashamed.
verse	53	3	15	Yet count him not as an enemy, but instruct him as a brother.
verse	53	3	16	Now may the Lord of peace Himself give you peace always in every way. The Lord be with you all.
verse	53	3	17	The salutation of Paul with my own hand, which is confirmation in every letter; so I write.
verse	53	3	18	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verse	54	1	1	Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the commandment of God our Savior and the Lord Jesus Christ, who is our hope,
verse	54	1	2	To Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.
verse	54	1	3	As I urged you when I went into Macedonia, remain in Ephesus that you may command some that they teach no other doctrine,
verse	54	1	4	nor give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions rather than godly edification which is in faith, so do.
verse	54	1	5	Now the purpose of the commandment is love from a pure heart, from a good conscience, and from sincere faith,
verse	54	1	6	from which some, having strayed, have turned aside to idle talking,
verse	54	1	7	desiring to be teachers of the law, understanding neither what they say nor the things which they affirm.
verse	54	1	8	But we know that the law is good if one uses it lawfully,
verse	54	1	9	knowing this: that the law is not made for a righteous person, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,
verse	54	1	10	for fornicators, for those who defile themselves with mankind, for kidnappers, for liars, for perjurers, and if there is any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine,
verse	54	1	11	according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God which was committed to my trust.
verse	54	1	12	And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord who has enabled me, because He counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry,
verse	54	1	13	who was formerly a blasphemer, a persecutor, and an abusive man; but I obtained mercy because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.
verse	54	1	14	And the grace of our Lord was exceedingly abundant, with faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.
verse	54	1	15	This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am chief.
verse	54	1	16	However, for this reason I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might show forth all longsuffering, as a pattern to those who are going to believe on Him for everlasting life.
verse	54	1	17	Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, to God who alone is wise, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
verse	54	1	18	This command I commit to you, son Timothy, according to the prophecies previously made concerning you, that by them you may wage the good warfare,
verse	54	1	19	holding to faith and a good conscience, which some having rejected, concerning the faith have suffered shipwreck,
verse	54	1	20	of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I delivered to Satan that they may learn not to blaspheme.
verse	54	2	1	Therefore I exhort first of all that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks be made for all men,
verse	54	2	2	for kings and for all who are in authority, that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.
verse	54	2	3	Because, this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior,
verse	54	2	4	who desires all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verse	54	2	5	Because there is one God and one Mediator between God and men, the Man Christ Jesus,
verse	54	2	6	who gave Himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time,
verse	54	2	7	because of which I was appointed a preacher and an apostle, I am speaking the truth in Christ and not lying, a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
verse	54	2	8	I desire therefore that the men pray everywhere, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting;
verse	54	2	9	in like manner also, that the women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with propriety and moderation, not with braided hair or gold or pearls or costly clothing,
verse	54	2	10	but, which is proper for women professing godliness, with good works.
verse	54	2	11	Let the woman learn in silence with all submission.
verse	54	2	12	And I do not permit the woman to teach or to have authority over the man, but to be in silence.
verse	54	2	13	Because Adam was formed first, then Eve.
verse	54	2	14	And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived, fell into transgression.
verse	54	2	15	Nevertheless she will be saved in childbearing if they continue in faith, love, and holiness, with self control.
verse	54	3	1	This is a faithful saying: If a man desires the position of a bishop, he desires a good work.
verse	54	3	2	A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, temperate, sober, of good behavior, given to hospitality, able to teach;
verse	54	3	3	not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for money, but gentle, not quarrelsome, not covetous;
verse	54	3	4	one who rules his own house well, having his children in submission with all reverence
verse	54	3	5	(because, if a man does not know how to rule his own house, how will he take care of the church of God?);
verse	54	3	6	not a novice, lest being puffed up with pride he fall into the same condemnation as the devil.
verse	54	3	7	Moreover he must have a good testimony among those who are outside, lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.
verse	54	3	8	Likewise deacons must be reverent, not double tongued, not slaves to wine bingeing, not greedy for money,
verse	54	3	9	holding the mystery of the faith with a pure conscience.
verse	54	3	10	But let these also first be tested; then let them serve as deacons, being found blameless.
verse	54	3	11	Likewise, their wives must be reverent, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.
verse	54	3	12	Let deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
verse	54	3	13	Because, those who have served well as deacons obtain for themselves a good standing and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verse	54	3	14	These things I write to you, though I hope to come to you shortly;
verse	54	3	15	but if I am delayed, so that you may know how you ought to conduct yourself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.
verse	54	3	16	And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifested in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen by angels, preached among the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.
verse	54	4	1	Now the Spirit expressly says that in latter times some will depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons,
verse	54	4	2	speaking lies in hypocrisy, having their own conscience seared with a hot iron,
verse	54	4	3	forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from foods which God has created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
verse	54	4	4	Because, every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be refused if it is received with thanksgiving;
verse	54	4	5	because it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
verse	54	4	6	If you put the brethren in remembrance of these things, you will be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished in the words of faith and of the good doctrine which you have carefully pursued.
verse	54	4	7	But reject profane and old wives' fables, and instead exercise yourself toward godliness.
verse	54	4	8	Because, bodily exercise profits a little, but godliness is profitable for all things, having promise of the life that now is and of that which is to come.
verse	54	4	9	This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance.
verse	54	4	10	Because, to this end we both labor and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe.
verse	54	4	11	These things command and teach.
verse	54	4	12	Let no one despise your youth, but be an example to the believers in word, in conduct, in love, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
verse	54	4	13	Until I come, give attention to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.
verse	54	4	14	Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the eldership.
verse	54	4	15	Meditate on these things; give yourself entirely to them, that your progress may be evident to all.
verse	54	4	16	Take heed to yourself and to the doctrine. Continue in them, because in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.
verse	54	5	1	Do not rebuke an older man, but exhort him as a father, younger men as brethren,
verse	54	5	2	older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, with all purity.
verse	54	5	3	Honor widows who are truly widows.
verse	54	5	4	But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to show piety at home and to repay their parents; because, this is good and acceptable before God.
verse	54	5	5	Now she who is truly a widow, and desolate, trusts in God and continues in supplications and prayers night and day.
verse	54	5	6	But she who lives in pleasure is dead while she lives.
verse	54	5	7	And these things give in commands, that they may be blameless.
verse	54	5	8	But if anyone does not provide for his own, and especially for those of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verse	54	5	9	Do not let a widow under sixty years old be taken into the number, and not unless she has been the wife of one man,
verse	54	5	10	well reported for good works: if she has brought up children, if she has lodged strangers, if she has washed the saints' feet, if she has relieved the afflicted, if she has diligently followed every good work.
verse	54	5	11	But refuse the younger widows; because, when they have, begun to grow immoral against Christ, they desire to marry,
verse	54	5	12	having damnation because they have cast off their first faith.
verse	54	5	13	And besides they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house, and not only idle but also gossips and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.
verse	54	5	14	Therefore I desire that the younger women marry, bear children, manage the house, give no opportunity to the adversary to speak reproachfully.
verse	54	5	15	Because, some have already turned aside after Satan.
verse	54	5	16	If any believing man or woman has widows, let them relieve them, and do not let the church be burdened, that it may relieve those who are truly widows.
verse	54	5	17	Let the older men who rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in the word and doctrine.
verse	54	5	18	Because, the Scripture says, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain," and, "The laborer is worthy of his wages."
verse	54	5	19	Do not receive an accusation against an older man except from two or three witnesses.
verse	54	5	20	Those who are sinning rebuke in the presence of all, that others also may have reverence.
verse	54	5	21	I command you before God and the Lord Jesus Christ and the elect angels that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing with personal favoritism.
verse	54	5	22	Do not lay hands on anyone hastily, nor be a partaker in other people's sins; keep yourself pure.
verse	54	5	23	No longer drink only water, but use a little grape juice for your stomach's sake and your frequent weaknesses.
verse	54	5	24	Some men's sins are clearly evident, preceding them to judgment, but those of some men follow afterwards.
verse	54	5	25	Likewise also, the good works of some are clearly manifest beforehand, and those that are otherwise cannot be hidden.
verse	54	6	1	Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor, so that the name of God and His doctrine may not be blasphemed.
verse	54	6	2	And those who have believing masters, let them not despise them because they are brethren, but rather serve them because those who are benefited are faithful and beloved. Teach and exhort these things.
verse	54	6	3	If anyone teaches otherwise and does not consent to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness,
verse	54	6	4	he is proud, knowing nothing, but is obsessed with disputes and arguments over words, from which come envy, strife, reviling, evil suspicions,
verse	54	6	5	useless disputations of men of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth, who suppose that gain is godliness. From such withdraw yourself.
verse	54	6	6	Now godliness with contentment is great gain.
verse	54	6	7	Because, we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.
verse	54	6	8	And having food and clothing, with these we should be content.
verse	54	6	9	But those who desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and harmful lusts which drown men in destruction and perdition.
verse	54	6	10	Because, the love of money is the root of all evil, for which some have strayed from the faith in their covetousness, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
verse	54	6	11	But you, O man of God, flee these things and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.
verse	54	6	12	Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, to which you were also called and have confessed a good confession before of many witnesses.
verse	54	6	13	I command you in the sight of God who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus who witnessed a good confession before Pontius Pilate,
verse	54	6	14	that you keep this commandment without spot, blameless until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verse	54	6	15	which He will reveal in His own timeframe, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
verse	54	6	16	who alone has immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light, whom no man has seen or can see, to whom be honor and everlasting power. Amen.
verse	54	6	17	Command those who are rich in this present age not to be arrogant, nor to trust in uncertain riches but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy.
verse	54	6	18	That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to share,
verse	54	6	19	storing up for themselves a good foundation for the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
verse	54	6	20	O Timothy! Guard that which was committed to your trust, avoiding profane and idle babblings and contradictions of what is falsely called science,
verse	54	6	21	by professing it some have strayed concerning the faith. Grace be with you. Amen.
verse	55	1	1	Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,
verse	55	1	2	To Timothy, my dearly beloved son. Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verse	55	1	3	I thank God, whom I serve with a pure conscience, as my forefathers did, that without ceasing I remember you in my prayers night and day,
verse	55	1	4	greatly desiring to see you, being mindful of your tears, that I may be filled with joy,
verse	55	1	5	when I call to remembrance the genuine faith that is in you, which dwelt first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice, and I am persuaded is in you also.
verse	55	1	6	Therefore I remind you to stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
verse	55	1	7	Because, God has not given us the spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind.
verse	55	1	8	Therefore do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me His prisoner, but share with me in the afflictions for the gospel according to the power of God,
verse	55	1	9	who has saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace which was given to us in Christ Jesus before the ages began,
verse	55	1	10	but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ, who has abolished death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel,
verse	55	1	11	to which I was appointed a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.
verse	55	1	12	For this reason I also suffer these things; nevertheless I am not ashamed, because I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day.
verse	55	1	13	Hold fast the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.
verse	55	1	14	That good thing which was committed to you, keep by the Holy Spirit who dwells in us.
verse	55	1	15	This you know, that all those in Asia have turned away from me, among whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.
verse	55	1	16	The Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain;
verse	55	1	17	but when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently and found me.
verse	55	1	18	The Lord grant to him that he may find mercy from the Lord in that Day, and you know very well how many ways he ministered to me at Ephesus.
verse	55	2	1	You therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verse	55	2	2	And the things that you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men who will be able to teach others also.
verse	55	2	3	You therefore endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
verse	55	2	4	No one engaged in warfare entangles himself with the affairs of this life, that he may please him who enlisted him as a soldier.
verse	55	2	5	And likewise if anyone competes in athletics, he is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules.
verse	55	2	6	The hardworking farmer must be first to partake of the crops.
verse	55	2	7	Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.
verse	55	2	8	Remember that Jesus Christ, of the seed of David, was raised from the dead according to my gospel,
verse	55	2	9	for which I suffer trouble as an evildoer, even to the point of chains; but the word of God is not bound.
verse	55	2	10	Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verse	55	2	11	This is a faithful saying: because if we died with Him, we will also live with Him.
verse	55	2	12	If we suffer, we will also reign with Him. If we deny Him, He also will deny us.
verse	55	2	13	If we are faithless, He remains faithful; He cannot deny Himself.
verse	55	2	14	Remind them of these things, commanding them before the Lord not to strive about words to no profit, to the ruin of the hearers.
verse	55	2	15	Study to present yourself approved to God, a worker who does not need to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
verse	55	2	16	But shun profane and vain babblings, because they will increase to more ungodliness.
verse	55	2	17	And their word will eat like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are of this sort,
verse	55	2	18	who have strayed concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past; and they overthrow the faith of some.
verse	55	2	19	Nevertheless the foundation of God stands firm, having this seal: "The Lord knows those who are His," and, "Let everyone who names the name of Christ depart from iniquity."
verse	55	2	20	But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay, some for honor and some for dishonor.
verse	55	2	21	Therefore if anyone cleanses himself from the latter, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified and useful for the Master, and prepared for every good work.
verse	55	2	22	Flee youthful lusts also; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verse	55	2	23	But avoid foolish and ignorant disputes, knowing that they generate strife.
verse	55	2	24	And a servant of the Lord must not quarrel but be gentle to all people, able to teach, patient,
verse	55	2	25	in humility correcting those who are in opposition, if God perhaps will grant them repentance, so that they may know the truth,
verse	55	2	26	and that they may come to their senses and escape the snare of the devil, having been taken captive by him to do his will.
verse	55	3	1	Also know this, that in the last days perilous times will come:
verse	55	3	2	Because, men will be lovers of themselves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
verse	55	3	3	without natural affection, covenant breakers, slanderers, without self control, brutal, despisers of those who are good,
verse	55	3	4	traitors, headstrong, haughty, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God,
verse	55	3	5	having a form of godliness but denying its power. And from such people turn away!
verse	55	3	6	Because, of this sort are those who creep into households and make captives of gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts,
verse	55	3	7	always learning and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verse	55	3	8	Now as Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, disapproved concerning the faith;
verse	55	3	9	but they will progress no further, because their folly will be manifest to all people, as theirs also was.
verse	55	3	10	But you have fully followed my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, perseverance,
verse	55	3	11	persecutions, afflictions, which happened to me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra, what persecutions I endured, but the Lord delivered me out of them all.
verse	55	3	12	Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.
verse	55	3	13	But evil men and seducers will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
verse	55	3	14	But you must continue in the things which you have learned and been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them,
verse	55	3	15	and that from childhood you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verse	55	3	16	All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness,
verse	55	3	17	that the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly equipped for every good work.
verse	55	4	1	I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at His appearing and His kingdom:
verse	55	4	2	Preach the word! Be ready in season and out of season. Convince, rebuke, exhort, with all longsuffering and doctrine.
verse	55	4	3	Because, the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine, but according to their own desires, they will heap up for themselves teachers, having itching ears,
verse	55	4	4	and they will turn their ears away from the truth, and will be turned aside to fables.
verse	55	4	5	But you be watchful in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make your ministry complete.
verse	55	4	6	Because, I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.
verse	55	4	7	I have fought the good fight, I have finished my race, I have kept the faith.
verse	55	4	8	After this, there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give me at that Day, and not to me only but also to all who love His appearing.
verse	55	4	9	Be diligent to come to me quickly;
verse	55	4	10	because Demas has forsaken me, having loved this present world, and has departed for Thessalonica, Crescens for Galatia, Titus for Dalmatia.
verse	55	4	11	Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is profitable to me for the ministry.
verse	55	4	12	And Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus.
verse	55	4	13	When you come, bring the cloak with you that I left with Carpus at Troas, and the books, but especially the parchments.
verse	55	4	14	Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil. May the Lord repay him according to his works.
verse	55	4	15	You also must beware of him, because he has greatly resisted our words.
verse	55	4	16	At my first defense no one stood with me, but everyone forsook me. I ask God that it may not be charged against them.
verse	55	4	17	But the Lord stood with me and strengthened me, so that through me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear. Also I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
verse	55	4	18	And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work and will preserve me for His heavenly kingdom. To Him be glory forever and ever. Amen!
verse	55	4	19	Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
verse	55	4	20	Erastus stayed in Corinth, but Trophimus I have left in Miletus sick.
verse	55	4	21	Do your utmost to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, as well as Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brethren.
verse	55	4	22	The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
verse	56	1	1	Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect and the acknowledgment of the truth which is according to godliness,
verse	56	1	2	in hope of eternal life which God, who cannot lie, promised before the ages began,
verse	56	1	3	but has in due time manifested His word through preaching, which is committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior;
verse	56	1	4	To Titus, my own son according to the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.
verse	56	1	5	I left you in Crete for this purpose, that you should set in order the things that are lacking, and ordain elders in every city as I appointed you.
verse	56	1	6	If a man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of dissipation or insubordination.
verse	56	1	7	Because, a bishop must be blameless, as a steward of God, not self willed, not quick tempered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for money,
verse	56	1	8	but a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, self controlled,
verse	56	1	9	holding fast the faithful word as he has been taught, that he may be able, by sound doctrine, both to exhort and convict those who contradict.
verse	56	1	10	Because, there are many insubordinate, both idle talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
verse	56	1	11	whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert entire households, teaching things which they ought not to, for the sake of dishonest gain.
verse	56	1	12	One of them, even a prophet of their own, said, "The Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons."
verse	56	1	13	This testimony is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
verse	56	1	14	not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn from the truth.
verse	56	1	15	To the pure all things are pure, but to those who are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but even their mind and conscience are defiled.
verse	56	1	16	They profess that they know God, but in works they deny Him, being abominable, disobedient, and disqualified for every good work.
verse	56	2	1	But as for you, speak the things which are proper for sound doctrine:
verse	56	2	2	that the older men be sober, reverent, temperate, sound in faith, in love, in patience;
verse	56	2	3	the older women likewise, that they demonstrate holiness in behavior, not slanderers, not slaves to wine bingeing, teachers of good things;
verse	56	2	4	that they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
verse	56	2	5	to be discreet, chaste, homemakers, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be blasphemed.
verse	56	2	6	Likewise, exhort the young men to be sober minded,
verse	56	2	7	in all things showing yourself to be a pattern of good works; in doctrine showing incorruptibility reverence, integrity,
verse	56	2	8	sound speech that cannot be condemned, that one who is an opponent may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
verse	56	2	9	Exhort servants to be obedient to their own masters, and to be well pleasing in all things, not answering back,
verse	56	2	10	not stealing, but showing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.
verse	56	2	11	Because, the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men,
verse	56	2	12	teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly in the present age,
verse	56	2	13	looking for that blessed hope and the glorious appearing of the great God even our Savior Jesus Christ,
verse	56	2	14	who gave Himself for us, that He might redeem us from all iniquity and purify for Himself His own special people, zealous for good works.
verse	56	2	15	Speak these things, exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise you.
verse	56	3	1	Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities, to obey magistrates, to be ready for every good work,
verse	56	3	2	to speak evil of no one, not quarrelsome but gentle, showing all meekness to all men.
verse	56	3	3	Because, we ourselves were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another.
verse	56	3	4	But when the kindness and the love of God our Savior toward man appeared,
verse	56	3	5	not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to His mercy He saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,
verse	56	3	6	whom He poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior,
verse	56	3	7	that having been justified by His grace we should become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verse	56	3	8	This is a faithful saying, and these things I want you to affirm constantly, that those who have believed in God should be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men.
verse	56	3	9	But avoid foolish disputes, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law; because they are unprofitable and vain.
verse	56	3	10	A person who is a heretic reject after the first and second admonition,
verse	56	3	11	knowing that such a person is warped and sinning, being self condemned.
verse	56	3	12	When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
verse	56	3	13	Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey with care, that they may lack nothing.
verse	56	3	14	And let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
verse	56	3	15	All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
verse	57	1	1	Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved friend, and fellow laborer,
verse	57	1	2	to our beloved Apphia, Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:
verse	57	1	3	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	57	1	4	I thank my God, making mention of you always in my prayers,
verse	57	1	5	hearing of your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints,
verse	57	1	6	that the sharing of your faith may become effectual by acknowledging every good thing that is in you in Christ Jesus.
verse	57	1	7	Because, we have great joy and consolation in your love, because, the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you, brother.
verse	57	1	8	Therefore, although I could be very bold in Christ to command you that which is appropriate,
verse	57	1	9	yet for love's sake I rather make request of you, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ:
verse	57	1	10	I make request of you for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten while in my chains,
verse	57	1	11	who was formerly unprofitable to you, but is now profitable to you and to me.
verse	57	1	12	Whom I have sent again. Therefore you receive him, that is, my own heart,
verse	57	1	13	whom I would have kept with me, that in your position, he might have ministered to me in the chains of the gospel.
verse	57	1	14	But I did not want to do anything without your consent, that your goodness might not be of obligation, but voluntary.
verse	57	1	15	Because, perhaps he departed for a season for this reason, that you might receive him forever,
verse	57	1	16	not now as a servant, but more than a servant, a beloved brother, especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord?
verse	57	1	17	If then you count me as a partner, receive him as you would me.
verse	57	1	18	If he has wronged you, or owes you anything, put that on my account.
verse	57	1	19	I Paul have written this with my own hand, I will repay it, not to mention to you how you also owe to me even your own lives.
verse	57	1	20	Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in the Lord.
verse	57	1	21	Having confidence in your obedience, I wrote to you, knowing that you will also do even more than I say.
verse	57	1	22	But, meanwhile, prepare for me a guest room also, because I trust that through the prayers of you all I shall be given to you all.
verse	57	1	23	Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
verse	57	1	24	also Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow laborers.
verse	57	1	25	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verse	58	1	1	God, who at various times and in diverse ways spoke in time past to the fathers through the prophets,
verse	58	1	2	has in these last days spoken to us by His Son, whom He has appointed heir of all things, by whom also He made the ages;
verse	58	1	3	who being the brightness of His glory and the express image of His person, and upholding all things by the word of His power, when He had by Himself purged our sins, sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
verse	58	1	4	having become so much better than the angels, as He has by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.
verse	58	1	5	Because, to which of the angels did He ever say: "You are My Son, today I have begotten You"? And again: "I will be to Him a Father, and He will be to Me a Son"?
verse	58	1	6	But when He again brings the firstborn into the world, He says: "Let all the angels of God worship Him."
verse	58	1	7	And of the angels He says: "Who makes His angels spirits and His ministers a flame of fire."
verse	58	1	8	But to the Son He says: "Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; a scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your kingdom.
verse	58	1	9	You have loved righteousness and hated iniquity; Therefore God, even Your God, has anointed You with the oil of gladness above Your companions."
verse	58	1	10	And: "You, LORD, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of Your hands.
verse	58	1	11	They will perish, but You remain; and they will all grow old like clothing;
verse	58	1	12	And like a cloak You will fold them up, and they will be changed. But You are the same, and Your years will not fail."
verse	58	1	13	But to which of the angels has He ever said: "Sit at My right hand, until I make Your enemies Your footstool"?
verse	58	1	14	Are they not all ministering spirits sent forth to minister for those who will inherit salvation?
verse	58	2	1	Therefore we ought to earnestly pay attention to the things we have heard, lest at any time we should let them slip away.
verse	58	2	2	Because, if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just reward,
verse	58	2	3	how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation, which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed to us by those who heard Him,
verse	58	2	4	God also bearing them witness both with signs and wonders, with various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to His own will?
verse	58	2	5	Because, He has not put the world to come, of which we speak, in subjection to angels.
verse	58	2	6	But one testified in a certain place, saying: "What is man that You are mindful of him, or the son of man that You visit him?
verse	58	2	7	You have made him a little lower than the angels; You have crowned him with glory and honor, and set him over the works of Your hands.
verse	58	2	8	You have put all things in subjection under his feet." Because, in that He put all in subjection under him, He left nothing that is not put under him. But now we do not yet see all things put under him.
verse	58	2	9	But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels, for the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that He, by the grace of God, might taste death for everyone.
verse	58	2	10	Because, it was fitting for Him, for whom are all things and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons to glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
verse	58	2	11	Because, both He who sanctifies and those who are being sanctified are all of one, for which reason He is not ashamed to call them brethren,
verse	58	2	12	saying: "I will declare Your name to My brethren; in the midst of the church I will sing praise to You."
verse	58	2	13	And again: "I will put My trust in Him." And again: "Here am I and the children whom God has given Me."
verse	58	2	14	Inasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, He Himself likewise shared in the same, that through death He might destroy him who had the power of death, that is, the devil,
verse	58	2	15	and deliver those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
verse	58	2	16	Because indeed He did not take upon Him the nature of angels, but He took on him the seed of Abraham.
verse	58	2	17	Therefore, in all things He had to be made like His brethren, that He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.
verse	58	2	18	Because, in that He Himself has suffered, being tempted, He is able to help those who are tempted.
verse	58	3	1	Therefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus,
verse	58	3	2	who was faithful to Him who appointed Him, as Moses also was faithful in all His house.
verse	58	3	3	Because, this Man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as He who built the house has more honor than the house.
verse	58	3	4	Because every house is built by someone, but He who built all things is God.
verse	58	3	5	And truly Moses was faithful in all His house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which would be spoken afterward,
verse	58	3	6	but Christ as a Son over His own house, whose house we are if we hold firmly to the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firmly to the end.
verse	58	3	7	Therefore, as the Holy Spirit says: "Today, if you will hear His voice,
verse	58	3	8	do not harden your hearts as in the provocation, in the day of trial in the wilderness,
verse	58	3	9	where your fathers tested Me, tried Me, and saw My works forty years.
verse	58	3	10	Therefore I was angry with that generation, and said, 'They always deceive in their heart, and they have not known My ways.'
verse	58	3	11	So I swore in My wrath, 'They will not enter into My rest.'"
verse	58	3	12	Beware, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God;
verse	58	3	13	but exhort one another daily, while it is called "Today," lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
verse	58	3	14	Because, we have become partakers of Christ if we hold the beginning of our confidence firmly to the end,
verse	58	3	15	while it is said: "Today, if you will hear His voice, do not harden your hearts as in the provocation."
verse	58	3	16	Because some, having heard, did provoke. However not all who came out of Egypt by Moses.
verse	58	3	17	Now with whom was He angry forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose corpses fell in the wilderness?
verse	58	3	18	And to whom did He swear that they would not enter His rest, but to those who did not believe?
verse	58	3	19	So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
verse	58	4	1	Therefore, since a promise remains of entering His rest, let us have reverence lest any of you seem to have come short of it.
verse	58	4	2	Because, the gospel was preached to us as well as to them; but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in those who heard it.
verse	58	4	3	Because, we who have believed do enter into rest, as He has said: "So I swore in My wrath, 'If they will enter into My rest,'" although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
verse	58	4	4	Because, He spoke in a certain place of the seventh day in this way: "And God rested on the seventh day from all His works";
verse	58	4	5	and again in this place: "If they will enter into My rest."
verse	58	4	6	Since therefore it remains that some must enter it, and those to whom it was first preached did not enter because of unbelief,
verse	58	4	7	again He declares a certain day, saying in David, "Today," after such a long time, as it has been said: "Today, if you will hear His voice, do not harden your hearts."
verse	58	4	8	Because, if Joshua had given them rest, then He would not have afterward spoken about another day.
verse	58	4	9	There remains therefore a rest for the people of God.
verse	58	4	10	Because, he who has entered His rest has himself also ceased from his own works as God did from His.
verse	58	4	11	Therefore let us labor to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall according to the same example of unbelief.
verse	58	4	12	Because, the word of God is living and powerful, and sharper than any two edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
verse	58	4	13	Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in His sight, but all things are naked and open to the eyes of Him to whom we must give account.
verse	58	4	14	Seeing then that we have a great High Priest who has passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.
