verse	58	4	15	Because, we do not have a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses, but was in all points tempted as we are, yet without sin.
verse	58	4	16	Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
verse	58	5	1	Because, every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.
verse	58	5	2	He can have compassion on those who are ignorant and on those who are going astray, since he himself is also subject to weakness.
verse	58	5	3	And because of this he ought, just as for the people so also for himself, to offer for sins.
verse	58	5	4	And no man takes this honor to himself, but he who is called by God, just as Aaron was.
verse	58	5	5	So also Christ did not glorify Himself to become a High Priest, but it was He who said to Him: "You are My Son, today I have begotten You."
verse	58	5	6	As He also says in another place: "You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek";
verse	58	5	7	who, in the days of His flesh, when He had offered up prayers and supplications, with strong cries and tears to Him who was able to save Him from death, and was heard because He had respect,
verse	58	5	8	though He was a Son, yet He learned obedience by the things which He suffered.
verse	58	5	9	And having been perfected, He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him,
verse	58	5	10	called by God as High Priest "according to the order of Melchizedek,"
verse	58	5	11	of whom we have much to say, and hard to explain, since you have become dull of hearing.
verse	58	5	12	Because, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you require that someone teaches you again what are the first principles of the oracles of God; and you have become such as have need of milk and not solid food.
verse	58	5	13	Because, everyone who partakes only of milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, because he is a babe.
verse	58	5	14	But solid food belongs to those who are of full age, that is, those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.
verse	58	6	1	Therefore, leaving the elementary principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on to perfection, not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works and of faith toward God,
verse	58	6	2	of the doctrine of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
verse	58	6	3	And this we will do if God permits.
verse	58	6	4	Because, it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift, and have become partakers of the Holy Spirit,
verse	58	6	5	and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come,
verse	58	6	6	if they shall fall away, to renew them again to repentance, since they crucify again for themselves the Son of God, and put Him to an open shame.
verse	58	6	7	Because, the earth which drinks in the rain that often comes upon it, and bears herbs useful for those by whom it is cultivated, receives blessing from God;
verse	58	6	8	but that which bears thorns and briers is rejected and is near to being cursed, whose end is to be burned.
verse	58	6	9	But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things concerning you, yes, things that accompany salvation, though we speak in this manner.
verse	58	6	10	Because, God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labor of love which you have shown toward His name, in that you have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
verse	58	6	11	And we desire that each one of you show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope until the end,
verse	58	6	12	that you do not become slothful, but followers of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verse	58	6	13	Because, when God made a promise to Abraham, because He could swear by no one greater, He swore by Himself,
verse	58	6	14	saying, "Surely blessing I will bless you, and multiplying I will multiply you."
verse	58	6	15	And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
verse	58	6	16	Because, men indeed swear by the greater, and an oath for confirmation is for them an end of all dispute.
verse	58	6	17	In this way, God, determining to show more abundantly to the heirs of promise the immutability of His counsel, confirmed it by an oath,
verse	58	6	18	that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we might have strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold of the hope set before us.
verse	58	6	19	This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and steadfast, and which enters into that which is behind the veil,
verse	58	6	20	where the forerunner has entered for us, even Jesus, having become High Priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.
verse	58	7	1	Because, this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the Most High God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,
verse	58	7	2	to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all, first being translated as "king of righteousness," and then also king of Salem, that is "king of peace,"
verse	58	7	3	without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like the Son of God, remains a priest continually.
verse	58	7	4	Now consider how great this man was, to whom even the patriarch Abraham gave a tenth of the spoils.
verse	58	7	5	And indeed those who are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to receive tithes from the people according to the law, that is, from their brethren, though they have come from the loins of Abraham;
verse	58	7	6	but he whose genealogy is not derived from them received tithes from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises.
verse	58	7	7	Now beyond all contradiction the lesser is blessed by the better.
verse	58	7	8	And here mortal men receive tithes, but there he receives them, of whom it is witnessed that he lives.
verse	58	7	9	And Levi also, who receives tithes, paid tithes through Abraham, so to speak,
verse	58	7	10	because he was still in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him.
verse	58	7	11	Therefore, if perfection were through the Levitical priesthood (because under it the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should rise according to the order of Melchizedek, and not be called according to the order of Aaron?
verse	58	7	12	Because, the priesthood being changed, of necessity there is also a change of the law.
verse	58	7	13	Because, He of whom these things are spoken belongs to another tribe, from which no man has served at the altar.
verse	58	7	14	Because, it is evident that our Lord arose out of Judah, of which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood.
verse	58	7	15	And it is yet far more evident if, in the likeness of Melchizedek, there arises another priest
verse	58	7	16	who is made, not according to the law of a fleshly commandment, but according to the power of an endless life.
verse	58	7	17	Because He testifies: "You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek."
verse	58	7	18	Because, on the one hand there is truly an annulling of the former commandment because of its weakness and unprofitableness,
verse	58	7	19	because, the law made nothing perfect; but the bringing in of a better hope did, by which we draw near to God.
verse	58	7	20	And inasmuch as He was not made priest without an oath
verse	58	7	21	(because, they have become priests without an oath, but He with an oath by Him who said to Him: "The LORD has sworn and will not relent, 'You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek'"),
verse	58	7	22	by so much more Jesus has become a surety of a better testament.
verse	58	7	23	Also truly there were many priests, because they were prevented by death from continuing.
verse	58	7	24	But this Man, because He continues forever, has an unchangeable priesthood.
verse	58	7	25	Therefore He is also able to save to the uttermost those who come to God by Him, since He always lives to make intercession for them.
verse	58	7	26	Because, such a High Priest was fitting for us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and has become higher than the heavens;
verse	58	7	27	who does not need daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for His own sins and then for the people's, because this He did once when He offered up Himself.
verse	58	7	28	Because, the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness, but the word of the oath, which came after the law, appoints the Son who is consecrated forever.
verse	58	8	1	Now this is the summary of the things we are saying: We have such a High Priest, who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,
verse	58	8	2	a Minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord set up, and not man.
verse	58	8	3	Because, every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this Man also have something to offer.
verse	58	8	4	Because, if He were on earth, He would not be a priest, since there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law;
verse	58	8	5	who serve the copy and shadow of the heavenly things, as Moses was admonished by God, when he was about to make the tabernacle. Because, He said, "See that you make all things according to the pattern shown you on the mountain."
verse	58	8	6	But now He has obtained a more excellent ministry, inasmuch as He is also Mediator of a better covenant, which was established on better promises.
verse	58	8	7	Because, if that first covenant had been faultless, then no place would have been sought for a second.
verse	58	8	8	Because, finding fault with them, He says: "Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah,
verse	58	8	9	not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they did not continue in My covenant, and I disregarded them, says the LORD."
verse	58	8	10	Because, this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the LORD: I will put My laws in their mind and write them on their hearts; and I will be to them a God, and they will be to Me a people.
verse	58	8	11	None of them will teach his neighbor, and none his brother, saying, 'Know the LORD,' because all will know Me, from the least of them to the greatest.
verse	58	8	12	Because, I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities I will remember no more."
verse	58	8	13	In that He says, "A new covenant," He has made the first obsolete. Now that which has become obsolete and has become old is ready to vanish away.
verse	58	9	1	Then indeed, even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service and the earthly sanctuary.
verse	58	9	2	Because, a tabernacle was prepared: the first part, in which was the lampstand, the table, and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary;
verse	58	9	3	and behind the second veil, the part of the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of All,
verse	58	9	4	which had the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which were the golden pot that had the manna, Aaron's rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant;
verse	58	9	5	and above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Of these things we cannot now speak in detail.
verse	58	9	6	Now when these things had been prepared like this, the priests always went into the first part of the tabernacle, performing the services of God.
verse	58	9	7	But into the second part the high priest went alone once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the errors of the people;
verse	58	9	8	the Holy Spirit indicating this, that the way into the Holiest of All was not yet made manifest while the first tabernacle was still standing.
verse	58	9	9	Which was symbolic for the present time in which both gifts and sacrifices are offered which could not make him who performed the service perfect in regard to the conscience;
verse	58	9	10	concerned only with foods and drinks, various washings, and fleshly ordinances imposed on them until the time of reformation.
verse	58	9	11	But Christ came as High Priest of the good things to come, with the greater and more perfect tabernacle not made with hands, that is, not of this creation.
verse	58	9	12	Not with the blood of goats and calves, but with His own blood He entered into the Most Holy Place once, having obtained eternal redemption for us.
verse	58	9	13	Because, if the blood of bulls and goats and the ashes of a heifer, sprinkling the unclean, sanctifies for the purifying of the flesh,
verse	58	9	14	how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself without spot to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
verse	58	9	15	And for this reason He is the Mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, that those who are called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.
verse	58	9	16	Because, where there is a testament, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.
verse	58	9	17	Because, a testament is in force after men are dead, since it has no force at all while the testator lives.
verse	58	9	18	Therefore not even the first testament was dedicated without blood.
verse	58	9	19	Because, when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and goats, with water, scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people,
verse	58	9	20	saying, "This is the blood of the testament which God has commanded you."
verse	58	9	21	Then likewise he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry.
verse	58	9	22	And according to the law almost all things are purified with blood, and without shedding of blood there is no remission.
verse	58	9	23	Therefore it was necessary that the pattern of the things in the heavens should be purified with these, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
verse	58	9	24	Because, Christ has not entered the holy places made with hands, which are figures of the true, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us;
verse	58	9	25	not that He should offer Himself often, as the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood of another;
verse	58	9	26	He then would have had to suffer often since the foundation of the world; but now, once at the end of the ages, He has appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of Himself.
verse	58	9	27	And as it is appointed for men to die once, but after this the judgment,
verse	58	9	28	so Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many. To those who eagerly wait for Him, He will appear a second time, apart from sin, for salvation.
verse	58	10	1	Because the law, having a shadow of the good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those same sacrifices, which they offered continually year by year, make those who approach perfect.
verse	58	10	2	Because then would they not have ceased to be offered? Because, the worshipers, once purified, would have had no more consciousness of sins.
verse	58	10	3	But in those sacrifices there is again a reminder made for sins every year.
verse	58	10	4	Because it is not possible that the blood of bulls and goats could take away sins.
verse	58	10	5	Therefore, when He came into the world, He said: "Sacrifice and offering You did not desire, but a body You have prepared for Me.
verse	58	10	6	In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin You had no pleasure.
verse	58	10	7	Then I said, 'Behold, I have come (in the volume of the book it is written of Me) to do Your will, O God.'"
verse	58	10	8	Previously saying, "Sacrifice and offering, burnt offerings, and offerings for sin You did not desire, nor had pleasure in them" (which are offered according to the law),
verse	58	10	9	then He said, "Behold, I have come to do Your will, O God." He takes away the first that He may establish the second.
verse	58	10	10	By that will, we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
verse	58	10	11	And every priest stands ministering daily and offering repeatedly the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.
verse	58	10	12	But this Man, after He had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down at the right hand of God,
verse	58	10	13	from that time waiting until His enemies are made His footstool.
verse	58	10	14	Because by one offering He has perfected forever those who are sanctified.
verse	58	10	15	But the Holy Spirit also witnesses to us; because after that He had said beforehand,
verse	58	10	16	"This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, says the LORD: I will put My laws into their hearts, and in their minds I will write them,"
verse	58	10	17	"Their sins and their iniquities I will remember no more."
verse	58	10	18	Now where there is remission of these, there is no longer an offering for sin.
verse	58	10	19	Therefore, brethren, having boldness to enter the Holiest by the blood of Jesus,
verse	58	10	20	by a new and living way which He consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, His flesh,
verse	58	10	21	and having a High Priest over the house of God,
verse	58	10	22	let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water.
verse	58	10	23	Let us hold fast the confession of our faith without wavering, because He who promised is faithful.
verse	58	10	24	And let us consider one another in order to provoke love and good works,
verse	58	10	25	not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as is the manner of some, but exhorting one another, and so much the more as you see the Day approaching.
verse	58	10	26	Because, if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins,
verse	58	10	27	but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and fiery indignation which will devour the adversaries.
verse	58	10	28	Anyone who has rejected Moses' law died without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
verse	58	10	29	Of how much worse punishment, do you suppose, will he be thought worthy who has trampled the Son of God underfoot, counted the blood of the covenant by which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and insulted the Spirit of grace?
verse	58	10	30	Because, we know Him who said, "Vengeance is Mine, I will repay," says the Lord. And again, "The LORD will judge His people."
verse	58	10	31	It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verse	58	10	32	But recall the former days in which, after you were illuminated, you endured a great fight of afflictions:
verse	58	10	33	partly while you were made a spectacle both by reproaches and afflictions, and partly while you became companions of those who were so treated;
verse	58	10	34	because you had compassion on me in my chains, and joyfully accepted the plundering of your goods, knowing that you have a better and an enduring possession for yourselves in heaven.
verse	58	10	35	Therefore do not cast away your confidence, which has great reward.
verse	58	10	36	Because, you have need of endurance, so that after you have done the will of God, you may receive the promise:
verse	58	10	37	Because, "Yet a little while, and He who is coming will come and will not delay.
verse	58	10	38	Now the just will live by faith; but if anyone draws back, My soul will have no pleasure in him."
verse	58	10	39	But we are not of those who draw back to perdition, but of those who believe to the saving of the soul.
verse	58	11	1	Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
verse	58	11	2	Because by it the elders obtained a good testimony.
verse	58	11	3	Through faith we understand that the ages were framed by the word of God, so that the things which are seen were not made of things which are visible.
verse	58	11	4	By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts; and by it he being dead still speaks.
verse	58	11	5	By faith Enoch was taken away so that he did not see death, "and was not found, because God had taken him"; because before he was taken he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
verse	58	11	6	But without faith it is impossible to please Him, because, he who comes to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of those who diligently seek Him.
verse	58	11	7	By faith Noah, being warned by God of things not yet seen, moved with reverence, prepared an ark for the saving of his household, by which he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.
verse	58	11	8	By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to go out to the place which he would receive as an inheritance. And he went out, not knowing where he was going.
verse	58	11	9	By faith he dwelt in the land of promise as in a foreign country, dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise;
verse	58	11	10	because, he waited for the city which has foundations, whose builder and maker is God.
verse	58	11	11	By faith Sarah herself also received strength to conceive seed, and she bore a child when she was past the age, because she judged Him faithful who had promised.
verse	58	11	12	Therefore from one man, and him as good as dead, were born as many as the stars of the sky in multitude, innumerable as the sand which is by the seashore.
verse	58	11	13	These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off were persuaded of them, embraced them and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
verse	58	11	14	Because those who say such things declare plainly that they seek a homeland.
verse	58	11	15	And truly if they had called to mind that country from which they had come out, they would have had opportunity to return.
verse	58	11	16	But now they desire a better, that is, a heavenly country. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, because He has prepared a city for them.
verse	58	11	17	By faith Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac, and he who had received the promises offered up his only begotten son,
verse	58	11	18	of whom it was said, "In Isaac your seed will be called,"
verse	58	11	19	concluding that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead, from which he also received him in a figurative sense.
verse	58	11	20	By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.
verse	58	11	21	By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed both of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff.
verse	58	11	22	By faith Joseph, when he was dying, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel, and gave instructions concerning his bones.
verse	58	11	23	By faith Moses, when he was born, was hidden three months by his parents, because they saw he was a beautiful child; and they were not afraid of the king's command.
verse	58	11	24	By faith Moses, when he became of age, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter,
verse	58	11	25	choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God than to enjoy the passing pleasures of sin,
verse	58	11	26	esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt; because he looked to the reward.
verse	58	11	27	By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; because he endured as seeing Him who is invisible.
verse	58	11	28	Through faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, lest he who destroyed the firstborn should touch them.
verse	58	11	29	By faith they passed through the Red Sea as by dry land, whereas the Egyptians, attempting to do so, were drowned.
verse	58	11	30	By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they were encircled for seven days.
verse	58	11	31	By faith the harlot Rahab did not perish with those who did not believe, when she had received the spies with peace.
verse	58	11	32	And what more shall I say? Because, the time would fail me to tell of Gideon and Barak and Samson and Jephthah, also of David and Samuel and the prophets:
verse	58	11	33	who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
verse	58	11	34	quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, became valiant in battle, turned to flight the armies of the foreigners.
verse	58	11	35	Women received their dead raised to life again. Others were tortured, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection.
verse	58	11	36	And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yes, and of chains and imprisonment.
verse	58	11	37	They were stoned, they were sawn in two, were tempted, were slain with the sword. They wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins, being destitute, afflicted, tormented;
verse	58	11	38	of whom the world was not worthy. They wandered in deserts and in mountains, in dens and caves of the earth.
verse	58	11	39	And all these, having obtained a good testimony through faith, did not receive the promise,
verse	58	11	40	God having provided something better for us, that they should not be made perfect apart from us.
verse	58	12	1	Therefore seeing we also are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which so easily ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us,
verse	58	12	2	looking to Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith, who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross, despising the shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
verse	58	12	3	Because, consider Him who endured such hostility from sinners against Himself, lest you become weary and faint in your minds.
verse	58	12	4	You have not yet resisted to bloodshed, striving against sin.
verse	58	12	5	And you have forgotten the exhortation which speaks to you as to children: "My son, do not despise the chastening of the LORD, nor be discouraged when you are rebuked by Him;
verse	58	12	6	Because, whom the Lord loves He chastens, and scourges every son whom He receives."
verse	58	12	7	If you endure chastening, God deals with you as with sons; because what son is there whom a father does not chasten?
verse	58	12	8	But if you are without chastening, of which all have become partakers, then you are illegitimate and not sons.
verse	58	12	9	Furthermore, we have had human fathers who corrected us, and we gave them respect. Should we not much more readily be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live?
verse	58	12	10	Because, they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed best to them, but He for our profit, that we may be partakers of His holiness.
verse	58	12	11	Now no chastening seems to be joyful for the present, but painful; nevertheless, afterward it yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
verse	58	12	12	Therefore strengthen the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees,
verse	58	12	13	and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be turned out of the way, but rather let it be healed.
verse	58	12	14	Pursue peace with all people, and holiness, without which no one will see the Lord:
verse	58	12	15	looking diligently lest anyone fall short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up cause trouble, and by this many become defiled;
verse	58	12	16	lest there be any fornicator or profane person like Esau, who for one morsel of food sold his birthright.
verse	58	12	17	Because, you know that afterward, when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, because he found no place for repentance, though he sought it diligently with tears.
verse	58	12	18	Because, you have not come to the mountain that may be touched and that burned with fire, and to blackness and darkness and tempest,
verse	58	12	19	and the sound of a trumpet and the voice of words, which voice those who heard it begged that the word should not be spoken to them anymore.
verse	58	12	20	(Because, they could not endure what was commanded: "And if so much as a beast touches the mountain, it shall be stoned or shot with an arrow."
verse	58	12	21	And so terrifying was the sight that Moses said, "I am exceedingly afraid and trembling.")
verse	58	12	22	But you have come to Mount Zion and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, to an innumerable company of angels,
verse	58	12	23	to the general assembly and church of the firstborn who are written in heaven, to God the Judge of all, to the spirits of just men made perfect,
verse	58	12	24	to Jesus the Mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better things than that of Abel.
verse	58	12	25	See that you do not refuse Him who speaks. Because, if they did not escape who refused Him who spoke on earth, much more will we not escape if we turn away from Him who speaks from heaven,
verse	58	12	26	whose voice then shook the earth; but now He has promised, saying, "Yet once more I shake not only the earth, but also heaven."
verse	58	12	27	Now this phrase, "Yet once more," indicates the removal of those things that are being shaken, as of things that are made, that the things which cannot be shaken may remain.
verse	58	12	28	Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom which cannot be shaken, let us have grace, by which we may serve God acceptably with respect and godly reverence.
verse	58	12	29	Because our God is a consuming fire.
verse	58	13	1	Let brotherly love continue.
verse	58	13	2	Do not forget to entertain strangers, because by doing so some have unknowingly entertained angels.
verse	58	13	3	Remember the prisoners as if chained with them, and those who suffer adversity, since you yourselves are in the same body.
verse	58	13	4	Marriage is honorable among all, and the bed undefiled; but fornicators and adulterers God will judge.
verse	58	13	5	Let your conduct be without covetousness; and be content with such things as you have. Because He Himself has said, "I will never leave you nor forsake you."
verse	58	13	6	So that we may boldly say: "The LORD is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do to me!"
verse	58	13	7	Remember your leaders, who have spoken the word of God to you, whose faith follow, considering the outcome of their conduct.
verse	58	13	8	Jesus Christ, the same yesterday, today, and forever.
verse	58	13	9	Do not be carried about with various and strange doctrines. Because, it is good that the heart be established with grace, not with foods which have not profited those who have been occupied with them.
verse	58	13	10	We have an altar from which those who serve the tabernacle have no right to eat.
verse	58	13	11	Because, the bodies of those animals, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned outside the camp.
verse	58	13	12	Therefore Jesus also, that He might sanctify the people with His own blood, suffered outside the gate.
verse	58	13	13	Therefore let us go forth to Him, outside the camp, bearing His reproach.
verse	58	13	14	Because, here we have no continuing city, but we seek the one to come.
verse	58	13	15	Therefore by Him let us continually offer the sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of our lips, giving thanks to His name.
verse	58	13	16	But do not forget to do good and to share, because with such sacrifices God is well pleased.
verse	58	13	17	Obey those who lead you, and be submissive, because they watch out for your souls, as those who must give account. Let them do so with joy and not with grief, because that is unprofitable for you.
verse	58	13	18	Pray for us; because, we are confident that we have a good conscience in all things, desiring to live honorably.
verse	58	13	19	But I especially urge you to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.
verse	58	13	20	Now may the God of peace who brought up our Lord Jesus from the dead, that great Shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,
verse	58	13	21	make you complete in every good work to do His will, working in you what is well pleasing in His sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verse	58	13	22	And I urge you, brethren, bear with the word of exhortation, because I have written to you in few words.
verse	58	13	23	Know that our brother Timothy has been set free, with whom I shall see you if he comes shortly.
verse	58	13	24	Greet all those who rule over you, and all the saints. Those from Italy greet you.
verse	58	13	25	Grace be with you all. Amen.
verse	59	1	1	James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad: Greetings.
verse	59	1	2	My brethren, count it all joy when you fall into various trials,
verse	59	1	3	knowing this, that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.
verse	59	1	4	But let perseverance have her perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking nothing.
verse	59	1	5	If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all people liberally and without reproach, and it will be given to him.
verse	59	1	6	But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering, because, he who wavers is like a wave of the sea driven and tossed by the wind.
verse	59	1	7	Because, do not let that man think that he will receive anything from the Lord;
verse	59	1	8	a double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
verse	59	1	9	Let the lowly brother rejoice in his exaltation,
verse	59	1	10	but the rich in his humiliation, because as a flower of the field he will pass away.
verse	59	1	11	Because, no sooner has the sun risen with a burning heat than it withers the grass; its flower falls, and its beautiful appearance perishes. So the rich man likewise will fade away in his ways.
verse	59	1	12	Blessed is the man who endures temptation; because, when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life which the Lord has promised to those who love Him.
verse	59	1	13	Let no one say when he is tempted, "I am tempted by God"; because, God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does He tempt anyone.
verse	59	1	14	But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust and enticed.
verse	59	1	15	Then, when lust has conceived, it brings forth sin; and sin, when it is finished, brings forth death.
verse	59	1	16	Do not be deceived, my beloved brethren.
verse	59	1	17	Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow of turning.
verse	59	1	18	Of His own will He begot us by the word of truth, that we might be a type of firstfruits of His creatures.
verse	59	1	19	So then, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath;
verse	59	1	20	because, the wrath of man does not produce the righteousness of God.
verse	59	1	21	Therefore lay aside all filthiness and overflow of wickedness, and receive with meekness the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.
verse	59	1	22	But be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves.
verse	59	1	23	because, if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man observing his natural face in a mirror;
verse	59	1	24	because, he observes himself, goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.
verse	59	1	25	But he who looks into the perfect law of liberty and continues in it, and is not a forgetful hearer but a doer of the work, this one will be blessed in what he does.
verse	59	1	26	If anyone among you seems to be religious, and does not bridle his tongue but deceives his own heart, this one's religion is vain.
verse	59	1	27	Pure and undefiled religion before God and the Father is this: to visit orphans and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unspotted from the world.
verse	59	2	1	My brethren, do not hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with personal favoritism.
verse	59	2	2	Because, if there should come into your assembly a man with a gold ring, in fine apparel, and there should also come in a poor man in filthy clothes,
verse	59	2	3	and you have respect to the one wearing the fine clothes and say to him, "You sit here in a good place," and say to the poor person, "You stand there," or, "Sit here at my footstool,"
verse	59	2	4	have you not shown personal favoritism among yourselves, and have become judges with evil thoughts?
verse	59	2	5	Listen, my beloved brethren: Has not God also chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which He promised to those who love Him?
verse	59	2	6	But you have despised the poor. Do not also the rich oppress you and drag you before the courts?
verse	59	2	7	Do they not blaspheme that worthy name by which you are called?
verse	59	2	8	If you fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," you do well;
verse	59	2	9	but if you show personal favoritism, you commit sin, and are convicted by the law as transgressors.
verse	59	2	10	Because, whoever shall keep the entire law, and yet stumble in one point, he is guilty of all.
verse	59	2	11	Because, He who said, "Do not commit adultery," also said, "Do not murder." Now if you do not commit adultery, but you do murder, you have become a transgressor of the law.
verse	59	2	12	So speak and so do as those who will be judged by the law of liberty.
verse	59	2	13	Because, judgment is without mercy to the one who has shown no mercy. And mercy triumphs over judgment.
verse	59	2	14	What does it profit, my brethren, if someone says he has faith but does not have works? Can faith save him?
verse	59	2	15	If a brother or sister is naked and destitute of daily food,
verse	59	2	16	and one of you says to them, "Depart in peace, be warmed and filled," but you do not give them the things which are needed for the body, what does it profit?
verse	59	2	17	So likewise faith by itself, if it does not have works, is dead.
verse	59	2	18	Yes, someone may say, "You have faith, and I have works." Show me your faith without your works, and I will show you my faith by my works.
verse	59	2	19	You believe that there is one God. You do well. Even the demons believe, and tremble!
verse	59	2	20	But do you want to know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?
verse	59	2	21	Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
verse	59	2	22	Do you see that faith was working together with his works, and by works faith was made perfect?
verse	59	2	23	And the Scripture was fulfilled which says, "Abraham believed God, and it was imputed to him for righteousness." And he was called the Friend of God.
verse	59	2	24	You see then how that a man is justified by works, and not by faith only.
verse	59	2	25	Likewise, was not Rahab the harlot also justified by works when she received the messengers and sent them out another way?
verse	59	2	26	Because, as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.
verse	59	3	1	My brethren, do not let many of you be teachers, knowing that we will receive a stricter judgment.
verse	59	3	2	Because, we all offend in many things. If anyone does not offend in word, he is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.
verse	59	3	3	Behold, we put bits in horses' mouths that they may obey us, and we turn their entire body.
verse	59	3	4	Look also at ships: although they are so large and are driven by fierce winds, yet they are turned about by a very small rudder wherever the pilot desires.
verse	59	3	5	Even so the tongue is a little member and boasts great things. See how large an object a little fire kindles!
verse	59	3	6	And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity. The tongue is so set among our members that it defiles the entire body, and sets on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire by hell.
verse	59	3	7	Because, every kind of beast and bird, of reptile and things in the sea, is tamed and has been tamed by mankind.
verse	59	3	8	But no man can tame the tongue. It is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.
verse	59	3	9	With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men, who have been made in the similitude of God.
verse	59	3	10	Out of the same mouth proceed blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not to be so.
verse	59	3	11	Does a spring send forth fresh water and bitter from the same opening?
verse	59	3	12	Can a fig tree, my brethren, bear olives, or a grapevine bear figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh.
verse	59	3	13	Who is wise and knowledgeable among you? Let him show by good conduct that his works are done in the meekness of wisdom.
verse	59	3	14	But if you have bitter envy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast and lie against the truth.
verse	59	3	15	This wisdom does not descend from above, but is earthly, sensual, demonic.
verse	59	3	16	Because, where envy and selfish ambition exist, confusion and every evil thing are there.
verse	59	3	17	But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and willing to yield, full of mercy and good fruits, without personal favoritism and without hypocrisy.
verse	59	3	18	And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.
verse	59	4	1	Where do wars and fights come from among you? Do they not come from your lust for pleasure that war in your members?
verse	59	4	2	You lust and do not have. You murder and covet and cannot obtain. You fight and war. Yet you do not have because you do not ask.
verse	59	4	3	You ask and do not receive, because you ask amiss, that you may spend it on your pleasures.
verse	59	4	4	You adulterers and adulteresses! Do you not know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
verse	59	4	5	Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, "The Spirit who dwells in us yearns jealously"?
verse	59	4	6	But He gives more grace. Therefore He says: "God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble."
verse	59	4	7	Therefore submit to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you.
verse	59	4	8	Draw near to God and He will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double minded.
verse	59	4	9	Lament and mourn and weep! Let your laughter be turned to mourning and your joy to gloom.
verse	59	4	10	Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up.
verse	59	4	11	Do not speak evil of one another, brethren. He who speaks evil of his brother and judges his brother, speaks evil of the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge.
verse	59	4	12	There is one Lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. Who are you to judge another?
verse	59	4	13	Come now, you who say, "Today or tomorrow we will go to such and such a city, spend a year there, buy and sell, and make a profit";
verse	59	4	14	whereas you do not know what will happen tomorrow. Because what is your life? It is even a vapor that appears for a little time and then vanishes away.
verse	59	4	15	Instead you ought to say, "If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that."
verse	59	4	16	But now you boast in your arrogance. All such boasting is evil.
verse	59	4	17	Therefore, to him who knows to do good and does not do it, to him it is sin.
verse	59	5	1	Come now, you rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that will come upon you!
verse	59	5	2	Your riches are corrupted, and your clothes are moth eaten.
verse	59	5	3	Your gold and silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be a witness against you and will eat your flesh like it was fire. You have heaped up treasure in the last days.
verse	59	5	4	Behold, the wages of the laborers who harvested your fields, which you kept back by fraud, cries out; and the outcry of the reapers have reached the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth.
verse	59	5	5	You have lived on the earth in pleasure and luxury; you have fattened your hearts as in a day of slaughter.
verse	59	5	6	You have condemned and murdered the just; and he does not resist you.
verse	59	5	7	Therefore be patient, brethren, until the coming of the Lord. See how the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, and waits patiently for it until he receives the early and latter rain.
verse	59	5	8	You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord draws near.
verse	59	5	9	Do not hold a grudge against one another, brethren, lest you be condemned. Behold, the Judge is standing at the door!
verse	59	5	10	My brethren, take the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, as an example of suffering affliction and of patience.
verse	59	5	11	Behold, we count them blessed who endure. You have heard of the perseverance of Job and seen the end intended by the Lord, that the Lord is very compassionate and merciful.
verse	59	5	12	But above all, my brethren, do not swear, either by heaven or by earth or with any other oath. But let your "Yes" be "Yes," and your "No," "No," lest you fall into condemnation.
verse	59	5	13	Is anyone among you afflicted? Let him pray. Is anyone cheerful? Let him sing psalms.
verse	59	5	14	Is anyone among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the church, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord.
verse	59	5	15	And the prayer of faith will save the sick, and the Lord will raise him up. And if he has committed sins, he will be forgiven.
verse	59	5	16	Confess your faults to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much.
verse	59	5	17	Elijah was a man subject to passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it would not rain; and it did not rain on the land for three years and six months.
verse	59	5	18	And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth produced her fruit.
verse	59	5	19	Brethren, if any of you wanders from the truth, and someone converts him
verse	59	5	20	let him know that he who converts a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and cover a multitude of sins.
verse	60	1	1	Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the pilgrims scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
verse	60	1	2	elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit to obedience, and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace be multiplied.
verse	60	1	3	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a living hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
verse	60	1	4	to an inheritance incorruptible, undefiled, and that does not fade away, reserved in heaven for you,
verse	60	1	5	who are kept by the power of God through faith for salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
verse	60	1	6	In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, you are in heaviness through various trials,
verse	60	1	7	that the genuineness of your faith, being much more precious than gold that perishes, though it be tested by fire, may be found to praise, honor, and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ,
verse	60	1	8	whom having not seen, you love. In whom, though now you do not see Him, yet believing, you rejoice with unspeakable joy, and full of glory,
verse	60	1	9	receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.
verse	60	1	10	Of this salvation, the prophets inquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of this grace that would come to you;
verse	60	1	11	searching for what, or which particular time, the Spirit of Christ who was in them signified when He testified beforehand of the sufferings of Christ and the glory that would follow.
verse	60	1	12	To them it was revealed that, not to themselves, but to us they ministered the things that are now reported to you by those who have preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent down from heaven, things which the angels desire to look into.
verse	60	1	13	Therefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope until the end for the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;
verse	60	1	14	as obedient children, not conforming yourselves according to the former lusts, as in your ignorance,
verse	60	1	15	but just as He who has called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct,
verse	60	1	16	because it is written, "Be holy, because I am holy."
verse	60	1	17	And if you call on the Father, who without personal favoritism judges according to each one's work, pass the time of your pilgrimage here in reverence;
verse	60	1	18	knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, like silver or gold, from your vain conduct received by tradition from your fathers,
verse	60	1	19	but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.
verse	60	1	20	He indeed was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you
verse	60	1	21	who now by Him believe in God, who raised Him up from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope might be in God.
verse	60	1	22	Seeing you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit in sincere love of the brethren, see that you love one another fervently with a pure heart,
verse	60	1	23	having been born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God which lives and abides forever.
verse	60	1	24	because, "All flesh is like grass, and all the glory of man like the flower of the grass. The grass withers, and its flower falls away,
verse	60	1	25	but the word of the LORD endures forever." Now this is the word which by the gospel is preached to you.
verse	60	2	1	Therefore laying aside all malice, all deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking,
verse	60	2	2	as newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the word, that you may grow thereby,
verse	60	2	3	if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is gracious.
verse	60	2	4	Coming to Him as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen by God and precious,
verse	60	2	5	you also, as living stones, are built up as a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.
verse	60	2	6	Therefore it is also contained in the scripture, "Behold, I lay in Zion a chief cornerstone, elect, precious, and he who believes on Him will not be put to shame."
verse	60	2	7	Therefore, to you who believe, He is precious; but to those who are disobedient, "The stone which the builders rejected, has become the head cornerstone,"
verse	60	2	8	and "A stone of stumbling and a rock of offense," which is to those who stumble at the word, being disobedient, to which they are also appointed.
verse	60	2	9	But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a special people, that you may proclaim the praises of Him who has called you out of darkness into His marvelous light;
verse	60	2	10	who once were not a people, but are now the people of God, who had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.
verse	60	2	11	Beloved, I urge you as foreigners and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul,
verse	60	2	12	having your conduct honorable among the Gentiles, that while they speak against you as evildoers, they may, by your good works which they observe, glorify God in the day of visitation.
verse	60	2	13	Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake, whether it be to the king as supreme,
verse	60	2	14	or to governors, as to those who are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and for the praise of those who do good.
verse	60	2	15	Because, this is the will of God, that by doing good you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men,
verse	60	2	16	as free, yet not using your liberty as a cover for maliciousness, but as the servants of God.
verse	60	2	17	Honor all people. Love the brotherhood. Reverence God. Honor the king.
verse	60	2	18	Servants, be submissive to your masters with all reverence, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the harsh.
verse	60	2	19	Because, this is admirable, if because of conscience toward God a person endures grief, suffering wrongfully.
verse	60	2	20	Because, what glory is it if, when you are punished for your faults, you take it patiently? But when you do good and suffer for it, if you take it patiently, this is acceptable before God.
verse	60	2	21	Because, to this were you called, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps:
verse	60	2	22	"Who did no sin, nor was deceit found in His mouth";
verse	60	2	23	who, when He was reviled, did not revile in return; when He suffered, He did not threaten, but committed Himself to Him who judges righteously;
verse	60	2	24	who Himself bore our sins in His own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live for righteousness, by whose stripes you were healed.
verse	60	2	25	Because, you were like sheep going astray, but have now returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.
verse	60	3	1	Likewise, wives, be in subjection to your own husbands, so that if any do not obey the word, they also without the word may be won by the conduct of their wives,
verse	60	3	2	when they observe your chaste conduct accompanied with reverence.
verse	60	3	3	Do not let your adornment be only an outward appearance, arranging the hair, wearing gold, or putting on of clothes,
verse	60	3	4	but let it be the hidden person of the heart, with that which is incorruptible, even the adornment of a meek and quiet spirit, which is of great value in the sight of God.
verse	60	3	5	Because, in this manner, in old times, the holy women who trusted in God also adorned themselves, being in submission to their own husbands,
verse	60	3	6	just as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord, whose daughters you are if you do good and are not afraid with any terror.
verse	60	3	7	Husbands, likewise, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honor to the wife, as to the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life, that your prayers may not be hindered.
verse	60	3	8	Finally, all of you be of one mind, having compassion for one another; love as brethren, be tenderhearted, be courteous;
verse	60	3	9	not returning evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary blessing, knowing that you are called to this, that you should inherit a blessing.
verse	60	3	10	Because, "He who would love life and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips from speaking deceit.
verse	60	3	11	Let him turn away from evil, and do good; let him seek peace and pursue it.
verse	60	3	12	Because, the eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, and His ears are open to their prayers; but the face of the LORD is against those who do evil."
verse	60	3	13	And who is he who will harm you if you be followers of that which is good?
verse	60	3	14	But even if you suffer for righteousness' sake, you are blessed. "And do not be afraid of their threats, nor be troubled."
verse	60	3	15	But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and reverence;
verse	60	3	16	having a good conscience, that when they defame you as evildoers, those who falsely accuse your good conduct in Christ may be ashamed.
verse	60	3	17	Because, it is better, if it is the will of God, that you suffer for doing good than for doing evil.
verse	60	3	18	Because, Christ also suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust, that He might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh but made alive by the Spirit,
verse	60	3	19	by whom also He went and preached to the spirits in prison,
verse	60	3	20	who formerly were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight souls, were saved by water.
verse	60	3	21	This is also figurative of that which also now saves us, even baptism (not the removal of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God), by the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verse	60	3	22	who has gone into heaven and is on the right hand of God, angels and authorities and powers having been made subject to Him.
verse	60	4	1	Therefore, since Christ suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind, because, he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,
verse	60	4	2	that he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh for the lusts of men, but for the will of God.
verse	60	4	3	Because, we spent enough of our former life in doing the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lustfulness, desires, drunkenness, partying, drinking parties, and abominable idolatries,
verse	60	4	4	in concerning these things they think it is strange that you do not run with them in the same excessive wastefulness, speaking evil of you,
verse	60	4	5	who will give an account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
verse	60	4	6	Because, for this reason was the gospel also preached to those who are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.
verse	60	4	7	But the end of all things is at hand; therefore be sober and watchful in prayer.
verse	60	4	8	And above all things have fervent love among yourselves, because "love will cover the multitude of sins."
verse	60	4	9	Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.
verse	60	4	10	As each one has received the gift, even so also minister the same to one another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.
verse	60	4	11	If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of God. If anyone ministers, let him do it as with the ability which God gives, that in all things God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be the praise and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verse	60	4	12	Beloved, do not think it strange concerning the fiery trial which is to test you, as though some strange thing happened to you;
verse	60	4	13	but rejoice to the degree that you participate in Christ's sufferings, that when His glory will be revealed , you may also be glad with exceeding joy.
verse	60	4	14	If you are reproached for the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you. On their part He is blasphemed, but on your part He is glorified.
verse	60	4	15	But let none of you suffer as a murderer, as a thief, as an evildoer, or as a busybody in other people's matters.
verse	60	4	16	Yet if anyone suffers as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God in this matter.
verse	60	4	17	Because, the time has come that judgment must begin at the house of God; and if it begins with us first, what will be the end of those who do not obey the gospel of God?
verse	60	4	18	Now "if the righteous are scarcely saved, where will the ungodly and the sinner appear?"
verse	60	4	19	Therefore let those who suffer according to the will of God commit the preservation of their souls to Him in doing good, as to a faithful Creator.
verse	60	5	1	The elders who are among you I exhort, who am also an elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that will be revealed:
verse	60	5	2	Feed the flock of God which is among you, serving as overseers, not by obligation but willingly, not for dishonest gain, but with an eager mind;
verse	60	5	3	nor as being lords over God's heritage, but being examples to the flock;
verse	60	5	4	and when the Chief Shepherd will appear, you will receive a crown of glory that does not fade away.
verse	60	5	5	Likewise you younger ones, submit yourselves to the elders. Yes, all of you be submissive to one another, and be clothed with humility, because, "God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble."
verse	60	5	6	Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time,
verse	60	5	7	casting all your burdens upon Him, because He cares for you.
verse	60	5	8	Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.
verse	60	5	9	Resist him steadfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are experienced by your brethren who are in the world.
verse	60	5	10	But may the God of all grace, who has called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after you have suffered a while, perfect, establish, strengthen, and settle you.
verse	60	5	11	To Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verse	60	5	12	By Silvanus, a faithful brother to you as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.
verse	60	5	13	The church who is in Babylon, elect together with you, greets you; and so does Mark my son.
verse	60	5	14	Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace be to you all who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verse	61	1	1	Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God even our Savior Jesus Christ:
verse	61	1	2	Grace and peace be multiplied to you through the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord,
verse	61	1	3	in the same way as His divine power has given to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of Him who has called us to glory and virtue,
verse	61	1	4	by which are given to us exceedingly great and precious promises, that by these you might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.
verse	61	1	5	And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue, and to virtue knowledge,
verse	61	1	6	and to knowledge self control, and to self control perseverance, and to perseverance godliness,
verse	61	1	7	And to godliness brotherly kindness, and to brotherly kindness love.
verse	61	1	8	Because, if these things are in you and abound, they make you that you will be neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse	61	1	9	But he who lacks these things is short sighted and blind, and has forgotten that he was cleansed from his old sins.
verse	61	1	10	Therefore instead brethren, be diligent to make your calling and election certain, because if you do these things you will never fall;
verse	61	1	11	because, then an entrance will be provided for you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
verse	61	1	12	Therefore I will not be negligent to constantly remind you of these things, though you know them and are established in the present truth.
verse	61	1	13	Yes, I think it is right, as long as I am in this tent, to stir you up by reminding you,
verse	61	1	14	knowing that shortly I must put off my tent, just as our Lord Jesus Christ has shown me.
verse	61	1	15	Moreover I will endeavor that after my decease you may be able to have these things in remembrance.
verse	61	1	16	Because, we did not follow cunningly devised fables when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of His majesty.
verse	61	1	17	Because, He received from God the Father honor and glory when a voice came to Him from the Excellent Glory: "This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."
verse	61	1	18	And we heard this voice which came from heaven when we were with Him on the holy mountain.
verse	61	1	19	We also have an additional confirmed word of prophecy, which you do well to observe as a light that shines in a dark place, until the day dawns and the day star rises in your hearts;
verse	61	1	20	knowing this first, that no prophecy of Scripture is of any private interpretation.
verse	61	1	21	because, the prophecy in old times did not come by the will of man, but holy men of God spoke as they were moved by the Holy Spirit.
verse	61	2	1	But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord who bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.
verse	61	2	2	And many will follow their destructive ways, because of whom the way of truth will be blasphemed.
verse	61	2	3	And through covetousness they will exploit you with deceptive words for profit; for a long time their judgment has not been idle, and their damnation does not slumber.
verse	61	2	4	Because, if God did not spare the angels who sinned, but cast them down to hell and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be reserved for judgment;
verse	61	2	5	and did not spare the old world, but saved Noah one of eight people, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;
verse	61	2	6	and turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them with destruction, making them an example to those who afterward would live ungodly;
verse	61	2	7	and delivered righteous Lot, who was oppressed with the filthy conduct of the wicked
verse	61	2	8	(because, that righteous man, dwelling among them, tormented his righteous soul from day to day by seeing and hearing their lawless deeds).
verse	61	2	9	The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations and to reserve the unjust for the day of judgment to be punished,
verse	61	2	10	but especially those who walk according to the flesh in the lust of uncleanness and despise authority. They are presumptuous, self willed, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignitaries,
verse	61	2	11	whereas angels, who are greater in power and might, do not bring a reviling accusation against them before the Lord.
verse	61	2	12	But these, like natural brute beasts, made to be captured and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they do not understand, and will utterly perish in their own corruption,
verse	61	2	13	and will receive the wages of unrighteousness, as those who count it pleasure to indulge in the daytime. They are spots and blemishes, delighting themselves with their own deceptions while they feast with you,
verse	61	2	14	having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin, enticing unstable souls. They have a heart trained with covetous practices, and are cursed children.
verse	61	2	15	They have forsaken the right way and have gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;
verse	61	2	16	but was rebuked for his iniquity: the mute donkey speaking with a man's voice restrained the madness of the prophet.
verse	61	2	17	These are wells without water, clouds that are carried by a tempest, for whom is reserved the blackness of darkness forever.
verse	61	2	18	Because, when they speak great swelling words of emptiness, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through unrestrained lusts, those who had completely escaped from those who live in error.
verse	61	2	19	While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption; because by whom a person is overcome, by him also is he brought in bondage.
verse	61	2	20	Because if, after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in them and overcome, the latter end is worse for them than the beginning.
verse	61	2	21	because, it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than after having known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered to them.
verse	61	2	22	But it has happened to them according to the true proverb: "The dog returned to his own vomit again," and, "a sow, having washed, to her wallowing in the mire."
verse	61	3	1	Beloved, I now write to you this second epistle, in both which I stir up your pure minds by the method of remembrance,
verse	61	3	2	that you may be mindful of the words which were spoken beforehand by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of us, the apostles of the Lord and Savior,
verse	61	3	3	knowing this first, that scoffers will come in the last days, walking according to their own lusts,
verse	61	3	4	and saying, "Where is the promise of His coming? Because, since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of creation."
verse	61	3	5	Because, they are willfully ignorant of this: that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of water and in the water,
verse	61	3	6	by which the world that then existed perished, being flooded with water.
verse	61	3	7	But the heavens and the earth which are now preserved by the same word, are reserved for fire until the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.
verse	61	3	8	But, beloved, do not be ignorant of this one thing, that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
verse	61	3	9	The Lord is not slack concerning His promise, as some count slackness, but is longsuffering toward us, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance.
verse	61	3	10	But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night, in which the heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will melt with fervent heat; both the earth and the works that are in it will be burned up.
verse	61	3	11	Seeing then that all these things will be dissolved, what manner of persons ought you to be in all holy conduct and godliness,
verse	61	3	12	looking for and hastening to the coming of the day of God, in which the heavens will be dissolved, being on fire, and the elements will melt with fervent heat?
verse	61	3	13	Nevertheless we, according to His promise, look for new heavens and a new earth in which righteousness dwells.
verse	61	3	14	Therefore, beloved, seeing that you look for such things, be diligent to be found by Him in peace, without spot and blameless;
verse	61	3	15	and consider that the longsuffering of our Lord is salvation, just as also our beloved brother Paul, according to the wisdom given to him, has written to you,
verse	61	3	16	as also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things, in which are some things which are hard to understand, which unlearned and unstable people twist, as they do also the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.
verse	61	3	17	You therefore, beloved, since you know this beforehand, beware lest you also fall from your own steadfastness, being led away with the error of the wicked;
verse	61	3	18	but grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be glory both now and forever. Amen.
verse	62	1	1	That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, concerning the Word of life;
verse	62	1	2	(because, the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and show to you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested to us:)
verse	62	1	3	that which we have seen and heard we declare to you, that you also may have fellowship with us; and truly our fellowship is with the Father and with His Son Jesus Christ.
verse	62	1	4	And these things we write to you that your joy may be full.
verse	62	1	5	This then is the message which we have heard from Him and declare to you, that God is light and in Him is no darkness at all.
verse	62	1	6	If we say that we have fellowship with Him, and walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth.
verse	62	1	7	But if we walk in the light as He is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
verse	62	1	8	If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.
verse	62	1	9	If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
verse	62	1	10	If we say that we have not sinned, we make Him a liar, and His word is not in us.
verse	62	2	1	My little children, these things I write to you, so that you do not sin. And if anyone sins, we have an Advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous.
verse	62	2	2	And He is the propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only but also for the sins of the entire world.
verse	62	2	3	Now by this we know that we know Him, if we keep His commandments.
verse	62	2	4	He who says, "I know Him," and does not keep His commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.
verse	62	2	5	But whoever keeps His word, truly the love of God is perfected in him. By this we know that we are in Him.
verse	62	2	6	He who says he abides in Him should also himself so walk just as He walked.
verse	62	2	7	Brethren, I write no new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you have had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you heard from the beginning.
verse	62	2	8	Again, a new commandment I write to you, which thing is true in Him and in you, because the darkness has passed away, and the true light now shines.
verse	62	2	9	He who says he is in the light, and hates his brother, is in darkness until now.
verse	62	2	10	He who loves his brother abides in the light, and there is no cause for stumbling in him.
verse	62	2	11	But he who hates his brother is in darkness, and walks in darkness, and does not know where he is going, because that darkness has blinded his eyes.
verse	62	2	12	I write to you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for His name's sake.
verse	62	2	13	I write to you, fathers, because you have known Him who is from the beginning. I write to you, young men, because you have overcome the wicked one. I write to you, little children, because you have known the Father.
verse	62	2	14	I have written to you, fathers, because you have known Him who is from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abides in you, and you have overcome the wicked one.
verse	62	2	15	Do not love the world or the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him.
verse	62	2	16	Because, everything that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.
verse	62	2	17	And the world is passing away, and the lust of it; but he who does the will of God abides forever.
verse	62	2	18	Little children, it is the last time; and as you have heard the Antichrist is coming, even now there are many antichrists, by whom we know that it is the last time.
verse	62	2	19	They went out from us, but they were not of us; because, if they had been of us, no doubt they would have continued with us ; but they went out that they might be made manifest, that they were not all of us.
verse	62	2	20	But you have an anointing from the Holy One, and you know all things.
verse	62	2	21	I have not written to you because you do not know the truth, but because you know it, and that no lie is of the truth.
verse	62	2	22	Who is a liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? He is antichrist who denies the Father and the Son.
verse	62	2	23	Whoever denies the Son, the same does not have the Father: but he who acknowledges the Son has the Father also.
verse	62	2	24	Therefore let that abide in you which you have heard from the beginning. If what you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will continue in the Son and in the Father.
verse	62	2	25	And this is the promise that He has promised us, even eternal life.
verse	62	2	26	These things I have written to you concerning those who seduce you.
verse	62	2	27	But the anointing which you have received from Him abides in you, and you do not need that anyone teach you; but as the same anointing teaches you concerning all things, and is true, and is not a lie, and just as it has taught you, you shall abide in Him.
verse	62	2	28	And now, little children, abide in Him; that when He appears, we may have confidence and not be ashamed before Him at His coming.
verse	62	2	29	If you know that He is righteous, you know that everyone who practices righteousness is born of Him.
verse	62	3	1	Behold what manner of love the Father has given to us, that we should be called the sons of God! Therefore the world does not know us, because it did not know Him.
verse	62	3	2	Beloved, now we are the sons of God, and it has not yet been revealed what we will be, but we know that when He appears, we will be like Him, because we will see Him as He is.
verse	62	3	3	And everyone who has this hope in Him purifies himself, just as He is pure.
verse	62	3	4	Whoever commits sin also transgresses the law, because sin is the transgression of the law.
verse	62	3	5	And you know that He was manifested to take away our sins, and in Him is no sin.
verse	62	3	6	Whoever abides in Him does not sin. Whoever sins has neither seen Him nor known Him.
verse	62	3	7	Little children, let no one deceive you. He who does righteousness is righteous, just as He is righteous.
verse	62	3	8	He who commits sin is of the devil, because the devil has sinned from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that He might destroy the works of the devil.
verse	62	3	9	Whoever is born of God does not commit sin, because, His seed remains in him; and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.
verse	62	3	10	In this the children of God and the children of the devil are revealed: whosoever does not practice righteousness is not of God, nor he who does not love his brother.
verse	62	3	11	Because, this is the message that you heard from the beginning, that we should love one another,
verse	62	3	12	not as Cain who was of that wicked one and murdered his brother. And why did he kill him? Because his own works were evil and his brother's righteous.
verse	62	3	13	Do not marvel, my brethren, if the world hates you.
verse	62	3	14	We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren. He who does not love his brother abides in death.
verse	62	3	15	Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.
verse	62	3	16	By this we perceive the love of God, because He laid down His life for us. And we also should lay down our lives for the brethren.
verse	62	3	17	But whoever has this world's goods, and sees his brother in need, and shuts up his heart of compassion from him, how does the love of God abide in him?
verse	62	3	18	My little children, let us not love in word or in tongue, but in deed and in truth.
verse	62	3	19	And by this we know that we are of the truth, and will assure our hearts before Him.
verse	62	3	20	Because, if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.
verse	62	3	21	Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, then have we confidence toward God.
verse	62	3	22	And whatever we ask we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and do those things that are pleasing in His sight.
verse	62	3	23	And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as He gave us commandment.
verse	62	3	24	Now he who keeps His commandments abides in Him, and He in him. And by this we know that He abides in us, by the Spirit whom He has given us.
verse	62	4	1	Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits whether they are of God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
verse	62	4	2	By this you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ came in the flesh is of God,
